Name: A cupful of Aha
Description: The author is possibly the only double PhD (one in Applied Psychology, the other in Comparative Tribal Music) who has spent multiple stints in several rehabilitation centres for problems ranging from drug abuse, mental breakdown, and schizophrenia. He then spent 8 years roaming the remote regions of the Himalayas - living with goatherds and monks, and often going several months with not a word spoken. At ease with Prime Ministers and commoners alike; he has the unique ability to predict key events of your future just by looking at a photograph of your little finger. PS: None of the above is true. The author is just the average John (or Jani or Janardhan). Does not matter. The message is important; not the messenger. Hope you enjoy the book.
Short description:
Hello,"" I said, “Can’t say I've seen you around here before.”
\n
\nShe smiled again…and my heart melted.
\n
\n“No, you haven’t,” she giggled. “For I have come especially to meet you today. I am Death, and it is time.”
\n
\nWhat happens when Death comes for you...and you start arguing over coffee ?
\n
\n... a quirky tale that offers a whole new perspective into one of life's deepest mysteries
Attribute:Author: anandaa

Name: Mystery Shopping
Description: Saurabh has been an avid Mystery Shopper since 2005. Academically, he holds double Masters and is an effective communicator with excellent techno-commercial skills, relationship building & interpersonal skills. He left his corporate Career of over 12 years in Customer Service and ventured into his own Mystery Shopping Company.
Short description: This piece of writing is a Handbook in the field of Mystery Shopping. A handbook that mystery shoppers can refer to when they feel lost. For someone who wants to enter into the world of mystery shopping as a mystery shopper, this handbook works as a step-by-step guide. A must read for existing mystery shoppers in order to brush up and enhance their skills.
Attribute:Author: Saurabh Bhatia

Name: INDIA IN SHAMBLES
Description: K.C. Agrawal, an electrical engineer and senior member of IEEE, USA, has over 33 years experience in different capacities in academics, PSUs and multinationals, and then running his own industry for 24 years manufacturing switchgear
Short description: An attempt at providing a Responsible and Accountable System of Governance for the people of India and fulfilling the basic objectives of our struggle for freedom.
Attribute:Author: K.C Agarwal

Name: It's Never Too Late
Description: A voracious reader of Thrillers, Murder Mysteries and Romances, Shilpa is a dreamer by nature and believes in living life to the fullest. A passionate reader and movie buff, she feels literature and the cinema make her life worthwhile. When she started to pen down Avantika's story, she felt its relevance to any modern woman, and felt a compulsion from within to make it reach book lovers everywhere. She says, “The journey of writing this book and creating these characters was really exciting and memorable. All in all, it was an enriching experience.”
Short description: Avantika Mahajan is a fiction editor who loves her job and looks up to fictional characters. She falls in love with and marries Rahul Kalyankar who eventually asks her for a divorce. Just when life is beginning to feel normal, Alex Logan, the dashing CEO of an American multinational comes her way. Will she be able to get over her insecurities and accept the love he offers? Only time will tell.
Attribute:Author: Shilpa Choudapurkar

Name: Thinking Made Easy
Description: The author, PRN Mohan, with over 37 yrs. of service in the Indian army, is a postgraduate in defence studies and management sciences. He has considerable experience in various facets of man-management and human behaviour in varying conditions and environments. The author has been actively involved in training, teaching and research assignments. He has developed a keen interest in creative thinking in the last few years and has keenly observed the impact of improved thinking skills on overall performance, particularly in problem solving, decision making and leadership qualities.
Short description:
Thinking is basic to us all. It is the intellectual activity that generates ideas, and underlines all human actions and accomplishments. As a skill it is learned through experience and in the process of education, though not to the extent required. The modern changing world, with its flood of information and increasing threshold of knowledge, poses greater challenges for our minds than ever before. This necessitates a refinement of thinking skills.
\nThis Book Provides an insight into the functioning of the brain and its impact on the thought process; to enable a well informed conscious effort to leverage the full potential of the mind.
\nThe simple steps outlined can be dovetailed into everyday activity, as you experience life, to improve your thinking ability, facilitate intellectual development and lead you to even greater success in life.
Tags: Non Fiction Book,PRN Mohan,Thinking Made Easy
Attribute:Author: PRN Mohan

Name: Dose
Description: Rising from the slums of Mumbai Satya has become a globe-trotter travelling to more than 100 cities in 25 countries and has lived in Dubai, England and now in Bulgaria. From young age he is fond of reading and invested a lot of time and energy in self-development. Besides earning master’s degree from Mumbai university Satya is also an Alumnus of IIM Kolkata. Satya gave up his high profile banking job to follow his heart and embarked on a passionate journey of writing, motivating and coaching. His dream is to see every fellow Indian become a super star. Satya is an expert author at ezinearticles.com and also contributes articles to Times of India. Yoga and meditation are his mantra for health and spiritual nourishment. He is happily married to a Bulgarian and spends most of his leisure time with his 2 kids.
Short description:
DOSE: DNA of Self-Energy
\nA 15-day handbook for a successful and energetic lifestyle by Satya Varghese
\nSuccess: a word that makes various images emerge in our minds - happy marriage, long-awaited children, rewarding job, accumulated wealth, dream home, fancy car, fortunate fight with disease, victory in sport, balance and harmony in life, and so on. The definition of success is not the same for every individual because we are all raised in varied conditions and believe in different principles and values. But whatever meaning the word success expresses, the path leading to it is paved with energy, according to Satya Varghese. Success is always desired and pursued in the competitive world we live. The aspirations related to it haunt us since childhood, and, inevitably, we sometimes become obsessed with the thought of it. The obsession often comes from the fact that we know we can do it, but we just do not know how. Using the idea of exploring this matter in detail, the author writes his first book, DOSE.
\nVarghese decides to pile together in one place the vital conditions for becoming and staying successful and content in life. The book primarily deals with facts about energy, determinants related to it, the way the human body works and how we can become more productive. Written in the form of a 15-day handbook, each chapter inside deals with different factors and maintains relative objectivity and thoroughness. In broad terms, the discussion explores health, lifestyle, body types and body weight, calories and food, various bodily systems and processes, sleep, workout routines, yoga, meditation and money.
\nTo sum up, DOSE by Satya Varghese is an interesting and practical book, suitable for people of every age and easily readable by all sections of society. It is an emotional illustration of the author’s own life, which has managed to integrate in itself solid information supporting the examined subject, namely how to gain and retain energy in order to be successful. If your life puzzle is incomplete. I guarantee that after reading DOSE, you will find at least some of the missing pieces and see that they match perfectly. Your life’s perception will certainly change, and you will become a magnetic person.
Attribute:Author: Satya Varghese

Name: Maya
Description: Satishsrinivas has been fascinated with film making since childhood and has grown up watching science fiction, fantasy and drama based films. He began experimenting with film making while working as a financial analyst with an IB company. This book is his way of sharing what goes on in his imagination and a stepping stone to making his very own feature film.
Short description: You trust a person and then you find out that you have been used by that person to serve his/her own mean purposes. How will you feel? Akshara, an innocent girl, doesn’t even know what has happened with her. She is out and away from her kingdom, the Javelin Kingdom. Her belongings are from a different city. Someone is playing with her emotions and not even thinking of the impact it will have on this innocent girl’s mind. Somebody’s greediness, somebody’s criminal mentality is affecting her and so many others. A strange woman is calling her Maya, though her name is Akshara. Who is that woman? Who is Maya? Why is Akshara facing a problem? Is the criminal related to all these people? How will they escape? A group of people want to reach an unknown destiny, a dangerous destiny, what is that?
Attribute:Author: Satishsrinivas

Name: Faceless
Description: Nizam Ahmed is 32. Born and brought up in Kanpur, he has studied in JMI, New Delhi, and IIM Calcutta. He works with Microsoft, and currently resides in Hyderabad along with his wife and two-year old son.
Short description:
What do you do when you try to commit suicide, and end up discovering you have superpowers?
\n
\nKabir faced this question just when he had done enough to get rid of a life he couldn't get along with.
\n
\nFoolishly encouraged by his new-found abilities, he decides get even with a cunning boss at work; win back his colleague Nat's love, and be an admired superhero.
\n
\nSo starts his crazy journey – a clumsy rescue act for a girl called Riona; a dramatically rigged introduction at the Qutub Minar; mathematical manipulations at flying; use of Facebook as a weapon, and surreal encounters with a wily Russian, and a mysterious monk.
\n
\nJust when he thinks he has a hang of it, he runs into the Devil - a manic ringleader of kidnappers - who is clearly more than a match for him.
\n
\nAs he stares at the barrel of the gun that the Devil has pointed at his head, he realizes how terribly inappropriate being a superhero has been.
Attribute:Author: Nizam Ahmed

Name: The Silicon Mind
Description:
The author was born in a highly educated matrilineal family of the lush green state of Kerala, India. After obtaining a Ph.D, she pursued a career in Physics as a teacher and researcher with interest in Condensed Matter and Non-linear Physics, at Banaras Hindu University, Varanasi. She has published several research papers in various scientific journals.
\n
\nBreaking the traditional norms of Hindu society, she opted for an inter-caste and inter-state marriage, choosing a Maharashtrian Brahmin colleague as her life partner. She has a son who is a corporate settled in Canada. After remaining an academic for two decades she took voluntary retirement to pursue her passion for writing.
\n
\nApart from knowledge hunting, reading and writing, she enjoys intellectual discussions on human brain, its potential and complexity and consciousness, an outcome of which is this book. She loves to live in new places all the time as it invigorates her and boosts her creative urge.
\n
\nShe is passionately involved in supporting helpless children all over India.
Short description:
The Silicon mind is a racy sci-fi thriller involving a very sophisticated neural chip implant by a robot on a human brain. It revolves around the intertwined lives of Ray, a leading neurosurgeon, sharp and flamboyant proprietor and driving force of Chetna, India's foremost coma clinic and Dr Aman Kapoor, reputed physician and accident victim who falls into a coma.
\n
\nAman becomes Ray's unsuspecting guinea pig- Ray and his American collaborators successfully implant a silicon chip inside Aman's brain- true to the book's sci-fi genre, a robot does the operation! Aman wakes up- rejuvenated and changed forever. As Ray and his team expected, his brain has been enhanced to superlative degrees but his body suffers strange illnesses, a result of the conflict between the material chip and the corporeal brain.
\n
\nThe story is about how Aman manages to trace his bizarre bodily symptoms and sudden miraculous healing powers to his brain operation at Chetna with help from Manasi, his psychiatrist, and her journalist friend, Ishan. Ray finally buckles to emotional pressure from Manasi and his own daughter, the irrepressible Sakshi and has to undo the wrong he had done by trying to play God.
Attribute:Author: Manikarnika Lagu

Name: Slow…
Description: Digonta Bordoloi was born and raised in the North East of India. In his early twenties, career dreams took him first to Delhi, then to Mumbai where he spent over a decade in high-level advertising. Escaping the corporate world, he landed up in Africa. After a year in Uganda, Digonta spent some time in Swaziland and Zanzibar, Tanzania, where he started writing this, his first novel. Digonta lives with his wife Susie. They call Australia and India home.
Short description:
Baba is born in a remote corner of India, sheltered from modern development. His father's job takes the family from town to town, and with each move, Baba comes to terms with his new life.He spends an idyllic childhood doing things at his own pace, bending the rules whenever he can.... And then the unthinkable happens. Slow is the story of a boy who preferred to walk, when the world around him was gearing up to run.
\n
\nFourWord Clarion Reviews (USA) ""Slow is a luxuriously sensual and provocative journey through life and death that examines the beauty and irony in the world around us.""
\n
\nKirkus Review (USA) ""Bordoloi's debut novel offers a picturesque journey through contemporary India with a splash of Mad Men style.""
Attribute:Author: Digonta Bordoloi

Name: The Bluest Marble
Description: Vipin Kumar is a guy you wouldn’t really notice in a crowd of three people. His ability to be extraordinarily ordinary combined with his astute observational sense makes him pick the most mundane people existing in our lives and tell their extraordinary stories. His passion to tell an ‘honest story’ can be adjudged by the fact that he admitted himself in a hospital to write the hospital scene in this book. He was an active participant in dramatics during college. He co-authored award winning plays and acted in the best ever drama produced in the history of IIT Bombay called Déjà-vu which dealt with IITian’s loneliness and rising suicide cases within the campus. Prior to this book he has written numerous short stories (unpublished) and poems (in English, Hindi and Hindustani; unpublished). He has an acute interest in psychological disorders which he has harvested to come up with a new disease in the book. His friends of each kind; those who like him and dislike him, have told him that his writing style reminded them of O’Henry and to some extent S H Manto. This is his debut novel.
Short description:
Aditya is known as Ram Kumar 125 – a name given to amnesiac patients in a ‘Mental Hospital’. He doesn’t have amnesia; he just doesn’t want to go back to the world he knew before. His inmates include: UT – the brilliant former CEO, Rajesh – software engineer and Jacky – Doctor in theoretical physics. Amongst these ‘crazies’ Ram Kumar 125 discovers himself, the true Aditya, and the secret of happiness. He finds the mysterious and precious “bluest marble” he has been unconsciously looking for all his life.
\nWith portraits that both touch and disturb, corporate politics, Mumbai night life, Dalal Street, lower-middle-class Delhi and psychological “illness”, The Bluest Marble is a sensitive exploration of young urban aspirations and angst in the age of economic turmoil.
Attribute:Author: Vipin Kumar

Name: Humanshastrra
Description:
Jatin Bharmani is a Human Resources (HR) professional with more than 12 years of professional experience and has worked with various Organisations. He founded Opteemize in 2011, which is a Human Resource Management Consulting firm.
\nDuring the course of his career, Jatin has interacted with a number of individuals across strata – Company MDs, Business heads, Department heads, Colleagues and Peons. Interaction among all levels made him realise that human beings are prone to various behaviours with subsequent actions.
\nHis detailed observations, interactions and experiences through his everyday contacts have helped him understand how
\nand why people react and apply logic in different situations.
\nOne of the most common observations, of Jatin, across levels is that most of the people are not satisfied in their current situations. They are continually chasing money, success and fame, which they think can give them ultimate happiness.
\nAlthough you may have the eagerness to earn money, fame and success, the means to earn the same is all the more important. And sometimes this eagerness to earn money becomes so important a desire that one adopts means that are against the Laws of Nature. And whenever you do anything against Nature you are bound to face the consequences.
\nIt is this thought that provoked the author to write ‘humanshastrra’ that can create awareness among people about the Laws of Nature and how all of us can be inspired by the Unseen.
\nJatin has decided to donate 10 percent of his earnings, from the sale proceeds of this book, for charity to express his gratitude.
Short description: Befriend Nature Are you missing something to act upon Make life easier Awareness made simple Be and Act better Act better Shape your Tomorrow Now Live your dreams Plan your Success
Attribute:Author: Jatin Bharmani

Name: Why Tears Are Necessary For The Success
Description:
Er. Vishal Gupta obtained Btech (ECE), M.tech(ECE) from Kurukshetra university kurukshetra & MBA(HR/FINANCE) from Punjab technical university. He has always been a scholar.
\nHe has more than 5 years of experience of teaching, industry & research. He has published and presented a number of research papers in technical journals and national/ international conferences. He has also authored 1 technical book meant for all students doing engineering and especially for electronics students.
\nEr. Gupta is an Assistant Professor and Project Engineer. He is also guiding several M.tech students in their research work. He is also a Life time Member of ISTE.
\nThe author is a motivator & also believes in social work. He always inspires others to work for the welfare of other’s especially for common man (AAM AADMI).
Short description:
This book is to motivate an ordinary common man to come forward to fulfill his dreams. The book has a very simple language so that everyone can understand and interpret the words easily. The book indicates how tears are your true soul mate, how they are helpful at every step for a person.
\nThis is not just a book which you have to read for time pass only. This is the damn life of you which you have to feel and correlate with your own life. This book initiates you to take steps for further writing, for speaking, to come out from yourself, from your inner guilt.
\nEach chapter can be read independently without any interlinked from the previous chapters. But a synchronous reading is highly appreciable and gain able for you. The book inspires you to follow your life and to make your life.
\nThis is not the final book; this is just the beginning chapters of one’s life. You have to make it complete, finalize it.
Attribute:Author: Er. Vishal Gupta

Name: Mobile Software Testing
Description: Narayanan Palani, a leading digital technology specialist with considerable years of experience in software testing including research and development. Proven track record of success with seven international research papers, thirteen international certifications from globally acclaimed institutions such as the British Computer Society, PRINCE2, AXELOS, Hewlett-Packard, IBM and Wipro. Authored a book (Advanced Test Strategy published by Penguin Partridge Publishers) on digital technology which stands as one of the best reviewed books across the globe.
Short description: Mobile Software Testing, the second book written by author Narayanan Palani and the first ever book on Mobile Application based software testing as well, has already turned out a best reviewed in the I.T industry. Narayanan Palani is keen in sharing the technical knowledge for those starting out a career in Software Testing or even for those with few years of testing experience. He is endorsed by Tech City UK as an exceptional talent/world leader in digital technology. His aim is to reduce the unemployment of developed countries like United Kingdom and developing countries like India by training the graduate students and jobseekers through his technical books. This book is the culmination of 5 years of research and effort in this field. It gives a pragmatic view of using Mobile Application Technology Testing Techniques in various situations. And is recommended for those aspiring to be experts or advanced users of test automation and performance tools like Experitest, Perfecto Mobile, uTest, Neotys, Soasta, Robotium, Ranorex and Eggplant. From the Reviewers "Mobile testing will capture the market space in the future and this book is very informative for testers who want to reserve the space in the future market"-Sunil Kiran Balijepalli, Team Lead at Cornerstone on demand. “Mobile testing is increasingly complex on day by day due to the range of platforms, devices and innovations. Narayanan has articulated the complex mobile testing approach in simple terms with good references. I am sure, this book will enable QA community to pick up the latest developments in mobile testing arena and the tools available to deliver secured & quality product to the end users” -Ponsailapathi V, Vice President, Polaris Software Lab Limited
Attribute:Author: Narayanan Palani

Name: That Girl in the Pink Raincoat & Other Stories
Description:
Sangya Singh has been fond of reading and writing from an early age. She and her school friends grew up reading the enchanting books of Enid Blyton.
\nLater she studied English Honours at Delhi University – which made her appreciate the works of famous poets and writers like Shakespeare, Byron, Keats, Shelley, Hardy and many more.
\nBesides teaching in a renowned school, she has also worked as a freelance writer for a leading English newspaper.
\nAlong with reading and writing, her other passions are cinema, travelling and music.
Short description:
This is a book which will bring a smile to your lips and a tear to your eye. The stories will move and grip you.
\n
\n‘Naina’ and ‘The Snow Kept Falling’ explore love, the most sublime of all emotions, in its various forms – infatuation, attraction, desire, affection, romance, duty and devotion.
\n
\n‘The Briefcase’ is a tale of trickery, deceit and entrapment told with a dash of wit and humour.
\n
\n‘Monkey Business’ is a most unusual story of revenge and vendetta.
\n
\nIn ‘Apartment 314,’ the reality merges with fantasy leading us into a world of supernatural. It leaves us spellbound with a feeling of horror and disbelief.
\n
\n‘Dada’ is a story on hero worship and adulation, of dreams being conceived, nurtured and fulfilled.
\n
\nThe Girl In The Pink Raincoat And Other Stories is a collection of short stories which deals with a myriad range of emotions.
Attribute:Author: Sangya Singh

Name: Unravelling Anjali: Diary of an Immigrant Bride
Description:
Nim Gholkar was born and raised in Mumbai, India. She graduated in English Literature from University of Bombay, Mumbai before moving to Australia in 1996.
\nHer blog ‘Nim’s Niche’ is a kaleidoscope of musings on life and its many reflections. She loves travelling, reading, playing badminton and singing karaoke.
\nUnravelling Anjali is her debut novel.
\nNim lives in Sydney with her husband, three children and a lovable Rhodesian Ridgeback called Cody.
\nTo know more about Nim, visit:
\nWebsite: www.nimsniche.com.au
Short description:
1998 Australia. Anjali Jathar is looking forward to life as an immigrant bride following her arranged marriage to ambitious divorcee Ravi. Settling in, she explores not just a new culture but also her newfound freedom. But life is less than perfect. Ravi’s constant travel and preoccupation with work leave Anjali feeling increasingly unloved and lonely.
\nEnter Jake Ellis. Charmed by Anjali’s exoticism, he finds himself gradually falling in love with her. And so begins an emotionally intoxicating roller-coaster ride.
\n‘Unravelling Anjali’ is a cross cultural tale delving into love, lust and relationships. What happens if a woman meets her soul mate after marriage…and it’s not her husband?
\n
\nA riveting read, ‘Unravelling Anjali’ is a vivid portrayal of commitment, betrayal and the struggle to find one’s identity in a foreign land.
Attribute:Author: Nim Gholkar

Name: Lifenine
Description:
Gayathri Thakoor is a writer and an educationist.
\nShe started her writing career with The Economic Times, Mumbai, working on feature stories in the corporate world. After years of contributing to this business daily, she moved on to becoming a freelance correspondent for a suburban supplement for The Times of India, Mumbai. She then started a partnership firm, Nanogems, to develop literature for children. Here, she helped create the Egghead series of books for children, which are now selling as iPhone and iPad apps, the world over. Her blog 'Affectionately...G' at gthakoor.blogspot.com is about bringing back the beauty of letter and diary writing, to communication today. Currently, she is on a content development assignment with IIT Bombay.
\nAs a teacher, she has encouraged children to think, read and write better through her creative writing and communication skills workshops, across Mumbai. Qualified with an academic record of a graduate degree in Economics, she also has an MBA degree in Finance and a Master's degree in Education, to her credit.
\nHaving frequent doses of 'adrenaline rushes' are a must for Gayathri Thakoor with her constant quest to try something new. If that includes a 15-day trek to Everest Base Camp in Nepal, navigating her team to win Lavasa Women's Rally, or running the half marathon in Mumbai, every year, she makes sure there is some thrill to look forward to.
Short description: Nothing could compare with the racy, unexpected, edge of the seat adventures in those nine months of her life. Travelling the length and breadth of the country, having so many 'adrenaline-rush' experiences and making sure her rebellious streak became the expected norm, Navya knew her story could give any reality show a run for is TRPs...all along when she was pregnant. Was it worth the risk?
Attribute:Author: Gayathri Thakoor

Name: Tat Tvam Asi
Description:
Destined to spend all her time reading and mothering, Pinky Acharya was born in Mumbai. She is a proud J. B. Petit High School for Girls alumnus, and graduated from Sydenham College with a B.Com degree. She is a practicing graphologist, with a decade's worth of experience, working with corporates and individuals alike, as a recruitment advisor and holistic remedials' therapist.
\nRaised completely and absolutely Gujarati, her eventful childhood and memorable adolescence has helped shape not only the theplas she makes daily, but also the woman she is today. Tat Tvam Asi is her first venture of its kind and, she vows, not her last.
\nAcharya resides in Mumbai with her silently-supportive husband, socially-explosive son and an increasingly-Shakespearean daughter.
Short description:
Life's beautiful moments are all around us, if only one stops enough to notice.
\nA random gesture of compassion has the power to reverberate multifold between a pair of strangers, a teacher's passion to fulfil her unsung duties goes a long way to mould a child's personality, a poor carpenter travelling a substantial distance to return a pittance proves his immense wealth of character, and sometimes, your own child surprises you with a maturity way beyond their years. These and many more soul-searching anecdotes are brought to you by Pinky Acharya to stir the spirit into thinking about the finer nuances of life.
\nTat Tvam Asi (that art thou) is Pinky Acharya's veridical journey that propagates empathy through inner cleansing. As the title suggests, once realisation dawns that each one of us is a mere drop in the ocean of the Supreme Being - though a tiny extension of the same - it is difficult to have thoughts or perform actions that are unworthy of the Almighty.
Attribute:Author: Pinky Acharya

Name: Guilty by Choice
Description: Shanti Paramashivan has a degree in microbiology from Mumbai University. With a passion to travel and meeting new people, she believes in living an optimistic life. She loves listening to music, especially Lucky Ali's tracks. Residing in Navi Mumbai, the author is a diehard fan of Ranbir Kapoor.
Short description:
Kiana Shetty is a young, dynamic and beautiful girl who lives in Mumbai with her mother and a younger brother. Like every recent graduate, she dreams of making it big and making it ig quickly. But fate may have otherplans for her in the form of her own brother: meet Viraj, Kiana's younger brother, who works at a call center but wants to open his own tattoo studio some day and he will fo anything to make that happen.
\nMumbai is known as the city of dreams and they say if you're brave enough to shoot for the moon, you'll at least land up among the stars. Viraaj sets out to do just that, but he may have taken the help of some very different means to achieve his dreams. While Kiana deals with Viraaj's dreadful secrets, she also has to put up with Abhit, Viraaj's best friend, who won't stop professing his love for her at every opportunity he gets. It looks like the only person she can trust in all this hullaballoo is Sarthak, her best friend and collegue. But for how long?
\nWill Kiana be able to get out of the mess that she actually has nothing to do with? Or has Viraaj already gone too far that Kiana can't help but be collateral damage?
\n'Guilty By Choice' is a story about dreams, about love, about friendship, and above all, family. Because in the end, you do it all for the family, right?
Attribute:Author: Shanti Paramashivan

Name: First Job & Ten Mistakes
Description: Uttam Kumar has a Masters degree in Mathematics. He has a liking for writing since he was in 9th Standard but "First Job and Ten Mistakes" is his first published work. His upcoming books include "The Moment of Truth" and "Recruitment Hijacked".
Short description:
""Credit Cards are your advance salary and not additional Salary.""
\n""Avoid SpEaR, adopt ESS""
\n""Loan for Loan is Suicidal.""
\n""It's always the first step that matters; the rest will follow.""
Attribute:Author: Uttam Kumar

Name: My Daughter
Description:
Shiny Thomas was born and brought up in Kerala and now lives in Mumbai with his wife anf two children. He worked in various media houses in Mumbai for more than 25 years. Currently he freelances as a business consultant.
\n""My Daughter"" is his first English novel and you can expect many more books from him.
Short description:
I had a friend Siva Rama Krishnan; I used to call him Siva. He came from the South and I am from the East. He was my collegue, partner and my best friend. We were together for more than a decade.
\nSiva was a gem of a person, kind-hearted in his dealing with people around him. Three Gods are always with him and showering him with blessings. Due to his mercy, several people are still alive. Let us go through his story... ""My Daughter"".
Attribute:Author: Shiny Thomas

Name: In A Feeling Named Love
Description: D. Sathwik, 22, is currently a Law Student. He lives in Hyderabad and is an avid reader and a foodie.
Short description:
Love - a simple four-letter word has the power to change the destiny of any person. Love is the best thing to happen to us if it is with our Mr. or Miss Right.
\nI found my Miss Right in Shritha, who changed my life and along with it, my destiny too. I will not claim that I have best love story in the world; but love was definitely the best thing that happened to me, I probably would have never come in front of you as a writer.
\nThis book is a magical journey of love, put through to you, my readers, in a loving way as my life was with Shrita. I hope you enjoy reading about this enchanted part of my life as much as I enjoyed living it and still enjoy reminiscing about.
\nIn A Feeling Named Love is my story, my experiences with love - the best part of my life - put into words.
Attribute:Author: D. Sathwik

Name: How Did It Go?
Description:
Currently working with a bank in New York, Prasun Choudhary is an alumnus of IIT Kharagpur, who spent a considerable amount of time as a consultant before switching over to Banking. Described by his friends and batch mates as a passionate person, who instils confidence in everyone he meets, the author is particularly fond of visiting new places and running marathons; he considers running to be the most liberating and satisfying of experiences.
\nThe author's active involvement, in all sorts of student activities during his IIT days, has given him detailed insights into the lives and characteristics of the different types of students he came across during the years he spent at university, which he has put to good use in his first work of fiction, 'How Did It Go?'
Short description:
Percy and his friends are just like other university students – trying hard to toe line between having the time of their lives and keeping up with their academics. When the constant pressures of competition start to get to them, they figure that they’d rather be having fun instead. And that’s when everything starts to fall apart! Will they be able to find their way back again? Or will it be too late?
\n‘How Did It Go?’ is an account of how an average student goes about navigating the intensely competitive waters of IIT, but its messages are universal. The constant fight to stay afloat, the loss of hope and your drive to succeed, the internal politics – it can all be a bit much for one person to take on. If you think getting in was difficult, think again! But, as Percy rightly puts it, nothing is too intimidating as long as you find where you belong, pick up a few life lessons and good friends along the way, and just have fun doing it all!
Attribute:Author: Prasun Choudhary

Name: The Way Ahead
Description:
Tamanna C is a natural healer and has been a Psychic from the age of nine. From the age of twelve, she certified herself as a Reiki master, Pendulum healer, Crystal healer, Self Hypnosis, NLP, Heartlight Ascension Healer, Master in Psychic Healing, Past Life Therapist & Soul Coach. She is also a medium and channel and connects with Higher Ascended Masters and Spirit Guides, practising in Divination Consulting. She has made a strong foundation for herself in Mumbai, Delhi, Dubai, Istanbul, and Ankara, with clients coming from all walks of life, from the age of twelve years up.
\nShe has also won various awards for her achievement in the space of Spirituality and Angel Therapy.
\nHer prime intention is to reach out to as many people across the globe and transform the idea of sprituality as a 'Way of Being' rather than a 'Way of Living'.
\nOne can avail Personal Psychic Reading and Various other healing sessions by appointments.
\nShe also runs a spiritual blog that you can access on: www.tamannac.wordpress.com
\nYouTube Channel: mstamannac
\nFacebook Page: Tamanna C Psyhic Healer
Short description:
The way the Universe works is not only strange but also miraculous and magical. It's always out there to watch our backs in any given situation. It's a myth that we need to go through problems or pain in order to grow as a soul. Soul-growth is a by-product of just being aware of what the Universe is trying to communicate to you at any given point of time.
\nWhile transformation, self-awareness and soul-growth have been core reasons for us being on earth in physical bodies, there are also various aspects and tools involved that make our journey towards self-awareness and transformation a lot more graceful. This book has been written to bring about that self-awareness and transformation in the most realistic and simplest of ways.
\nThis book isn't about philosophy or self-help, nor is it about practising rituals or techniques. The words in this book only help create an energy imact strong enough for realisation and awareness to shift within you, without you even knowing it. It's there to accompany you in your journey from here on, just being a light for you to move ""A Way Ahead"" than where you already are right now.
Attribute:Author: Tamanna C

Name: The Path Is The Way
Description:
Lt Col Mohit Badoni was commissioned into the 12th batallion of the Rajputana Rifles in 1999. An alumni of the Indian Military Academy, the author had three field tenures in Jammu & Kashmir, where he had been actively deployed in counter terrorist operations including a tenure with The Rashtriya Rifles. Currently, the officer is serving in High Altitude in Arunachal Pradesh. The officer has also been actively deployed in the desert sector during Operation Parakram and served in line of control Operation Vijay. The author has vast experience in Ammunition, Counter IED and is qualified in CBRN warfare.
\nThe author already has a published novel to his credit, 'CROSSROADS', which was published in the year 2010, when he was serving the Rashtriya Rifles. The author is a vivid writer, and has been contributing to professional articles in military journals. Writing fiction is his passion and he wants to reach out to the world through his writing, with a message behind every story that he intends to tell.
Short description:
Vijay Amrit Raj Sharma,a young Indian Army Officer is critically injured in a cordon and search operation, Struggling between life and death, he recalls the lessons that life and his grandfather have taught him. The young officer survives his gunshot wound only to find out that he has survived to pay back for his sins.
\nEmbarking on a journey to find a way to wash away his sins, Vijay disovers love, friendship, passion, greed, despair and finally, hope.
\nLike a flowing river, THE PATH itself becomes THE WAY with an invisible world manifesting itself in the visible world to grasp the mysteries of human morality and the quest of redemption.
Tags: General Fiction,Mohit Badoni,The Path Is The Way
Attribute:Author: Mohit Badoni

Name: The Whispered Raga
Description:
Sudipto Roy Choudhury holds a BTech in engineering from IIT Kanpur and a PhD in mathematical physics from Cornell University, as well as a certificate on screen and novel writing from the Hollywood Screenwriters' Guild.
\nHis published literary work includes the novel 'I Shall Come Out as a Tremendous Comet' (Rupa, 2009) and two volumes of translated short stories - 'The Arabian Nights of Kolkata and Other Stories' (Calcutta Writers' Workshop, 2002) and 'Prometheus: Unbound: Short Stories of Samaresh Basu' (Rupa, 2006). He also has 97 published research articles in top journals in mathematical physics and was founding Chair of the Society of Industrial and Applied Mathematics Activity Group on Nonlinear Waves and Coherent Structures. He teaches at the University of Central Florida in Orlando, USA and can be reached at roy.choudhury141@gmail.com. He has also written miscellaneous columns on film in 'The Hindu' (Madras) and 'The Statesman' (Calcutta), and articles in 'World Literature Today', 'Asian Affairs' et cetera. Among them was a monthly column on European art film which ran in 'The Statesman' from 1992 to 1998.
Short description:
It is 1974 and friends aniket, Nazrul and Lopa, all very gifted North Indian classical singers trained at the Marris School of Music in Lucknow, have no inkling that in a couple of decades, they'll be going through bittersweet reunion in Ithaca, New York of all places.
\nAniket and his friends, leading a relatively contented, musical life, come of age at the Sursagar School of Music in Calcutta when a music conference precipitates a series of dramatic events, which transform their lives in ways none of them could have anticipated.
\nMuch like the peaks and troughs of a 'khayal' or composition, ""THE WHISPERED RAGA"" tells its story in four parts: beginning with the 'alaap', which sets into motion their journey, the 'majh' follows, setting the stage for the impending drama. This triggers a series of flashbacks in Aniket's mind just like the 'asthayi' that lays the foundation of a 'khayal'. As the various crises come to head at a second music conference, the stage is set for the final crescendo or 'tarana'.
Tags: Fiction: Literary,Sudipto Roy Choudhury,The Whispered Raga
Attribute:Author: Sudipto Roy Choudhury

Name: You, Your Bedroom & 5 Minutes
Description:
Author Sunil Mimani's backgrounding in Anatomy & Physiology materialised and rigourised in the late 70s, during his 1st MB years at the Guwahati Medical College in Assam.
\nAnd even though he later moved into industry, passion for physiology not only just still stay but stayed to such extents-&-depth, that something as granted as the case of, 'even elite-sports-people sporting that paradoxical-potbelly' led the author into that exceptionally painstaking research, that culminated into the cultivation of this game-changing-protocol, that gets people into a: lifetime of tummy-tonedness at a price as sheer as 5 bedroom-minutes mere!
\n56 & Reverse-Aging, Sunil is an incorruptible intellectual, and could be contacted at ergodynamic@hotmail.com
Short description:
How would you like it.. if you, your bedroom & 5 minutes, were to be the utter-all you would need to stay tummy-toned-&-core-fit for the rest of your life!
\nValuable for all ages, this book will prove to be a goldmine for perennially - busy young men-&-women of the modern-era!
Attribute:Author: Sunil Mimani

Name: Jordan
Description:
Ishan Mathur is the guy behind Jordan. He is a copywriter by profession, author by fate, and beer-lover by choice. Pondering upon his story for several months, he finally decided to pen it down recently.
\n
\nIshan loves crazy conversations on existence of religion, beliefs, emotions, and the Batman. He equally loves his female German Shepherd ‘Peppers’, who is single-handedly or may be single-pawdedly responsible for tearing apart first two drafts on paper.
\n
\nIf you are up for a beer, coffee, or conversation, just drop him a message on Facebook. Of course, he’d love to hear if you like his story, in fact he is currently hunting for compliments.
Short description:
This is not a love story. There is no ‘boy-meets-girl’ or a ‘happily ever-after’. It’s not like anything that you’ve read.
\nIn this story, Apples – a young, ambitious reporter makes her living writing about the most infamous musician. She praises him, adores him, adulates him, and finally has the chance to interview him in a country far away, only to end up in tears. He is the man she’d least expected to spend her life with.
\nLater, fate chooses to weave her journey with him, who is already struggling with the smudges of his past. They are not meant to unite. It is a story written in irony, where every choice is the wrong one.
Attribute:Author: Ishan Mathur

Name: Such is the world
Description: Surendranath holds a diploma in electrical engg., runs an electrical contracting firm in South Mumbai and resides in the western suburbs.
Short description:
Paapu, a mischievous boy studying in the seventh standard is having a hard time trying to be a good student at school. He finds it equally hard to be a good little boy at home. The result is a riot of fun and laughter as Paapu and his friends cope with the demands of being well-mannered and well-behaved, when all they want to do is let loose their natural exuberance and curiosity.
\n
\nTogether, the friends explore avenues for amusement and mischief in their school and neighbourhood, while their parents and teachers try hard to quiet them down. Paapu has questions in school that are not satisfactorily answered by his teachers. He tries to question his mother’s beliefs only to receive a beating for his troubles. He visits his grandfather’s house and while there, learns that the world is not as simple as he thought it was.
\n
\nTowards the end, as an adult, he comes face to face with the realization that he too is one among the many people in this world, struggling to make sense of life. His illusion that he is different and better compared to other people is shattered when he realizes how he has failed his mother, who had given him everything he had in life.
\n
\nThe story ends on a sober note, with Paapu and the narrator reminiscing and commiserating with each other over the misfortunes they have had to face in their lives.
Attribute:Author: Surendranath Lahari

Name: An Intimate Dance of a pair of hands
Description: The author is a neonatal intensive care specialist since 25 years. He has been with McMaster University Medical Centre and Children’s Hospital at Hamilton, Ontario, Canada for the last 30 years. He also serves in a voluntary honorary capacity at Surya Children’s Hospital, Mumbai, India for 3 months each year for over 15 years. This book was written over a period of 3 months during a glorious visit of 4 months to India from December 2012 till April 2013. In his chosen profession that many have called his life’s vocation, he is regarded by colleagues and his patients’ families as a richly experienced, dedicated, honest, compassionate clinician and bedside educator.
Short description:
This book is a glimpse of the mystery and beauty of life with all the nuances of romance, love prayer, fantasy, tragedy, philosophy, spirituality, memory and imagination. It is a book in which you may find yourself too.
\n
\nIt is a Mirror that reflects me, at times wiped clean at other times covered with dust. It is about how an ordinary man had the most extraordinary experience in life.
\n
\nWith Gratitude, I take the liberty to quote Richard Bach:
\n
\n“True love stories never have endings!”
\n
\nAll proceeds from the sale of this book in any form will be divided amongst the main characters in this book and NGOs of the author's choice.
Tags: An Intimate Dance OF A pair of hands,BecomeShakespeare,Biographical,Fiction,Jay Shah
Attribute:Author: Jay k. Shah (a.k.a Dadhi)

Name: The Cannanore of Yore
Description: Born In Doha, in the State Of Qatar, to Mrs Hemalatha and Mr K.T Jayaram, from Kannur. Learnt my first lines and sang my first rhymes from a small school run by a British lady, Mrs Nicholson. Children from all nationalities clamored in the tiny school until the fourth standard. Indian children were dropped off in their homeland to continue their studies. St Teresa’s Convent , Kannur, and my grandmother, moulded the rest of me. Graduated in English literature from S.N College, Kannur. Loves lines, lores and lyrics. Settled for domesticity, putting in my mite towards business,.. Been a part and parcel of Ashrayam Special school, a Centre for the Mentally challenged, finding joy in the small strides they make. Seeks solace in the strains of the veena . A dreamer, a spectator, marveling on the intricacies of life and its many splendored characters. Married to restaurateur, N.P Santhosh Kumar, and has two children, Sarang and Sanyanth.
Short description:
The Cannanore of Yore”, meanders its way through the lives of the families who found their niche in Kannur, and continues to enrich it’s rich tapestry.The book neatly captures fascinating stories that shouldn’t fade away with time.
\nTake a stroll over an era where the Malabar coast was a treasure trove for the spice market. The scent of the spices steered many explorers to follow the trail, and eventually wage wars to establish their sovereignty. The laid back life of the largely agrarian populace, dominated by the feudal landlords received a jolt when the fangs of foreign powers sailed its way through the deep seas. The old snapshots lends authenticity to the book, and also leads us back to an era gone by. The book treads through the vast metamorphosis it brought to the economic,religious, cultural, academic and infrastructural fabric of Malabar.
Tags: BecomeShakespeare.com,​Chandini Santosh,History.,Kannur,literature,Non Fiction,The Cannanore of Yore
Attribute:Author: Chandini Santosh

Name: Microscopy of Transiting Planets Simplified Volume 5
Description:
The author Baldev Bhatia is a renowned and world famous Astrologer who has penned several simple books on Astrology – this mysterious subject that reveals the true perception of knowing oneself through the art of prediction. Professionally, the author has put his entire life experience in promoting Astrology in various fields with a view to serve the millions of curious readers of this mystic science with the intention of imparting the real knowledge of Astrology through various marvellous scriptures.
\n
\nThe Astrologer has been associated with Astrology for the past 45 years and has been practicing Astrology in various forms. The Author-cum Astrologer has been in touch with general public throughout his life and has been practicing phycology and pubic healing. His intention is to guide his readers to achieve their personal goals with ease that would assist them to overcome all the problems, crises, and the unforeseen negatives forces, in their lives so as not to get disheartened or depressed in their lives and finally lead a happy and peaceful life.
\n
\nThe author also shares the valuable experience of his life with his readers through his valuable and helpful book. His published books, “Microscopy of Astrology”, “Microscopy of Numerology”, “Microscopy of Remedies”, and “Microscopy of Happy Living” guide his readers to achieve their personal goals with ease and assists them to overcome all the problems, crises, and the unforeseen negative forces in their lives.
Short description:
In Astrology, the planetary transits are important to understand the effects of planets on an individual at a given moment. Transiting of a planet means movement of that planet from one sign to another, and from one constellation to another. If the influence is good, it brings good or positive changes or events in life. But negative influence gives undesired results.
\nThrough this marvellous scripture, the author intends to guide the readers to achieve their personal goals with ease that would assist them to overcome all the problems, crises, speed breakers and the unforeseen negatives forces in their lives, as not to get worried or disheartened or depressed in their lives if the influence of the transiting planets is weak or depressed and unfavourable.
\nThe astrologer has been associated with Astrology for the past 45 years and has been practicing Astrology in various forms. His predictions have been very useful, purposeful, and a pin point to the service of mankind. He wishes success for all his readers.
Tags: Astromony,Baldev Bhatia,Microscopy of Transiting Planets Simplified Volume 5,Zogiac Signs
Attribute:Author: Baldev Bhatia

Name: Between the union jack and the rising sun: damsels, knights, and knaves
Description:
\n \n \n \n \n \n
9789383952526
\n"Sudipto Roy Choudhury holds a BTech in engineering from IIT Kanpur and a PhD in mathematical physics from Cornell University, as well as a certificate on screen and novel writing from the Hollywood Screenwriters’ Guild. \nHis published literary work includes the novels The Whispered Raga (BecomeShakespeare, 2015) and I Shall Come Out as a Tremendous Comet (Rupa, 2009) and two volumes of translated short stories – The Arabian Nights of Kolkata and Other Stories (Calcutta Writers’ Workshop, 2002) and Prometheus Unbound: Short Stories of Samaresh Basu (Rupa, 2006). He also has 97 published research articles in top journals in mathematical physics and was founding Chair of the Society of Industrial and Applied Mathematics Activity Group on Nonlinear Waves and Coherent Structures. He teaches at the University of Central Florida in Orlando, USA and can be reached at roy.choudhury141@gmail.com. He has also written miscellaneous columns on film in The Hindu (Madras) and The Statesman (Calcutta), and articles in World Literature Today, Asian Affairs et cetera. Among them was a monthly column on European art films that ran in The Statesman from 1992 to 1998.
Short description:
This novel interweaves three stories set in the Asian theatre of WWII in the fertile crescent stretching from Singapore to Calcutta.
\n
\nThe first Chinese-Japanese-Eurasian tale is set in the famous Raffles Hotel in Singapore, now being rapidly transformed as ‘comfort women’ are brought in. Complications arise as the head of the Kempeitai takes a fancy to the Anglo-Indian cabaret artiste, who was once the object of the Hotel Manager’s affections, while a noble Japanese officer falls in love with one of the Chinese comfort women. Given the harsh realities of wartime Malaya, a series of tragedies ensues as the narrator, Ashoke, and his friends, Lim-Siew and Tim O’Brien-D’Souza are forced to look on in impotent, hapless horror.
\n
\nA second, true story from the Quit India Movement serves as an Indian counterpoint to the events unfolding at Raffles. The third tale involves Subhash Bose and the Indian National Army or INA, narrated by two of the principal historical protagonists, Major Fujiwara and Captain Saraswati. As the INA soldiers go on trial at Delhi’s historic Red Fort, all of India rises in revolt.
\n
\nBy the end, the tales become meditations on war itself, ranging far beyond the confines of a hotel which had embodied ‘all the exotic tales of the East’ and a fabled palace complex, that once rivalled Versailles. Netaji and Fujiwara will have decisively advanced the eventual post-War liberation of all of colonial Asia, while Ashoke and Liem-Siew and Tim will be marked forever by the tragedies they witness of little people caught between malign, feuding colonial forces.
Tags: and knaves,BecomeShakespeare.com,Between the union jack and the rising sun: damsels,Historical Fiction,History.,knights,Sudipto Roy Choudhry,WWII History
Attribute:Author: Sudipto Roy Choudhry

Name: My Childhood Love Story
Description:
Piyush, just 18 years old, is a student. He loves
\nreading love stories, something like what he has
\nwritten himself. He wants to become the best writer
\nin the world. My Childhood Love is his debut novel.
\nSome thoughts from his mind:
\nFriend said to not take risks but I said I don’t take
\nthe chance to avoid risks
\nI do not think who I am. I just thought what am I?
\nI love myself but I am not a selfish person.
\nI don’t care who talks about me but I care who does
\nnot talk about me.
Short description:
There once was a boy named Aman of a mere 13
\nyears of age. He may have been just a child, but his
\nmind sprung into action like an adult at the sight of
\nher. He actually falls in love in the 8th standard, but
\nbefore he could utter a word to her, she was gone.
\nThat was my childhood love story – one wherein
\nlove blossoms from a tender age and lovers
\naccept each other during their college days.
Tags: BecomeShakespeare.com,Fiction,love,Love story,My Childhood Love Story,Piyush Arora,Romance
Attribute:Author: Piyush Arora

Name: Ice Bound
Description:
Born in Bombay and brought up in Mumbai, Hywel has
\nalways been a big fan of mystery/suspense books, which
\nkeep you enthralled right up to the end, hooking you to the
\ncharacters and the storyline.
\nHe works full-time at a Media agency and reading and now
\nwriting books has been a break for him from the daily stress
\nof life; he is predominately a weekend writer.
\nCouple of story ideas and the encouragement of his wife,
\nChristina, and his family have led him to write his first story.
\nIn addition to books, he loves watching football and playing
\nthe guitar whenever he gets some free time.
Short description:
The Year is 2034 – on a post-apocalyptic Earth.
\nA group of New World residents led by James Cook are
\ntraversing the frozen lands in search of his father. But
\nstaying one step ahead of a diabolical army – the
\nVengers – led by a megalomaniac who is hell bent on
\nruling the New World is only one of the group’s concerns.
\nThe other is beating nature at her own game.
\nWill friends turn into enemies when the temperature
\ndrops? Who will you trust when you are ICE BOUND?
Attribute:Author: Hywel Pinto

Name: Know Your Self  for Better Work-Life Balance
Description:
Sanjay was born in 1971 in Sonipat, Haryana (India). He has around 25 years of work experience in insurance and steel sectors in the domain of corporate communication and administration. The book is based on experiences he himself had and also the experiences shared by friends and acquaintances. A self-proclaimed introvert and avid reader, he tried to seek answers to his dilemmas at work and in other parts of life, from various sources. His quest for peace of mind for himself resulted in these writings which reflect on various aspects of Work-Life Balance.
\nShare you feedback and queries at gorask@gmail.com
Short description:
Author Sanjay Gora is a Gold-medallist in journalism course, but he did not join the journalism profession. His PG Diploma in Human Resource Management did not improve his people management skills as a reading of this book would reveal to you. Nor did he put his Masters course in English language to much use. Whether he should have written this book at all, considering his excellence in mediocrity and goofiness, is for you to judge after reading the book.
\nAuthor will await your comments at gorask@gmail.com
Tags: Know Your Self with Better Work-Life Balance,Sanjay Gora,Self Help
Attribute:Author: Sanjay Gora

Name: Tere Bina Jiya Jaaye Na
Description:
Parthasarthi Daas was born in Bhusawal, Maharashtra, on7th March, 1973 and was raised in Kolkata and Indore during his early years. He has a Master of Philosophy degree with a specialisation in German Science and Vedic Astrology. He has an acute interest in copywriting, and has scripted many TV commercials.
\n
\nHe is a columnist for the Times of India, Navbharat Times, and Dainik Bhaskar. He has worked with Rajkumar Santoshi (eminent filmmaker) and Maqbool Fida Husain as an assistant director for their feature films, and has also held the post of Executive Producer at Zee TV. He has designed and headed two courses for Whistling Woods International, Mumbai. Daas currently resides in Mumbai with his wife and five-year-old daughter. He believes in simple living and high thinking, and hopes to become a renowned author and revolutionary filmmaker some day.
\n
\nFor feedback email: parthsarrthi@gmail.com
Short description:
This is a book that talks about an eternal love story—about how two people can meet in the most unusual circumstances, and how a single instance can spark unconditional love that lasts a lifetime.
\n
\nBased in Kolkata, the story narrates the troubles of a very intelligent CA, and how love saves the day even in the darkest hour. The book is not just a simple love story—it also informs and educates about the dread that comes with fatal diseases, and shines a light on the societal taboos associated with them.
Tags: AIDS,BecomeShakespeare.com,Family Drama,Fiction,Kolkata,Love story,Parthasarthi Daas,Romantic Fiction,Tere Bina Jiya Jaaye Na
Attribute:Author: Parthasarthi Daas

Name: Dry Tears of Love
Description: Vicky Kharb is an entrepreneur and a writer. Vicky was born on 7th August, 1992 in a small village called Mundhela Kalan in New Delhi. Vicky completed his senior schooling from Shiv Vani Model Sr. Sec School and also graduated from the Delhi University.With Dry Tears of Love, his first novel, he has stepped into the writing world and is looking ahead to serve short stories and portray his thoughts through upcoming novels. An incident made him realize his potential, and inspired by a friend; he started exploring thoughts, and made writing his career. Through Dry Tears of Love, he has made an effort to convey the message about love being abused and the severe conditions that take place. His purpose behind this book is to deliver the message to the largest count of our society about modern thoughts and the outcomes from that.
Short description: “Dry Tears of Love” is a love story about ‘love at first sight’. Two unknown people from different cultures met incidentally and fell in love. But destiny has planned something else for them. They stood up for each other, faced problems but kept their love alive. Being away from each other, they paid the price for someone else’s mistake.
Tags: BecomeShakeshpeare.com,college stories,Drama,Dry Tears of Love,Love story,Somveer Kalonia,Vicky Kharb
Attribute:Author: Vicky Kharb

Name: Srijana
Description:
Dr. S. Chakraverty was born in the scenic hill station of Shillong, Meghalaya. A medicine man by profession, writing was a pursuant passion with plays at the Bangiya Sahitya Parishad at an early age ﬁnally staging his own called “Yatra” in Bengali in 1974.
\nAlthough helping the ill and the less fortunate took precedence, writing and directing as a hobby kept its momentum until ﬁnally he self published his ﬁrst novel “Bollywood Gambit” in Aug 2008, and distributed it through the Brand “DEPOT Self Publishing” promoted by Pantaloon Retail.
\nThis is his second attempt at getting published.
Short description:
When a woman’s life needs to be embodied, her essence needs to be deﬁned, we come upon SRIJANA. It is the story of a woman in the true sense of the term “prakriti” or the womb; the creator of beings. But when such creation succumbs to the dark side of existence it is this very creative energy that does not hesitate to destroy its own. Meandering on layered relationships of the modern world and
\na woman’s single minded ﬁght Srijana summarises “courage” as we all would like to portray or be a part of her journey through the toughest trek of “life”.
Attribute:Author: DR. S. CHAKRAVERTY

Name: Way to Fall in Love and Dreams
Description:
Chaitali Bangre is an engineering graduate from Nagpur. She completed
\n
\nher management degree from Pune. She has been working as a ‘Content
\n
\nand concept writer’ in Softweb Design Studio, Nagpur.
\n
\nShe is also holding a campaign known as ‘Awareness aromas’ on her own
\n
\nblog: newcomersweb.blogspot.in
Short description: Applauded with love and ended with dreams….!! Time changes with the growing world and so do people. But Kabir is a perfect blend of solitary attitude that made Aiyesha to experience his love and the joy of dreaming even the impossible. Aiyesha is a common girl, you resides inside every girl, was only molded in the way her family wanted. But, a layer of cold breeze appealed her senses and this common girl turned out to an unexpected Lady who stole each and every heart. Kabir who saw a different world in his life, asked for nothing but always her. Life took unexpected turns, but he still continued to open his heart and wait for her till the end. Aniket, I would call him that friend who always brought the best in his two puppets, Spruha , she has absurd ways of making you mad and please don’t expect more than she can give. Life and dreams can never be perfect together, but if they can make you laugh, they will also make you think what has left behind, Find out more how DREAMS and LOVE gives Aiyesha and Kabir those perfect wings to FLY…
Tags: BecomeShakespeare.com,CHAITALI BANGRE,General Fiction,Way to Fall in Love and Dreams
Attribute:Author: Chaitali Bangre

Name: Heaven in a Hell
Description: Samaira Sandhu, a vivid writer with a charming personality, takes pride in coming up with a debut fiction novel after winning a National Beauty Pageant and publishing it before going for the International Contest. She is passionate about dancing and is a great dancer herself. Winner of several prestigious pageants, at present, she is Mrs. India, Queen of Substance 2015 and Mrs. East Asia Earth 2015, and now competing for Mrs. Earth, 2015. She recently debuted as a lead actress in a Tamil movie “Dhayam”. The talented diva is a software engineer professional currently working in a leading MNC. She is a true philanthropist. She is also the brand ambassador of HCWA and CRT216, the two international NGO’s.
Short description:
Transformation, when happens in a life, creates a huge turmoil, but if transformation happens at every step, imagine the outcome!
\nAn extraordinary story of an ordinary girl, Ananda! She begins her journey with hopes, but life’s twists and turns work like a wending machine shaping it to the unforeseen. “Thus, began a new phase of my life, i.e. entering the hell.” The moment she starts believing that life is a heaven to live in, unexpected twists play the foul and make it a living hell. “Now, it had become my mission to find heaven in this hell.” An unusual story, where things shape up through struggles – class struggle, teenage struggle, financial struggle, relationship struggle, social setup struggle, fighting the taboos and so on… An angel does play the part to make it heaven, but … “I felt like I had built up a heaven in a hell already.” Enriched with mystery, suspense, thrill and an ultimate romance… This novel covers all the aspects of human psyche and focuses on a whooping social evil, a curse engulfing youth like an epidemic.
Tags: Actress,Addiction,Adolescence,Ananda,Anmol Sandhu,army officer,Become Shakespeare,Birthday,Books on Drugs,Books on youth,brand Ambassador,Celebrity Mother,College,Curse,De-addiction Center,Delhi,Drugs,East Asia Earth,Friendship,Heaven,Heaven in a Hell,Hell,Human psyche,Keywords - Anmo,Mrs. Earth,Mrs. India,Mystery,National beauty,Peddlar,Philanthropist,Rabia,Ravi,Relationship,Renowned figure,Revenge,Romance,School,Sibling Love,Sister,Social evil,Struggle,Suspense,Thrill,Transformation,Trap,Twists and turns,Unusual story,Vasu,Youth

Name: The Warrior Within
Description:
Born and brought up in Mumbai, India, Seema travelled the word early
\nin life while working as a flight attendant. She later decided to pursue
\nher passion and, to retain her independence she free-lanced with the
\nmedia—writing copy, for radio and television, for av,s and theatre, even
\nas she dabbled in radio presenting and production.
\nHer father being a well-known music composer of The Indian Film
\nIndustry, Seema was naturally drawn to the world of cinema. She is the
\nwriter, presenter and producer of a 13-CD album released by Saregama,
\n100 Years of Hindi Film Music.
\n
\nHer forthcoming works are:
\n
\nCatty KT: A girl adventure series wherein each book takes the reader through
\nthe life and adventures of Kajal and her celestial friend Muttoo, the
\ncloud!
\n
\nMonsoon Earth-Mee
\n: This is the story of Saanchi, a filmmaker. Vacillating between her present
\nin Mumbai, Mcloedganj, and Manali, and her past in Punjab, Saanchi
\nrelives her love story amidst the bloodied riots and the partition of India
\nand Pakistan. It is also the story of CJ, an ex-model and an advertising
\nhoncho who falls passionately in love with Saanchi.
\n
\nDeedara
\n: A mountain of a man, a man birthed from the fertile soils of Punjab,
\nDeedara is the life story of Dara Singh, and his transition from a poor
\nbut champion farmer, to a world champion wrestler, to a film star and
\nfinally to a Rajya Sabha MP.
Short description:
On a trek to the Himalayas, in search of the self, in search of Mahaavtaar Babaji, a superstar reminisces the last sixty years of his life. And herein
\nbegins the journey of a poor boy who rises from the ashes of poverty to the zenith of popularity, to become one of the highest paid film actors in the world.
\n
\nThe Warrior Within is the story of a star torn between the material and the spiritual. It tells of Rajinikanth’s journey into the realms of the unknown alongside his world of films; his spiritual leanings in contrast with his vices and his indiscretions; his meditative and monk-like demeanour versus his daredevilry, moodiness and volatility; as well as his philanthropy, his wit; his politics and his business acumen.
\n
\nDoes Shivaji find himself? Does he win the war—within, and without?
Tags: BecomeShakespeare.com,Life Journery,Non Fiction,Rajinikanth,Rajinikanth’s journey,Seema Sonik Alimchand,Shivaji Rao,Super Star,The Warrior Within
Attribute:Author: Seema Sonik Alimchand

Name: Flower in the Dust
Description:
The author lives in New Delhi.
\nShe is a post graduate from Delhi University and she acquired her M Phil degree (on the thesis, ‘The Home Rule Movement in Western India’) also from Delhi University. She had a long teaching career in Mater Dei School in Delhi where English and Social Studies were her teaching subjects. She did a year’s stint in journalism in Ahmedabad and has written a number of articles for the Indian Express. Her book, ‘The Ficus Tree & Other Stories’ is her first publication. It is a collection of stories that she has written from her interaction with students. It also contains stories on other topics, among them a discovery of an old ship wreckage which traces the story of a missing warship during the 1962 war with the Portuguese, a smalltime neighbourhood tailor who finds himself victimized by the police and there is also the story of a dissatisfied spirit that hovers over a long-forgotten graveyard of
\nmedieval times.
\nHer second publication is ‘Waging a Silent War.’It is her first novel, covering the period when revolutionary activity was rife in preindependent India. Though the novel is based on facts and some members of the family were involved in secret activities, much of the story has been written keeping the dramatic element in mind. Shaha has been a student of History and she takes a keen interest in reading fiction with a historical background. She is interested in art and culture and contributes some time in making the movement, Spic Macay, a success. She is an avid painter, having done a fine arts course in the J.J. School of Art and a spell at Triveni Kala Sangam. She has tried her hand at portrait painting but she prefers still life and painting plants of different varieties. At heart, she is a family person, hoping to have the children around as much as possible, though of course the exigencies of work keep them away from Delhi.
Short description:
Chameli, Chandani & Suresh are the true faces of the teeming millions of our society in which
\n
\nabandoned children are too many to cope with. This novel reflects the plight of these unfortunate
\n
\nsiblings whose misfortune it is to fall into the bands of anti-social elements.
\n
\nBy a quirk of fate they are lost to one another. Each one grows up in a bostile environment, being left to
\n
\nfend for herself or himself and to face the harsh realities of a cruel world. One is thrown into the sordid
\n
\ncompany of drug addicts, the other unwittingly lands in the clutches of
\n
\na gangster.
\n
\nThe story is replete with events. Chameli (later known as Elsie) is hoodwinked by the police into
\n
\nembarking on a journey to Hong Kong to trace her lover, the gangster. But the mysterious sun Yee On
\n
\nconfuse her and the notorious Xiexi Gang confounds her. And all these incident, together with the role
\n
\nof the police and the bureaucracy, are woven into a tale to create spice and adventure
Tags: Flower In the dust,General Fiction,Shaha Ghose,Street children
Attribute:Author: Shaha Ghosh

Name: My Dad, My Superhero!!!
Description:
Dhruvi K. Joshi is a student studying in 9th std,
\n
\nin Atul Vidyalaya, Valsad, Gujarat, India. She
\n
\nwas born on 17th February, 2001 and this is her
\n
\ndebut book- which she has written at the age of
\n
\nfourteen. Her hobbies are music and reading
\n
\nbooks. She also likes to participate in various
\n
\ndebates and competitions.
Short description:
The only superman I know is my dad!”
\n
\nIt is not a story about prince and princesses. It’s neither
\n
\na fairytale nor a fantasy. It’s a real life story; a story of
\n
\ndetermination, endurance and hard work. A story of
\n
\ninspiration and about inspiring others. It’s a story of a
\n
\nmarathoner. A story of a person who cannot quit.
\n
\nA story which began with a failure and resulted in a
\n
\ngreat success. A motivational story rather than a
\n
\nsuccess story.
\n
\nThis book is about my father who has encouraged and
\n
\ninspired me in a stupendous way. It’s a portrait of his
\n
\njourney of running, all the ups and downs, challenges,
\n
\nfailures and successes. It’s a mark of respect for my dad
\n
\nto whom I tell- “You are my hero!
Attribute:Author: Dhruvi Joshi

Name: Software Automation Testing  Secrets Revealed
Description:
Narayanan Palani, is an internationally known software test automation specialist and author of best-selling book 'Mobile Software Testing'. His remarkable career history consists of twelve international IT certifications, eight research papers, dual masters from world class universities, and mentoring job seeking professionals to get well paid automation jobs! He is inspired by the words of Swami Vivekananda , “Give me hundred truly dedicated people and I will change the face of this country”. His mission is to create employability among the talents rather than creating jobs! He help dedicated people across the countries to get an opportunity in Test Automation through his books.
\nHis open source projects can be downloaded for practice test automation at
\nhttps://github.com/narayananpalani/testautomation
\nuk.linkedin.com/in/narayananpalani/
Short description:
If you are a software testing professional, a developer, or a student looking forward to get a job in software industry, this book will help in creating automation test scripts for your web applications, this is the right guide for you! As a prerequisite, a basic knowledge in programming languages are expected, although any previous knowledge of testing tools are not necessary.
\nLearn for software testing job opportunities on how automation frameworks designed and understand how to overcome limitations of not knowing such testing tools in the past Setup and use automation tools for twelve different automation frameworks such as Selenium, HP UFT (formerly QTP),Ranorex, RFT and other famous automation testing tools Learn how to deal with the advanced features of automation tools which will be helpful for software testing job opportunities! Understand how the most wanted automation technologies can be designed such as excel automation frameworks which will help for testing projects of leading clients across US,UK. Practice the sample projects using clear instructions from each chapter and apply for relevant software testing jobs in your desired location!
Tags: Agile-Continuous Integration,Ant,AutoIT,Automation,Automation Framework,Automation Tester,Automation Testing,Automation tools,BDD,BecomeShakespeare.com,Behavior Driven Development,Computer Science,Cucumber,CucumberFramework,DBTesting,Eclipse,ETL Testing,Excel AutomationFramework,Excel Objects Automation,Excel VBA Automation,HP Quick Test Professional,HP Unified Functional Testing,IBM Rational Functional Test,Jason Phantom Ghost Driver,Jenkins,JUnit,Maven,MavenFramework,Narayanan Palani,Non Fiction,NUnit,QA,QTPFramework,Ranorex,RanorexFramework,Regression Testing,ReportUnit,RFT Framework,Selenium IDE,Selenium Web Driver,SeleniumFramework,SeleniumWebDriver,SOA Framework,SOA Testing,SOAP UI Automation,Software Automation Testing Secrets Revealed,software industry,software testing,Specflow,SpecflowFramework,SQL Testing,TDD,Team Foundation Server,Test Automation,Test Driven Development,Testing,Testing Tools,TestNG,Visual Studio,Visual Studio for Testing,WebDriver,XSLT Reporting
Attribute:Author: Narayanan Palani

Name: Aasha- the Inspiration
Description:
Sandhya Bachche
\nShe is a Marathi woman born and bought up in Kolhapur in a joint family. Since childhood, Sandhya has liked to write poems and articles in Marathi. She graduated from Kolhapur in B. Com with good marks and did her computer course and traveled abroad with her husband. Sandhya has observed certain facts and fiction of the Indian society and encrypts her observance in the form of a diary. She has got a very strong point and message in her mind that goes around changing the mentality treating a girl child in rural India. She met her friend who was a writer and presented her manuscript in Marathi, requesting her to translate. The translation was complete and both of them worked with each and every page of the novel called Aasha – the Inspiration as nomenclature by Sandhya.
\n
\nSweta Chakraborty
\n
\nA writer, a socialite and a traveler. She is a blogger and pens down each and every experience from her travel stories and her culinary experiences. Quite popular among her friends for her literary works, she met Sandhya Bachche at a social gathering and became friends with her. Sandhya approached her with her Marathi manuscript and the translation was done in the form of a book called Aasha – the Inspiration. Each and every page was translate+d to Hindi and explained which she later translated to English. The strong point in the story is the confidence of a village girl and Sweta is very much convinced about the storyline.
Short description:
Aasha – the Inspiration is the journey of Jyoti
\nPriya Malvankar, a Marathi girl born and educated in
\nsome B grade towns of India whose birth and upbringing
\nhover around a middle class family with lots of dos
\nand don’ts to follow; Like in 90 percent Indian families,
\nshe faced negligence and felt unimportant being a girl
\nchild. Luck strikes her door when she has the opportunity
\nto travel abroad with her husband, see the world
\nand serve at an NGO. She publishes a book ‘Aasha –
\nthe Inspiration’ which is about the struggle and journey
\nof a girl from orthodox society to the ultimate of
\nsuccess and fame. This book was written and published
\nas a fund raising initiative for the NGO she was working
\nfor. Her literary work got appreciated all over the
\nworld and she gets identified as an iconic symbol who
\nuplifts the stature of common woman. She admits in a
\nfelicitation program that that the motivation in life
\ncomes from her mother.
\nThis was an appeal to the masses of India, a message
\nnot to ignore a girl child, but instead to give her equal
\nopportunity and help her bloom like a flower amongst
\nthe society.
Tags: Aasha - The Inspiration,Books,Inspiration,Sandhya Bachche,Self help. motivation,Sweta Chakraborty
Attribute:Author: Sandhya Bachche & Sweta Chakraborty

Name: Moonwalker
Description:
Virendra Shahaney was born in Jabalpur, India. He studied engineering and then steered his life towards a creative profession. Today he is a successful writer and producer in Indian Television Industry with popular shows like CID, Uttaran, Bidaai, Adaalat to his credit.
\nThis is his debut novel.
Short description:
On July 20, 1969, two significant events occurred in this world. The first one took place on a distant rock called Moon as Neil Armstrong an American astronaut set his country’s flag on it.
