The second event happened inside the head of a little boy in Bihar, India. He pictured an Indian tricolor on the surface of the moon. Little did he know that his life was about to change forever.
\n
\nNine-year-old Raghu in Gardhanibagh, Bihar is a curious child. He likes school but he prefers playing around railway tracks. One day he asks his father, “If Americans can go to the Moon, why can’t we?” His father simply tells him stop daydreaming and focus on studies. His brothers and mates in school think he is crazy. This is the start of an extraordinary journey through the corridors of IIT, the DRDL and ISRO where he chases his passion, meets and marries his love Aarti, finds a best friend in Vinayak, invents his dream machine and gets caught in a storm of jealousy, deceit and betrayal that threatens the very spirit of his dream.
\n
\nThis 45-year long roller coaster of life will transform little Raghu into Dr. Raghav Manohar, a man, a legend. But will he succeed in his mission to put Indians on the moon or will the forces of fate land him somewhere else?
\nEnjoy this gripping tale of passion, love and friendship. Moonwalker will strike a chord with you.
Attribute:Author: Virendra Shahaney

Name: That's How I Knew Love
Description:
Not all bankers are just financial advisors – some
\nhave stories to tell. Born in Jaipur, Shelly Mittal loves
\nadventure sports and travelling. She finds peace in
\nnature, is a dog-lover and a staunch opponent of
\ncasteism and racism. Her family and friends are the
\nmost important in her life. Currently she is working as
\nan officer at the Bank of Baroda and That’s how I knew
\nlove is her debut novel.
Short description:
Most love stories begin like….
\nBoy loves girl and girl eventually falls for the boy.
\nBut for Shivali’s its different, Love for her is just another set of rules. Long distance is a big no.
\nCheat on her, be prepared to die. But…
\nDestiny had its own plans.
\nShe loved Rudra but was adamant to accept.
\nHad he cheated on her?
\nNo matter how much ever she tried to forget him, she was unaware that all of it would one day come back to haunt her…
\nWill she ever know the truth?
\nWill she ever express her love or has she really moved on ?
\nOr was it just from her figment of imagination?
\nWhere will destiny take them….?
Tags: college love story,first love,Love story,new bestsellers.,new indian writers,Romantic Fiction,shelly mittal,teenage novels,that's how i knew love
Attribute:Author: Shelly mittal

Name: Bhrigusutra  -An Ancient Asset of India
Description:
Dr. Pt. Jitendra Vyas had written & edited many books exploring different sections of this subject. Dr. Vyas doing research in astrology subject since 15 years. Dr. Vyas has presented his researches in many international conferences worldwide and had been published in many famous research journals. He has served as a columnist in many newspapers since many years. He has done an astonishing research in
\nGlobal Disaster, Manuscripts, Predictive Astrology, Shares Markets, Numerology, Environmental Vastu, Yantra-Karm-Kand, Palmistry and Medical Astrology.
Short description:
After the incident of testing trinity in my life, I have decided to edit this famous manuscript of Maharishi Bhrigu, to help the native.
\nBhrigusutra is believed to be the first book of its kind in the field of Vedic Astrology which extensively lies down the predictions of all the nine planets when positioned in each house, for all the twelve houses from the Ascendant with specific reference to exaltation, debilitation and own house of planets.
\nThis book Bhrigusutra-An ancient asset of India is unique in telling the facts about one’s horoscope. This book elaborates the ‘Rajyogas’and ‘Phalas’ like health, wealth-Luxury, Brother-sister, parents, Education, Enemy, marriage, love, destiny, job, income, age etc associated with the position of planets in twelve houses of Birth chart.
Tags: Aquarious,Aries,BecomeShakespeare.com,Bhrigusutra- An Ancient Asset of India,Birth Chart,Cancer,Capricon,Dashas,Destiny,Dhanyogas,Dr. Jitendra Vyas,Health,Income,Jemini,Job,Jupiter,Kundli,Leo,Libra,Love affair,Luxury,Manglik,Marrige,Mars,Mercury,Moon,Phalas,Pisces.,Pitra Doshas,Planets,Prediction,Rahu-Ketu,Rajyagas,Sagittarious,Saturn,Scorpio,Slokas,Sun,Taurus,Twelve houses,Vedic Astrology,Venus,Virgo,Wealth
Attribute:Author: Dr Jitendra Vyas

Name: Panchnad
Description:
C. L. Dhamija, after retirement in 1993, as a lecturer in English from D.A.V. College, Chandigarh, became a full time writer and speaker on Spirituality.
\nIn his thirties, he started writing stories for children. His children, Deepti and Aasheesh, inspired him with their constant inquisitive prattle: “What? When? Where? Why? Who?”
\nLater, following his Gurbani inheritance, he turned to writing on Guru Nanak Dev ji and Japji Sahib. Health permitting, he has decided to follow this book with writings on Gurbani, particularly for children from all backgrounds so that they remember: 'We are the children of the same God!’
\nThe curse of killings in the name of Ishwar, God, Allah and Waheguru continues in the world but the author believes that by choice, we are able to live in comfort, a life of rich spirituality and speak out aloud:
\n
\n“Sabna Jian Ka Ikko Daata So Mein Vissar Na Jaie
Short description: Considering the kind of age we live in, it comes as no surprise when people of all ages turn to spirituality for sustenance. The future stands conquered by science as well as spirituality. Once we look beyond the mystique of so much of religion, its spirituality begins to shine straight into our souls. The author is one such being who has perceived the basic ground reality of the spirituality that lies safely hidden under all the trappings of religion. Read on to know the evolutionary struggle of a Highly Evolved Being.
Tags: awakened,Bala,Become Shakespeare,bliss,C.L.Dhamija,charged,cleansing,deep,development,eternal,evolution,experience,ghost,humility,ignorance,infinite,inner light,Japji Sahib,joy,Keywords - Guru Nanak Dev ji,linked,manifestation,Mardana,message,mound,Mystery,outburst,pain,Panchnad,peace,phenomena,previous,Renowned figure,saint,Sarpanch,Tapasvi,uplifting,wonderful,Yogi
Attribute:Author: C.L.Dhamija

Name: The Heart That Beats for you
Description:
Some day someone is going to look at you like you are the best
\nthing in this world. You shall find the one who will watch every
\nsunrise with you. That someone will make you realize what is
\ntrue love.
\nThere is always a reason we meet people. Either we need to
\nchange their life or we are the one to change theirs. In this case,
\nAbhinav’s life changed after meeting love of his life. This inspiring
\nstory is based on the story of a person I had spent lot of time
\nwith. I had learnt every emotion of that boy and tried to put it on
\npaper.
\nThis realistic saga will touch the minds and hearts of many
\npeople those who believe that there is somebody out there just
\nfor them, that they exist to be there for that somebody.
\nThis story describes the up’s and down’s of love and how only
\nthe simple four letter word make it possible to cross every mild
\nstone it come across.
\nI was worried about the boy from whom I was inspired to
\nwrite down his tale until he said “you never know how strong you
\nare, until being strong is the only choice you have
Short description:
Had any one ever asked you - what it feels
\nlike when your heart just gets numb forever?
\nSome stories don’t have happy endings......... No one wants to be romeo and Juliet,
\nlike Cinderella and price charming or even Barbie or ken. Every one wants to make their own story.
\nThis was one of the most touching stories I came across with,
\nwhen the man narrated his past with his
\ntears clinging on his eyes, I was anxious too.
\nIt was when I asked him, how do you survive? And he said “because my heart still beats for her
Tags: Abhinav Mahire,BecomeShakespeare.com,Love story,The Heart That Beats for you
Attribute:Author: Abhinav Mahire

Name: A Darling in your fifties
Description:
Nagalakshmi M G., also known as Ashmi is a writer, educator, and counsellor. After having worked as a lecturer in English for over twenty five years in Bangalore, she took voluntary retirement in the year 2001 to pursue her passion for writing. She did her Bachelor of Arts from Kerala University and pursued a Master’s degree in English language and Literature at Jnana Bharathi (Bangalore University). Additionally, she has a Degree in M.Phil, and also went on to fulfil her dream of getting a Post Graduate Diploma in Journalism and in ‘Proficiency in Counselling’ from Bharatiya Vidya Bhawan and The Theological College respectively.
\nShe has published light reads in Femina and The Indian
\nExpress. ‘A Darling in Your fifties’ is her first work of
\nfiction. Although a staunch Bangalorean, she currently
\nlives in Pune with her family.
Short description: Arjun has disowned his wife, Neema. She has grown to hate her tormentor, her husband, yet knows a divorced woman in India is a scandal and she is trapped. With a malicious mother on the other end, she has nowhere to go. When Arjun, aided and abetted by his mother in law, escalates his attempts to eliminate Neema, she holds her peace, sinks into the fantasy of Bollywood movies, and later empowered by the return of her long-lost friends finds the strength to go in search of a new life
Attribute:Author: Ashmi

Name: Sachin Tendulkar-The Two Decades of Happiness
Description: My name is Pratik Pravin Kulkarni. I have done B.E. In Mechanical Engineering and currently persuing MBA+ PGPM Degree from IBS Mumbai. Sky is not just the limit if you dedicate yourself to achieve what you want to do with 100% of Passion. That is what I have done to achieve my dream to become a writer and now I consider myself as a fortunate Indian to write and publish the Book on one of the most Loved, Respected and the only person who is treated as a GOD in such a Devoted Country.
Short description:
From 18th Century to 21st Century….every
\nplayer who played and is playing the
\ngame of Cricket is not remembered by how
\nhe/she is the player is? ; They are remembered
\nby how they played, what they have
\ndone and how they are serving the game of
\ncricket……
\nIt was, It Is and It will always be about
\nCricket….
\nI just want to serve Cricket to the fullest.
\nMy love towards Cricket will never die. My
\nlove towards the Human Being, the
\nplayer, the Cricketer-Mr.Sachin R. Tendulkar
\nwill always be there; no matter
\nwhat happen in my life.
\nA true Sir Sachin R. Tendulkar Fan……..
Tags: BecomeShakespeare.com,Pratik Pravin Kulkarni,Sachin Tendulkar-The Two Decades of Happiness,Sports
Attribute:Author: Pratik Pravin Kulkarni

Name: Hiraeth: First Love First Contact
Description:
Taksh Gupta is a graduate from SGTB Khalsa College. He has been an all-round performer since childhood inclusive of distinction in academics, olympiads, sports, abacus and extra-curricular activities. He is also a graduate in music. He is the founder director of IITIIMShaadi.com, a niche matrimonial website. He is currently pursuing Masters in Global Business from SP Jain School of Global Management.
\nEmail: takshgupta@gmail.com.
\n
\nAkhil Ahuja is a graduate from Shaheed Sukhdev College of Business Studies (CBS). He has been a consistent topper for many years in school and in commerce olympiads. He is an avid reader, coffee lover and a passionate cricket follower. He is currently pursuing Post Graduate Diploma in Management (PGDM) from SP Jain Institute of Management and Research. Email: akhilahuja1811@yahoo.com.
\nThe duo has another title to their names, Love @ 365 Kmph.
Short description:
What supposedly troubles man the most is the fear of the unknown.
\nHowever, what transcends that is a nightmare, where things are so incredibly
\nfrightening that you hope that it was just that – a nightmare –
\nbut there’s a part of you which knows that it is a part of your existence.
\nNikhil, a young guy loaded with responsibilities, and his girlfriend,
\nSaesha, are trapped in this unenviable situation. Eerily, their worst
\nnightmare is essentially the same: A cold-blooded, red-eyed freak chasing
\nthem, with a resolute obsession to slay their souls. The two try to
\npass this as coincidence, until the day things start falling apart. In a
\nbizzare turn of events, Saesha gets abducted and returns with no memory
\nof Nikhil.
\nWeighing the odds of Saesha teaming up with the aliens, Nikhil has to
\nmake a choice between his beliefs and the world’s, which is under
\nsiege. Biological weapons are unleashed, as a 623-year-old intergalactic
\nrivalry is revived. Governments brainstorm together, there are UN
\nmeets and nuclear weapons are aggregated. Eventually, war breaks.
\nThe novel depicts Nikhil’s journey as he sets out to save his love,
\nwhich may also be the key to saving the world.
Tags: Akhil Ahuja,Alien Invasion,BecomeShakespeare.com,Extra terrestrials,Hiraeth: First Love First Contact,love,Nikhil,Novel,Romance,Saesha,Science Fiction,Taksh Gupta,UFOs,War
Attribute:Author: Taksh Gupta & Akhil Ahuja

Name: A journey to 1000 heavens
Description: The Author is currently working in a media company and is graduated in BMM from Somaiya College , Mumbai . Further he is keenly interested in reading and writing books of genre of ancient mythological magical fantasy like Harry Potter , Ramayana , Mahabharata , Chronicles of Narnia etc. Also he lives in Dombivili , Mumbai , India .
Short description: The Story of the book can be viewed by the reader as a completely different scene of unseen secret worlds which will take him to the dreaming tour of Truth , Mysteries , Adventures , Secrets Knowledge , Powers , Intelligence and Time stopping moments . The book is specially designed for the people whose beta mind is still active , others all who think very practically and logically will not be able to unlock the secret worlds of this book
Attribute:Author: Mayur Bhanushali

Name: Wings Of Rhapsody
Description:
I think of myself as a pirouetting spirit, a global citizen having absorbed into my being a range of cultures over the years. This book of Poems is a journey of self-discovery.
\nI juggle multiple roles in my present life, fighting for space and time to fit in my routine the chaotic creative thoughts churning constantly in my mind. Thoughts which at times emerge as words and rhymes popping up unexpectedly catching me unawares. I am a full time working Mom, mother of two little boys, a Banking IT professional with over two decades dedicated to Professional career.
\nA resident of Mumbai, India, my roots are from the ancient land of “Naura” now known as Kannur (Cannanore), Malabar region of Kerala. Kannur the land of lores and looms is also called the ‘Crown of Kerala’. State of Kerala is known as Gods Own Country and verily so. Kannur is a mystical land, with a liberal sprinkling of many temples large and small, small ‘kavus’ shrines open to nature and nature worships, and a range of ancient tribal art and dance forms. The most famous being the colorful enacted prayer performance and storytelling - ‘Theyyam festivals’ ritualistic dancing to the beat of drums held in each temple for several days and weeks witnessing which has kindled my esoteric interests in nature and spirituality.
\nBeing around and reading/discussing about crystals, mountains, flowers, higher dimensions, space travels, temples and mythology are my key areas of interest and my channel for finding my inner space and self. My free time, I get by bursting into more frenzied activities which is mainly travelling, visiting places soaking in nature. My friends and family tell me, they love me for my energy, undying quest to visit and travel and then share these experiences.
\nI did my post-graduation in Science and over the years have acquired a few additional degrees in Management and Information Technology subjects to assist my job functions. These days my vocabulary usage is limited to professional and IT related discussions, writing technical notes and presentations.
\nThe seeds for Poetry and poetry appreciation were sown in my early childhood, with the practice of reciting daily prayers and Hindu shlokas supervised and encouraged by my grandparents. Especially so during our visits to Kannur during long summer holidays, gathering with cousins in the evenings around the fully lit ‘Vellaku’ (Diya) and reciting our prayers with the elders correcting the pronunciations and emphasizing the rhythmic sing song delivery of prayers.
\nLater by my teachers of KendriyaVidyalayas, constantly encouraging my participation in poetry recitation competitions in multiple languages English, Hindi and Sanskrit. I began writing Poetry in my seventh grade a few of them made their way into School magazines. However eventually life caught up and my writings became sporadic thanks to long working hours and other demands.
\nGrowing up as an Airforce child, I have travelled extensively within India absorbing India’s myriad hues and cultures. Over the years thanks to my IT career, I gained exposures to varied experiences, cultures and cuisines at both domestic and international locations mainly in USA travelling from East to West based on Company and project requirements.
\nThe good side of it, I thoroughly enjoyed travelling the beautiful expanse of USA countryside, the majestic mountains and the wide plains. Experiencing snow, climbing mountains laden with snow, climbing the glacier of Mount Rainier were some of my most cherished and exhilarating experiences being a tropics born and bred Indian girl.
\nThe trigger for embarking on poetry as a means of expression restarted last year in September 2015 with the images of the little baby boy washed up ashore the Aegean sea. Since then I find myself scribbling away, at times like someone possessed mostly writing my thoughts out on my cell as I commute or late at nights after my kids have gone to bed. I felt the need to expand my horizons and share my muse with a wider set of audience and hence the idea of putting them together in the form of poetry book emerged.
\n‘My poems are expressions of wonder, an appreciation of nature in her myriad colors and forms and motivational introspections on human and nature events occurring around us silently which we typically tend to miss in our self absorbed fast lives.’ - Seema
\n
\nContact: Email: Seemakj@yahoo.com
\nTwitter: @seemakj24
\nPages and Blogs: https:
\n//en-gb.facebook.com/seema.jayaraman.1
\nFacebook Group: Mystic Verses
\nhttps://www.facebook.com/groups/953475531415211/
\n
\nFacebook Page: Breaking Free - Poems https://www.facebook. com/Breaking-Free-Poems-1525189397811952/
\nwww.poemhunter.com/Seema Jayaraman
\nwww.facebook/breaking free poems
\nwww.facebook/flights to freedom poems
Short description:
Wings Of Rhapsody Wings Of Rhapsody - A Dalliance Of Poems is an anthology of poems
\nwritten by Mumbai based poetess Ms. Seema K Jayaraman. This
\ncollection is an eclectic mix of poems written over a period of three
\ndecades. Seema is a visual artist painting with words.
\n
\n'Seema writes with a naturalistic, lyrical style, her work on the page begs to be read
\naloud. Her work hearkens to a romantic tradition, drawing on landscape and nature
\nher craft is a contemporary one.’
\n
\n- Guest Curator Ciarán Hodgers, Leaveners’ ‘Poets’ Corner’ UK introduces
\nSeema K Jayaraman as showcased Poet of the month December 2015.
\n
\n'Seema's poems are like photographs in words, one can open the book to any page
\nfor a feeling of true human history. lots of love and best wishes for the book!,
\n-Mana (Spiritual healer, Popular author of Soul Science)
\n
\n'Seema's poems sometimes feel like song, they have a beat, some are mystical..'
\n- Aneish Kumar (MD, BONY, Mumbai)
\n
\n'Seema's poems are thought- provoking, they churn you up with lucid images and
\nstrong emotions. A book of poems which heals. I loved it.' Keep writing.....and
\nhealing...Love.’
\n-Dr Trupti Jayin (Clinical psychologist, PLR expert)
\n
\n'Seema, a poet / poetess like you only come around every 100 years or more, this is
\nyour star, your destiny. Your ink is indeed blessed.'
\n- John Kavangah, UK (Poet, Author, Critic)
\n
\n'Mesmerising! Original and ingenious crafting of words and images.
\nDelight to read and savor.'
\n- Oormila V Prahlad, Australia (Artist, Poetess and Accomplished Pianist)
Attribute:Author: Seema K Jayaraman

Name: Then came you
Description:
Mahak Goel is a passionate girl who loves to spend her
\ntime, reading and writing novels. She is a blogger with
\ntwo blogs of her own and can be found on major writing
\nsites. Initially, she started writing on India-forums and
\nthe responses made her realise her capability. Since
\nthen, she took her fling for writing seriously and wrote
\nmany things. Writing for her, means life. She loves
\nspinning a web of tales and immerse herself in the
\ncharacter’s world.
\nShe is also fond of singing and painting. Having done
\nMasters in Journalism, she is ready to set foot in the
\npractical arena of life. She loves spending time with her
\nfamily and playing games with her father.
\n“Then Came You.. and changed my life forever” is
\nher first published novel and she hopes to write many
\nmore.
\nYou can connect with her by liking her Facebook page,
\n“The Fragrance Of Life”, or send her the feedback on
\n“writer.mahak@gmail.com
Short description:
There is an extraordinary love story in every story.
\nThat’s what they say, right?
\nSamidha Mittal is a straight A’s kind of girl who has an amazing group of friends who support her and love her. But she also has a dark secret in her past that no one except her best friend, Mayank, knows about. It’s a kind of secret that prevents her from falling in love with anyone and makes her distrustful towards guys in general.
\nYet, she can’t seem to find her senses when she is around Aditya Agarwal. But even though she develops this silly kind of crush on her new friend, she believes that she isn’t proper for him and that he deserves better. Now, would Aditya be able to make her open up to him and fall for her or would her first ever crush be crushed?
\n“Then Came You” is an emotionally gripping, bitter-sweet love story of Samidha Mittal and Aditya Agarwal, two people who once again prove the fact that love can overcome everything. Love always wins. True love can change lives and people. Love isn’t judgmental and can overcome every hurdle thrown on its way. If there is true love, it cannot be bound by any barriers.
Attribute:Author: Mahak Goel

Name: Tale o' 12
Description: Biranchi N Acharya is a competent engineer by profession and habituated blogger and writer by passion. As an ardent political/social observer he is a regular contributor to various online political and social platforms that publish articles. His various articles/blogs ranging from opinions on politics, current affairs, socio-economic issues, religion and spiritual thoughts have been published on different platforms and highly appreciated by readers at large. Llots of his anecdotes also based on real life experiences mostly in story telling style posted in various free blogging sites and has earned him loads of reader’s accolades. ‘Encounter with Wisdom’ is the first book of the author published in December 2014. ‘Tale O’ 12’ is his second book. Author can be contacted through infobnacharya@gmail.com
Short description:
Every life event is a story. In fact every moment of our life is part of a story being happened. We always ignore those because we think stories have no connection to real life happenings. But when we read stories or fictions suddenly we connect ourselves to the story-line or some of the characters emotionally or otherwise. That’s why stories always fascinate us, entertain us & give us some lessons of life.
\n
\n‘Tale O’ 12’ is a collection of twelve stories inspired from real life events written in a fictional narrative. One would definitely connect to the characters of the stories someway or other because all the stories have something that’s related to everyone’s life.
Attribute:Author: Biranchi Narayan Acharya

Name: Fourteen  Urban Folklore
Description: Ranjani R, is B.E. in Electrical from Mumbai University currently working with a manufacturing unit in Mumbai. She resides with her Parents and Grandmother. She is a crazy person with lots of dreams, small time singer, loves hanging with friends, doesn’t like monotony, an avid reader and a mediocre writer who aspires to become a good novelist and will keep writing till the time she can.
Short description:
He may be your next door neighbour, she may be your colleague or it may be leafless tree at the corner of your street…Everyone sings life in his own style.
\nPlotted in urban backdrop are Fourteen stories, Countless emotions, untold perceptions and myriads of people, we often fail to observe in daily life have been portrayed with minute detailing. It limns a real world we often fail to understand and makes us think on a deeper level.
Attribute:Author: Ranjani Ramachandran

Name: Empty souls
Description:
A successful 32 year old management executive Rahul Singh has always
\nbeen inclined more towards appeasing his creative instinct of writing
\nstories. Drawing inspiration from the likes of Alfred Hitchcock , he’s
\nfinally decided to begin his writing career with his first novel “Empty
\nSouls”. His idea of writing stories is to dig deep into the world of
\nimmorality which leads to some of the most thrilling stories which
\naccording to him is the ‘most fascinating genre in the art of story writing’.
\nWith “Empty Souls” Rahul takes the plunge into the fascinating world
\nof stories which is often cultivated by the strange true life events which
\nkeep happening in the world around us.
Short description:
On a night when Mumbai’s streets are partially submerged by
\nthunderous rains Ahmed a suicidal cop Investigates the sensational
\nmurder of a yesteryear starlet Aisha who’s been brutally killed by her
\nhusband Armaan. As he goes deeper into the murky investigation
\nAhmed goes down the path of moral decay falling in love with a young
\njournalist Saloni whose only ambition is to become a sensation in the
\nworld of journalism. Was Aisha indeed murdered by her husband in a
\ncrime of passion or was there more than meets the eye? Empty Souls
\ntakes the readers into the world of fallen morals where greed, lust &
\ndeceit are the virtues that guide the characters to their sinister actions.
Attribute:Author: Rahul Singh

Name: Rain drops
Description:
Kamalakar Gune has served in the Logistics Branch of the Indian Air Force for Twenty Four years, mostly on Fighter and Bomber Bases along the Pakistan Border. He also served in the High Commission of India, London (UK) for over Five years as an Indian Air Force Representative.
\nOn retirement in the rank of Wing Commander, he had a Business Career of Fifteen years in Engineering Ancillary Unit, Electrical Installations and Farming. He is widely travelled in Britain, Europe, USA, Thailand, Singapore, Malaysia and Hong Kong apart from all parts of India. His Hobbies include Reading, Writing, Music, Wines Collection & Testing and the Movies.
\nContact: - Email ID: gunekb@yahoo.com
\nMobile:+ 91 9822 412 995
Short description:
Rain Drops “written by Kamalakar Gune, is a Collection of Short Essays, Anecdotes and Nostalgia. These are Authors reflections, narrations and opinions on experiences, events and situations encountered by him during his life.
\nThese narratives indicate Author`s keen observations ,off-beat perceptions , sense of humor and his penchant for taking understated digs at contradictions in human life .His story telling style is engaging and persuasive. The Topics covered are random and cover a wide range of subjects which will give Readers a kind of “Surfing “experience.
\nSurely, the Readers will find “Rain Drops “Cool, Refreshing and Stimulating.
Attribute:Author: Kamlakar Gune

Name: Your best judge is you
Description:
I am a simple person who loves to enjoy the little things in life. I
\nfeel writing is the best way to express myself. When not writing,
\nI love cooking food, gardening, practicing yoga, and painting. I
\nbelieve that life is a wonderful gift to make dreams come true.
Short description:
Not every poor person is a thief
\nNot every good face has a good heart
\nNot every religious person is actually religious
\n
\nIt is a book about you. How people judge you. How to stop looking with the borrowed eyes. Why you are your best judge.
Tags: BecomeShakespeare.com,Seema singh,Your best judge is you
Attribute:Author: Seema singh

Name: Ghalib Unplugged - A prose-poetic chronicle
Description:
A Copywriter by profession, a poet by passion, an author by chance, a weekend filmmaker by choice, a film review writer by obsession, a Barista by qualification, a bookworm by appetite.
\n
\nYou can connect with him at prakashgowdamail@gmail.com, www.prakashgowda.wordpress.com or follow on Twitter @prakashgowda
Short description: Ghalib Unplugged is a prose-poetic chronicle of a fictional poet who insists upon calling himself 'Ghalib'. The story chronicles his journey from a college student to a popular name at Srishti Theatre Café, Mumbai, where he spends the rest of his life. The book is about his 'performance' at Srishti Theatre, where he is narrating his story to his 'audience'. Laced with dollops of poetry, this book is based on the thought: What if Mirza Ghalib were alive in our times?
Tags: Ahmedabad Literature Festival,book,chronicle,ebook,Ghalib Unplugged,Gujarat,Gulzar,India,Kindle,literature,Mirza Ghalib,poetry,Prakash Gowda,prose,Sathya Saran,Vadodara
Attribute:Author: Prakash gowda

Name: Rendezvous
Description:
Having brought up in suburbs of Mumbai, she did
\nher engineering from one of the prestigious college
\nin Mumbai. She is currently working in MNC, Navi
\nMumbai. The total Amchi Mumbai girl, she adores desi
\nburger (vada pav) like anything.
\nMumbai is city which never sleeps. Mumbai has witnessed
\nmany incidents and brave it all. The city inspires her to
\nfollow her dream and to never give up no matter how
\nhard it goes.
Short description:
Life is a journey. A journey where every relation is chosen by God except one relationship and that is friendship. This story is about four friends Akash, Naina ,Shruti and Arun. They were partner in crime for all the adventures. They cherished their friendship.
\nAkash who “never meant to fall in love” kind of guy falls for Naina on the first day of engineering college. Naina considers Akash as true friend. Akash did propose to Naina but destiny has planned something else for Akash. Naina was not part of Akash life.
\nIs love all about owning that person or having that person in life? What if your friend is in trouble and needs you. Will you go that extra mile??
\nDiscover with Akash the story of friendship and love.
\n“Pyaar karo itni siddhat se khud pyaar ko aapke pyaar par naaz ho jaye
\nHo iss pyaar ki Umar itni ki nafrat ko bhi aitraaz Ho jaye
Attribute:Author: Abhilasha S

Name: Self Manage And Reverse Your Diabetes
Description:
DR. GEETA SUNDAR M.D
\nMedical consultant, Diabetologist and author
\nI did my Indian school certificate (formerly senior
\nCambridge) from St. Joseph’s convent Jabalpur with
\nmerit in English literature. I was always interested in
\nwriting, and won several prizes for essay and prose both
\nin school and college. Later I joined MBBS and went on
\nto do my post graduation in medicine. Passed WHO
\nrecognised certificate course in Diabetes. I have been
\npracticing as a consultant in medicine for more than
\n30 years, and as Diabetologist for five years. In 2002 I
\nstarted writing, first health books and then fiction.
\nOther activities
\nRegular contributor to Times wellness
\nChief medical advisor to ‘India online health’
\nCorporate lecturer.
\nCONTACT
\nhealthauthorpune@gmail.com
\nsundar.geeta@gmail.com
Short description: This book equips the reader with knowledge of every aspect of Diabetes needed by a Diabetic patient in simple language with excellent illustrations. After reading the book the reader will be able to manage 60% of his Diabetes on his own and even attempt to reverse it.
Tags: Bariartic surgery in Diabetes,Diabetes and Pregnancy,Diet in Diabetes,Exercise in Diabetes,Eye complications in Diabetes,Foot care in Diabetes,GDM,Kidney in Diabetes,Reverse your Diabetes,Self manage your Diabetes,Types of Diabetes,Understand Diabetes
Attribute:Author: Dr. Geeta sundar

Name: Flying high on the wings of love
Description:
Manish Kumar is author of his debut novel Flying High on the Wings of Love, lives in Bangalore. He has completed his engineering education from M.P and currently working in IT Industry - IBM over the past 5 years, is very keen about writing true stories specially inspired from ones life, got aspired of writing from his own life when and where he felt challenges was thrown by life and it was hard to decide to hold a pen and start writing. That gives a joy to start writing and completed his first novel.”
\nWebsite : www.authormanish.com
\nFacebook page : http://facebook.com/manish.official.fanpage
\nTwitter : https://twitter.com/manishkum22/
\nemail : manish.iws@gmail.com
Short description:
Love is redefined when you feel it ….
\nThis is a story of shattered dreams and redemption, of fear and fortitude and above all, a story of the indomitable human will, how one unassuming person from a modest background deals with the challenges randomly thrown at him by Life. All it happened in love …
\n
\nWhen a school student (later he finds his identity as a writer) falls in love with a girl (he called her “G” as he saw God in her eyes) from a very conservative background. He realize little impact on lives, If she doesn't muster up the courage to marry him, what are the emotional consequences of her fear? If she is willing to go against her family's dictates and marry him, what will be the aftermath?
\n
\nAs if this weren't enough of a dilemma to grapple with, he also has to figure out a way to build a secure life for himself and his family. Coming from an economically difficult background, he cannot afford to play at dreaming his dreams, and chasing them endlessly. He has to focus on getting a good job and creating some stability for himself and his loved ones. Does he succeed in doing this? Love always rewards some special gifts..
Tags: Flying high on the wings of love,Love story,manish,Manish kumar,story book,Youth
Attribute:Author: Manish Kumar

Name: Dark and Days
Description: I'm a 16 year old teenager, I love to write and read. I'm myself is into reading a lot of books. I must tell poetries are the beauty of literature. Now days people aren't reading a lot of poetries but if you will read my book you will experience something which might help you redeem yourself. I'm sick enough to be called sick , form last seven years hospitals are just like my second home. I'm not afraid of fears because I know they're inside me hidden powering my beast and my angels will fight and protect me till the end.. Just being poetic again. I hope you guys enjoy reading my metaphor "dark and days" I hope reading my poetries might make realise yours . Right now I'm a school drop out because of my medical issues you can visit my twitter account @S15nov for my daily thoughts and read my blog for life lessons I write .
Short description:
DARK AND DAYS”
\nIs a phrase which stands for fear, fear is history of present in future , each one of us is afraid of something or someone but according to me we fear a common being. I want to you know who and the only possible way is by reading “DARK AND DAYS” .
\nStart a poetic journey of abstractions xing xes of multiple emotions, let me drive you to different stations of various emotions. Few of them might be vicious but can't deny many are still bliss. This book is inspirational, women empowering and can denitely the help you with self discovery. I'm also trying to revive the value of poetries in literature and in the lives of young people and teens. The bonus stories are a bit of the raconteur in me ; one of the short story mansions how the mega star Shahrukh Khan unknowingly is a inspiration of my inspiration.
Attribute:Author: Stuti Mishra

Name: Crazigasm
Description: Jaikishan Hirani, a pantheist and an Instrumentation and Control engineer is an Amdavadi, who always takes help of a pen and a paper in trying to make this complicated life simpler. Crazigasm is his second book after his debut novel Corruption in Construction. Born and brought up in a joint family, he cherishes the family talks and warm relationships over dinner. A movies and TV series enthusiast and a nocturnal writer, he loves to spend time with his wife and nature together.
Short description: Rishabh is a writer with sharp observations. Angel is a con artist who cons people of their miseries. Together they form a power couple who go on a rampage to create a wild fire of positivity in their surroundings.
Attribute:Author: JK Hirani

Name: A chaotic NRI
Description:
He was a software engineer a few years back, before he embraced the full time writing career. Now, he writes novels, which deals with humor, romance, and inspiration. The aim of his every book is to bring some fundamental change in everyone’s life to achieve their dreams.
\n
\nYou can contact him at https://karthickhemabushanam.wordpress.com/
\nAnd through twitter handle @phkarthick
\n
Short description:
In cold winter, Sushil is fed up with an explosive software job, his onsite journey in NewYork plummets with his technical blunders, his love affair with Tanu broke up in wild atrocity, and his reporting staff stab at his back with false allegations. Life pricks him at every step. Finally depression knocks him down and suddenly he is jobless.
\n
\nOnce a high salary package holder, now scraping his butt on the couch, the burning aspiration to win is engulfing him, he joins hands with his old friends, and start a new software company. Failure welcomes them everywhere they go. Only failures, nothing else. Penniless boys go fasting. But their resolve to succeed never fails. Would they win despite their struggles and constant impediments in their path?
\n

Name: A FAILURE'S LOVE STORY "…but not a failure love story It's all about love, career and life…
Description:
Hi,
\nI’m Rangaiah Chituprolu, fortunately the author of this book.
\nI’ve been a long time reader of English novels, primarily Chetan Bhagat’s, who has been my inspiration and motivation towards writing. ‘A Failure’s Love Story’ is my first book. Being a perfect blend of the most immiscible things like family emotions, science and social issues, I believe that this will be liked by all genre of public.
\nI have an M.Pharm tagged to my name. The entire story runs in the backdrop of Pharmacy which will be really fresh to the readers as it has some interesting scientific facts. It took me a couple of years to complete my story. My heart and soul travelled with every character of my story and I love all of them. Similar to the protagonist, I’m also a novice when it comes to writing. To be frank I’m no‘thing’ but every great author makes a start from this ‘thing’ and I am hoping this to be mine.
\n
Short description:
Snigdesh Dixit, part of a middle class joint family, has an extreme ardor towards Pharmacy and completes his post graduation. A wonderful job, provide service to the needy, lovely and happy future with his Gujarati girl friend, ‘Sukhanya’, was all in his mind. Little was he aware that also has a big load of struggle to undergo. This struggled phase helped him to understand the real meaning of life, family and world. It becomes an arduous task for him to settle in his life and to tackle with two entirely different families against the money, castes, customs, cultures and traditions. How he sort out the issues forms rest of the story.
\n

Name: Ambition + Confusion = Realization
Description:
Sriram is an award winning best-selling author, renowned for his writing abilities”. 
\nWell, apparently, the author of this book, Sriram, was dreaming while penning that sentence. In reality he is one of the most amateur authors India has ever seen. He was working in IT, did MBA to work in Finance. Now that he is working in Finance, is doing what not, to work in IT. He doesn’t believe in spending much for mobiles, but recently bought Apple iPhone X. He is a foodie, but doesn’t like non-vegetarian. He loves driving, but doesn’t like travelling. However, he is extremely clear about one thing, that he is confused!!
\n
Short description:
Suresh suffers from a very serious disease, a desire to be successful. So, he sets about taking the GRE test and gets selected in TCS during campus placements. However, an innocuous 'special class' wreaks havoc on his decision making. Suresh decides to pursue MBA and starts preparing for India's toughest PG entrance exam, CAT. Does he crack CAT or crack himself? Why does he want to do MBA in the first place? Is he happy about it or does he regret it? Even the ghostly Avatar, which travels with Suresh from education to employment, is fed up with his vacillating aspirations. By the end of it all he probably rediscovers himself, only to say “if you are successful you party, else you philosophize”.
\n
Tags: After Engineering what,Campus Placement,career,CAT,GRE,MBA,study in Singapore,success,TCS,XAT

Name: Asking for Trouble
Description:
A voracious reader of Thrillers, Historical fictions and Love Stories, I believe in living life to the fullest. A passionate reader and a movie buff, I feel these two things make my life worthwhile. When I started to pen down (No, typed actually) Ankita's story, I felt it's relevant to any modern woman, and felt a compulsion from within to make it reach allyou people out there. The journey of writing this book and creating these characters was really exciting and memorable. All in all, it was an enriching experience.😉
\n
\nName: Shilpa Choudapurkar
\nPublished Work- “It’s Never Too Late” published by Become Shakespeare.com"
\n
Short description:
What could be the similarities between the lives of two women, one of them belonging to 2015 and another from the year 1942.
\n
\nAnkita Marathe, a kick ass, go-getter, modern, Independent and new- age woman who successfully runs her ‘Web designing and graphics’ business. At 37, she had survived a bad marriage and betrayal of her husband of 2 years and post-divorce another failed romantic relationship. So now she is searching for the true meaning of relationships & she concludes that she needs someone of her own, who will not leave her in the middle of the road. Like having her own child. 
\nShe faces a breakup with her current boyfriend in the process of convincing him of letting her have his child, although she was keeping him off the hook of marriage and responsibility of raising the child.
\n
\nMaya Marathe, her paternal granny, who turns 18 years old in 1942, is caught up in the web of traditions and restrictions imposed on her by her family& her community, directly or indirectly. She is doomed with the prospect of a traditional marriage which is looming in front of her like a threat and no one is bothered with the fact that she is not interested in this marriage but in fact wants to pursue further education.
\n
\nSo, what could be the possible thread to bond these two women who belong to different generations with a gap of almost 70 years separating them from each other and had different upbringings except for the fact that they both belong to the same family. 
\nMaybe it’s the bond of being women or maybe it’s their quest of finding answers to their existence...So will they find their answers? Or will there be more questions? Or will their journey will lead them to know the meaning of their existence......
\n

Name: CHAINED HEARTS UNCHAINED LIVES
Short description:
This is a story of friendship , love ,lust , hate , lies enveloped in sarcastic humour and free joy displayed over 4 close friends who meet up after years apart at the funeral of the fifth. All this and much more that previously bound them so closely, makes them realise that the STRENGTH of the group isn't quite the same without their deceased fifth member.
\n

Name: Chloe's Faith
Description:
Suneha lives in Mumbai and works as a teacher in an
\ninternational school. When she is not interacting with kids, she spends her day people watching and spinning stories in her head. Her work has previously been published in Muse India
\n
Short description:
Chloe’s Faith is the story about a little girl who likes the sound of the word faith. “Faith, faith,” she repeats the word to herself. It reminds her of the word “fate” or “mate” and her French teacher, Ms. Kate.
\n“What does faith mean?” She asks granny curiously.
\nGranny explains that the universe takes care of all of us when we find ourselves in trouble. It’s called having faith.
\n

Name: Cobwebs
Description: The lady of the forest green, Anjana, was born and brought up in the quaint and peaceful Aranmula – the abode of Parthasarathy by the river Pampa. Her inspiration is the nature in its grandeur of interior Kerala. She makes human figures & thoughts seem to evolve out of and pass back into this very landscape. Anjana currently resides in Cochin with her husband and two lovely kids.
Short description: Grab a smile, shed a tear, and take a word to keep.”  Welcome to a torrent of thoughts, like sunbursts scattered over the pages, that take you through a wonderful landscape of love, laughter and despair. Peep through the kaleidoscope of imagination that fills this palette, with the brightest of colors that Anjana wishes to share with the universe. Swim along.

Name: Dark Side of The Coin
Description:
An aspiring writer from the town of Rajahmundry, Nagendra Sarma (Indra) distinguishes himself with a unique style and the uncanny ability to tell a story at its best. After being a blogger from 2012, this is his first true attempt at a novel. A post graduate from Andhra University, Nagendra has earned several accolades in the field of storytelling, he maintained an award winning blog before he got to be twenty and at the age of twenty three, he’s already publishing his first novel, this is undoubtedly a distinctive and talented individual from whom we can expect a lot more in time to come. Follow him at @nagendrasarma.g (Instagram) and iamindra.wordpress.com
\n
Short description:
Around 10:00 PM on the 26th of February 2015, I, the author, was called out by my friend Aamani. She, agitated by some mistake in her project, asked me to take her to some store which was at the outskirts of Rajahmundry, our hometown. I took her there, without annoying her with objections. When we almost reached the place, she asked me to stop and go back to the town to get some things for her, which she forgot. She said she'll walk to the store from there. I remember it so well: I looked around the uninhabited place and I was frightened at the thought of leaving her alone, at that place, at such an inappropriate time. I said I wouldn't go, if she doesn't come with me. She was frantic. She insisted I should go alone, for in the meanwhile she has much work to get done. Dissenting, I took a promise from her that she'll stay at the store and wouldn't stray away. When I was back, leaving her for half an hour at the abandoned place, she was missing. 
\n
\nI searched for her. 
\nShe was missing. . .
\nThe fear, not of the unknown, but of a repugnant imagination shook me like I was a maniac. I was trembling, with fear. Anger. Anxiety. Particularly, horror. And from that terror born was this ‘Dark Side of The Coin.’
\nWhat would you do if you were me?
\nRead and relate.
\n
Tags: Adventure,Dark Side of the Coin,Fiction,Indra,Mystery,Nagendra Samra

Name: Double Circle - A Story of Love to Naxalism
Description:
I am Nagesh Kumar and i am twenty five year old. I am from Kota, Rajasthan. I have done my B.tech from Rajasthan Technical university in Electronics & communication Engineering. Now currently i am working in Government Bank as a Probationary Officer in Maharashtra. I love music and writing. 
\n
\nMail id- Nageshg440@gmail.com 
\nMob :- 8619227235 
\n
\n
Short description:
There was a nice boy..... there was a sweet girl.
\nThere was an ordinary love story........... but there was something not ordinary in the boy........ 
\n
\nSo tell me, is it his love or his revenge ............... so tell me is this a revolution or his lethal revenge. So tell me who is wrong, a boy or a revolution. 
\n
\nThis is the world of the Double Circle.
\n

Name: Eternal Victory
Description:
Niraj Agarwal is a Software Engineer graduate hailing from Assam in India. Greatly inspired by J.R.R. Tolkien's work Lord of the Rings, he hopes one day humans could live on Earth like Tolkien's Elves in Rivendell. He wishes to pursue a career in wildlife conservation someday.
\n
Short description:
Everything is connected in this universe. The spiritual health of this planet is connected with the spirtual health of human civilisations. This book aims to promote meditativeness and self- awareness, to help create harmony in personal lives and as a result on the planet as a whole. Lord Shiva, who is the epitome of all transcendental knowledge in Hinduism, guides us to living positive lives on this planet while respecting all its inhabitants.
\n

Name: And… It's Not Just Love. It's Subject of Belief
Description:
Nuthan Poojari. Born and brought up in Thirthahalli in a middle class family. Qualification: MBA in Finance from AIMIT St. Aloysius.                                                             Currently working for Capgemini Services and Technology as a Finance and Accounts Associate in Bangalore.                                             I love to be alone with just my music. My little world is my parents, my brother and my n number of friends.
\n
\nFacebook: Nuthu Poojari                                  
\nInstagram; nuthu_poojari
\n
Short description:
Hi! My name is Nuthan Poojari. To be specific and short about me, I am the guy one who knotted blindfold himself in the matter of ‘Belief’, without being able to identify the ‘Lie’ which is carefully assembled between the ‘Belief’. I am the guy who has given the way to some unknown; to cross his beautifully structured life, without his own knowledge and re-constructed the most horrible conclusion which was supposed to be happy ending.                                                                                                                                                                                                       It all happened in the wake of, what people call ‘True Love’. Nevertheless, now I am happy because I got to know, I am not the only ill-fated creature of this universe as I had assumed. There are many out there and perhaps, you could be one of those.                                                                                                                                                                                               Which was that one moment that could have given me the better turning? What was that one thing that changed the entire scene? What was that one thing, that was connected to my life without my invitation and what made me to connect?                                                                                                                                                                                     Board bus with me, let’s go for a journey through the heart of the dense forest of Malenadu; by allowing me to illustrate the subject of Love. 
\n

Name: Kurfi - A sweet love story
Description:
Rajesh Patil has completed Mechanical Engineering from East point college of Engineering, Bengaluru. Currently he is working in Pune. He strongly believes smart work always overshadows hard work. He writes poems and loves travelling. This is his debut novel. 
\nRajesh Patil can be contacted via 
\n
\nE mail id – rajeshpatil14293@gmail.com 
\nFacebook id - /rajesh.kunnur 
\nInstagram – rajeshpatil5 
\n
\n
Short description:
Ram, Rahul and Rohan join Engineering. 
\nThe roommates’ journey starts with disappointments. They have different opinion about girls. Girls are love for Ram, hate for Rahul and flirt for Rohan. Ram likes Urmi, Rohan likes Miss Shruti and Urvashi likes Rahul. 
\nWill Ram gets his love interest, Rohan gets Miss Shruti and Urvashi gets Rahul? Will the naughty boys achieve big in mysterious Engineering? Kurfi is sweet story about love, friendship, sacrifice and heartbreak. 
\n
\n

Name: Lost and Found
Short description:
Sometimes in life you lose something and in the pursuit of finding it you end up finding something more profound and important.
\n“Lost and found” is the testimonial of how you can ‘lose’ your fears and inhibitions and ‘find’ a new meaning to your life. The fictional story revolves around people and circumstances that force the protagonist to accept the challenge called “life” by tapping in to her inner strengths. The story is a direct take on the people who lose themselves willingly in the shadows of others and then, when those shadows fade, they cease to exist.

Name: Moonlit Monochrome
Description:
Chandrama Deshmukh is a writer by profession and a poet by passion. Moonlit Monochrome is her first collection of English poems. She has authored two books of Marathi poems. A storyteller of sorts, the moon is her muse. Poetry for Chandrama is that one streak of silver lining amidst the chaos of life. Being an avid reader, photography enthusiast and a part-time playwright, she believes nothing touches her soul the way poetry does. Chandrama lives in Bangalore. 
\n
\nFacebook: https://fb.me/chandramadeshmukh
\nTwitter: @chandramawrites
\nInstagram: chandrama_deshmukh
\n
Short description:
These poems happened to me 
\nat random, insignificant moments.
\nThey are still damp, from loss.
\nThey epitomize wild ways to look at 
\nordinary things.
\nI am picking up pieces of life
\nAnd handing them over to you
\nDipped in words. And longing.
\nThis book is a map of my soul.
\nMy moonlit monochrome."
\n
\n- Chandrama
\n

Name: My Very Own Soup for the Soul
Description:
Lalita Karve, started writing poems in her ‘Dear Diary’ from the age of 15. She has completed her post-graduation in Chemistry from Pune University. She has published scientific papers while working as a research fellow. Thereafter, she started working as a ‘Content Developer’ in education. Her passion for writing ranges from scribbling taglines for her imaginative content to writing short stories and of course, poetry. She has submitted her poems and articles to various forums and has a blog titled ‘madhurasoulsoup.wordpress.com’. Her poem ‘Eye Witness’ has been published in the International Poetry Forum’s Yearbook in top 20 select poems.
\n
\n‘My Very Own Soup for the Soul’ is her first book as a published author. She dreams of becoming a well-known poet / writer and to travel the word.
\n
Short description:
The book is a compilation of my poems written for an audience who are philosophically and spiritually inclined, such as readers of the speaking tree. The book depicts the journey of the author’s philosophical interests. There are total 18 selected poems with which I wish to connect to people of similar interests.
\n
\nThe poems are reflections of my thoughts. A spiritual quest embarked upon since past 15 years. They touch upon the topics ranging from natural wondering about our universe, how I perceive various people, phenomena and situations. Some poems tell about human values, philosophical thoughts, spirituality and inner growth. The book is a mirror that reflects what a conventional mirror cannot.
\n

Name: ORPHANS AND THE NIRVANA
Description:
Every reality was once a dream, every dream was once a heart beat and this is mine.We live thorugh stories and in those stories we confide to ourselves of who we are-life is beautiful that way.Strangely by accident I went into a workshop on how to write stories and thats when everything around me changed and thats when I fell in love with stories of all sorts , when I was eleven.One story and thats all it took.Its been an insane journey with Aditi and her friends ,an journey that took nine years, and counting and finally have arrived. Currently have been working in Royal Enfield HSR Services in Bangalore, India. Another dream working hand in hand . On new years eve , nine years ago an idea , a small idea that consisted of a young girl rediscovering herself pierced my eyes in sleep from where I got up and wrote Aditi on a piece of paper. For next eight hours I threaded on Aditi and everything around changed and then I fell in LOVE at the age of eleven. Nine years after, working day at Royal Enfield and night with a addictive nature of a story in and out of itself.No matter who you are or where you are -your story is the best that you can write and always believe in your heart and FOLLOW YOUR HEART because it somehow knows you better than yourself.Pursue and be fearless,never stop and never give up. Meet you on the other side of the book.
\n
Short description:
Follow your heart' a voice that haunts a twelve year old where she has been asleep for the last three years . After her awakening from her Cryo sleep , she meets Divine Borns(Beings who are made up of Angel blood and soul of a Human) who claim to be her friends from birth and also as her memory had been lost and she has no recollection of her past, not a single memory.
\n
\nShould she trust her new found friends ? Should she believe in their legend that Aditi Agostis the awakened one is a true legend famously known as the 'Blue Eyed One' who defeated the most notorious criminal and the dark alchemists of all time simply known as THE BLACK KNIGHT.
\nWith so many questions and so little answers, she decides to trust her heart and in turn trusting those four strangers of her age and following them leads to an unknown realm well hidden on earth but in a different dimension, the realm-FOUR WATERS. Four Waters is a place filled with four kingdoms with endless magic but in a different form, with a different source known as Alchemy
\n
\nAditi Agostis and her friends find themselves in a quest of attaining 'Nirvana' through alchemy. 
\nWhat is Nirvana ? Will they succeed in achieving a most well known and ancient form of art and alchemy.
\n
\nA prophecy that surrounded around the five ORPHANS .What exactly is that Prophecy ? A prophecy which will test them on and on and will they survive?
\n
\nDo the five really think who they are ? Are they really Divine Borns? As the truth really been shared? One realm ,a million secrets .Will the five uncover the truth ? And especially what happened that night on September 8? A Day where the peace was restored but still it was a mystery , a mystery these Orphans are bound to find out or was it really a mystery at all?
\n

Name: Pangs and Ardor
Description:
Swati is a 27-year-old writer. She began as early as when she was fourteen. She competed and won multiple English Literary competitions and scored high in exams. Swati completed her B. Tech. in 2013, after which she began working as a Game Developer. Later she moved to Toronto and became Technical Analyst at a software company. During these years she continued to chase her dream to be a published author. This book is the first step towards that dream.
\n
Short description:
Time is never ending brief
\nOf a deluge to come and a lost breeze.
\nPonder in its sphere is nor to invade,
\nHandful trials on which victim hath paid.
\nThe spoil, the toil, the present unleash,
\nArms wide might fill the valley deep.
\n
\nTime relentlessly keeps reminding the weak of the troubles to come due to the lost opportunities. The judgmental wise would never account for the trivial attempts of the weak. The remains of failures, the suffering, the wasted hustle and the sorry life only plead for one embrace of love and understanding which might lessen the differences between the wise and the victim.

Name: Poster
Description: The writer is an another addition to the group of writers who are bankers. He is into banking career for more than 15 years and loves creative writing. He loves writing stories, skits and plays. His dream is to write a movie one day.
Short description:
A beautiful inspiring story of love, friendship and sacrifice... Must Read! 
\n -- Krishnadev Yagnik (Writer/ Director of Chhello Divas) 
\n 
\n Mohan a small time repairman finds a small baby. boy wrapped in a Poster on the streets of Bandra. Living an inconsequential life with no kith and kin to live for, Mohan picks him up, plans to raise and give him a fine life. A handsome boy he wants to make out an orphan; Poster instead turns out to be a goon leading his life outrageously. He continues to be one for goodtwenty years of his life, until he comes across a day in his life that tears him apart; the life that he has taken for granted all this while. Entangled in the deadlock with no road ahead, he laments over the loss that is irrrevocable. 
\n 
\nAnd then, life comes a full circle when one day, he stumbles upon an orphan child, Sumi, who changes the course of his unavailing life. 
\n 
\nA narrative of love, sacrifice and perseverance, Poster reflects upon the life of every human soul who desires for someone special to imbue values in each one of us to make us stand triumphant and efficacious in all walks of life.

Name: soulmate_search.com..! - sure, it was not that easy…!!
Description:
Author, Uday Ranjan Dasgupta, November 1950 born, passed his W.B Higher Secondary Examinnation with National Scholafship in 1967, did his B.E (Mechanical Engineering) in 1972 from the then Bengal Engineering College, Shibpur, now known as Indian Institute of Engineering, Science & Technology (IIEST). Having keen interest in literature all along, after retiring from senior executive position in Bhilai Steel Plant, SAIL, penned down this book, his maiden publication.
\n
Short description:
Adyamnya, on intensive search on internet matrimony sites for a compatible match for his tall charming elegant daughter, Babby ... otherwise extremely winsome and charismatic, with her only negative... a childhood accidental injury in right eye... Does that stand in the way of her happiness and thirst for life…!! ??? 
\n
\nShe rejects Harsh, a highly qualified top achiever ... Just for a fraction of a second he touched her hand and she felt a strong repulsion... Said a clear NO' to Arrk, otherwise a very decent and desirable guy, but not having a look that attracts her ... Get rejected by cute Baibhav ... Sure for her right eye ... but moves ahead knowing for sure ...God's delays are not God's denials! 
\n
\nMekhla said, "Babby, the grass is not always greener on the other side. I have a husband but no life; you have no husband but plenty of life!" ...
\n
\nNo, no hurry, not to commit any mistake... Father & daughter, both resolved not to make any compromise... Both prepared not to settle for anything less than what is desired... both knowing pretty well that we don't make our destiny... and inevitable are the decrees of fate ... And it's the God's will that will prevail...
\n
\n"Hold me tight, man", whispered Babby aboard the Swiss Glacier Express, ""you kept me waiting soooooo long…!
\n

Name: Stuck in the Middle? Let's break the middle class dilemma!
Description:
Praveen comes from a lower middle class family in the rural parts of eastern UP. A common man and a middle class in many ways- childhood, upbringing, mindset- he spent major part of his adolescence living in the village with half or no knowledge about many bigger things. He has been a bright student throughout and a very keen observer of the surroundings and how people react to different stimuli around them. Praveen went on to do his B. Tech in Electrical Engineering from IIT Kanpur after securing the All India Rank of 120 in IIT-JEE. After graduating from IIT in 2005, he has been working in the electronics and semiconductor industry. He is currently based in Bangalore.
\n
\nBeing a middle class himself, Praveen understands the potential of that class and the barriers that prevent those belonging there from breaking into something new. The middle class needs a reason, an awakening, and a realization to break free, and that’s what Praveen aims to achieve through this book.
\n
Short description:
How many times have you not answered a question despite knowing the answer, not expressed a view despite having a concrete point to make, or not asked a question even though you had a doubt? Either you thought the question was silly, the answer was stupid, the point was so-so, or you wished someone else should ask or tell.
\n
\nDo you get the feeling of not knowing how much you know about something? It may be too little, too much, just enough, more than your peer, or may be a lot, but you can't measure that. Sometimes this not knowing how much you know becomes a bottleneck. Know that nobody knows everything and you are not alone when it comes to not knowing how much you know. Ignorance is not exclusive!
\n
\nDo you find yourself stuck between many choices and not able to pick one and move ahead? Find out all such things that create this middle class dilemma and how to deal with it. The book takes you through the world of this great middle class. It describes what is a middle class mindset, what makes you a middle class, why there is a need to break this mindset, how to break it, what prevents you from doing it and of course what helps you in doing that. All these through real events and personal stories!
\n
Tags: Praveen Tiwari,Self Help,Stuck in the Middle

Name: Terracotta Dreams
Description: Monalisa Joshi is a writer and a poetess. As much she loves to write poetry, she also relishes in writing prose and fiction. She is presently working on one of her fiction book and few short stories side by side. She enjoys blogging and is quite active on social media platforms like Facebook and Twitter and she is also an active member of an International poetry group called ‘The Awakening poets’. Much of her writings and poetry are showcased in her blogs and can be visited at https://monalisajoshi105.wordpress.com/ and http://monalisa-wwwlisa.blogspot.in/. With a Major in English Literature she feels deeply inspired by Elizabethan poetry and Victorian women poet like Christina Rossetti and thus loves writing ballads and folklores. Her first poetry book is ‘Stirring Spoonful of Emotions’ from another publisher. Terracotta Dreams is her second poetry book and the title of the book she has chosen to be ‘Terracotta Dreams’ is because she feels deeply connected to her Indian roots and many of her poems reflects the same earthen essence of her soul. She is also the founder and editor of an online Magazine called “Plethora Blogazine” and finds time for her writing amid the homely chores, her two sons, her husband and a beautiful family life. She balances all her roles with great zest and abundance of love that she fills both in life and her dwelling
Short description:
Her heart is the vessel overflowing with myriad hues of emotions like glee, melancholy, nostalgia, reminiscences, fantasy and most of all with love. This poetry book has been written in an intriguing and captivating way which after reading will make you fall in love with the poems as well as with the poet. The great imagery, vivid narration and her fluid imagination will take you to the world of ballads, folklore and into another realm of fantasy and romance. The love poems particularly will touch your heart and you will find the words resonating and soul stirring both. The uniqueness of the book is one place you find the poet poignant and in the next moment her pious and defiant love towards her beloved can be seen. The mundane, the contemporary and the classic all the elements are merged like beads in a necklace within this book seeming to be completely inseparable from each other. The verses and the musings contained in it would certainly echo longer inside your soul even after you have finished reading the book. The book is an alluring summon for all, to come and fall in love with poetry. Her sermon to you... Thy love is the refuge I want, Thy romance is the sanctuary I need, Thy heart is the place I want to call, Home and thy glance make me more, Beautiful and I ever desire to stay within, Your breaths for as long as they shall flow, My presence shall be known as thy muse 
\n~ Monalisa’s Musings ~
Tags: Fantasy Poems,Poems and Musings,Soulful Romance,Terracotta Dreams

Name: The Dead Can Also Kill
Description:
Born in Nairobi, Kenya- Suneet Paul in his earlier years was exposed to diverse cultures within India, thanks to the gypsy urges of his parents. He comes from a family involved with literature. An architect by training, he is a creative writer and editor of an architectural magazine. Suneet has a published book of short stories and his short fiction has been carried in various magazines of the country and online literary portals. Painting is a hobby for him.
\n
Short description:
Friendship, withering relationships, emotional insecurities, love, passion, stress, betrayal, deceit, hatred, revenge- these are but some of the pungent elements of complex urban life that evolve and contour this fast-paced and engrossing suspense/murder thriller. It is the deftness and zeal of reputed investigative lawyer Richard Froth, that demystifies human intrigue and impulsive circumstantial responses leading to fatal encounters…. 
\n
\n“The captivating and focused writing, compels you to finish this book at one go. The simple narrative flow in conjunction with a plot that is realistically framed, makes the reader yearn for more of the intelligently crafted twists and turns in the story-line.” --RajnishWattas, writer & critic
Tags: Fiction,Romance,Suneet Paul,The Dead Can Also Kill,Thriller

Name: THE VEIL OF SHADOWS
Description:
A Masters in Computer Information Technology, Reynold Wolfe, is a computer engineer by profession, currently residing in Canada. Unparalleled imagination and sincere dedication have kept him inspired to bring out the best of his writings. Cronos is the first book of the series, ‘Veil of Shadows’ and is his first novel which has embarked his career in the world of writing.
\n
Short description:
A world class conman Mathew, pulled out the most difficult bluff of his life which was supposed to change his life forever; except for not the way he thought, who was completely unaware of what his fate awaited him, in his moment of triumph. Never believed in more than science, Mathew was about o find himself in an unknown world of supernatural with which his struggle had just begun. From the 17th century blood ridden massacred walls to the shootout at the French museum and the life threatening chase in the deep forests of Germany, the plot will always keep the reader guessing and the eventual nerve cracking ending will leave them longing for the next installment of the novel.
\n

Name: They Came Back
Description:
Mr. Rajesh Dhakane was born on 17 May, 1987 in a small village named Dhakanwadi 
\nin India’s most underdeveloped rural area. Unfortunately, he lost his parents when he was a 
\nchild and became an orphan in the days when children enjoy their lives with their families. 
\nLater, he was adopted by a poor farmer of the same village on a loan basis up to the 6th 
\nstandard during which he suffered from domestic violence and handed over to another person 
\nfor one year during which the infringement still continued. In turn, he spent his next year in 
\nthe hostel of backward class students which was working like an orphanage in Beed district. 
\nThen, he completed his education up to12th standard in 2006 on a loan basis and developed 
\ninterest in writing during 9thstandard when he wrote a Marathi drama for entertainment and 
\nan English poem against malpractices in academic examinations which were appreciated by 
\npeople. However, he still confronted mental harassment from the lender. Afterwards, he 
\ncompleted his graduation in Mrs. K.S.K. College, Beed by taking loan from another lender in 
\n2010 where he took considerable efforts to set his mind for academic and personal 
\nimprovements. 
\nMr. Rajesh was a strongly self-motivated and career-oriented person from his 
\nchildhood. He gave his 100% to his graduation studies and passed in it with the first division. 
\nDuring this course, he worked as Class Representative (C.R) for two years when he wrote his 
\nfirst English novel named ‘Youngsters in Love’ in 2008 due to his experience related with 
\nproblems of young students and desire to write something for them in order to guide them for 
\ngetting success in their lives. Moreover, he worked as a General Secretary (G.S) of his 
\ncollege during the last year of the related course. Nevertheless, owing to poor economic 
\nconditions, he couldn’t publish his first novel. After graduation, he worked as a waiter at the 
\ncanteen of Beed bus stand in 2010. Subsequently, by taking an education loan from another 
\nperson, he completed his post graduation in Microbiology in 2012, from the Institute of 
\nScience, Aurangabad with the first class. He was again deadly tortured by a lender, after 
\nwhich he worked as a laborer at a book stall located in Pune to solve his economic problems. 
\nNext, he worked as a production officer at Venkateshwara Hatcheries Pvt. Ltd., Pune 
\nin 2013 for six months and later as a Junior Research Fellow at Aurangabad University till 
\nMarch, 2016. Meanwhile, he qualified the USA-held Ph.D entrance exam viz. ‘Test of 
\nEnglish as Foreign Language’ (TOEFL) in 2014 and wrote his second novel titled ‘They 
\nCame Back’ in 2015. After completing his tenure at Aurangabad University, he worked as a 
\nSenior Research Fellow at BAIF, Haryana in reproductive biology from May, 2016 to 
\nDecember, 2016. Afterwards, he completed a five month course in biological science at 
\nIndian Institute of Advanced Studies (IFAS) at Pune in 2017 and worked as a trainer for 
\nadvanced and upper advanced English at Eon Vertex Center for Spoken English and 
\nPersonality Development, Aurangabad in the same year. 
\nMr. Rajesh never gave up in his life and kept fighting with adverse economic, mental 
\nand physical problems. He came to know the real importance of parents in a person’s life, 
\nwhich he missed completely. He tried to prove that an orphan can reach at the top in his 
\ncareer with constant efforts, remarkably excellent enthusiasm and absolutely stunning 
\nconfidence along with self realization.
\n
Short description:
The novel in question is presented to show a correct path to the young generation for 
\nachieving success by maintaining professional and personal status at first-rate level using 
\nhuman intelligence and common sense. In order to get a goal in life, one is required to work 
\nwith splendid commitment and devotion, which are gateways of achievements.

Name: Welcome To My Destiny
Description:
Rozene is a Fiji-born Indian, raised in Sydney, Australia. She has spent most of her life having a career in the public and not-for-profit sector, her qualifications including a Masters in Management. Rozene enjoys writing, solo travelling, cooking and spending time with her friends and family. From time to time, she manages to fit in Bollywood dancing in her busy schedule as well. Rozene’s catalyst for writing her book after she turned 40 was her divorce and her disenchantment with life. Her characters are fictional; however, some have been inspired through her journey of life. iv Welcome to my destiny Rozene is yet to regain her belief in love and magic, but she hopes one day she’ll get there. She lives in Sydney, Australia with her daughter. ‘Welcome to My Destiny’ is her debut novel. You can follow Rozene on www.rozenesnarayan.com
\n
Short description:
Sofia Rossi is a mother of four who defies her Italian culture and marries an Australian man.She visits her sick father in South Italy where she bumps into the young, handsome Peter Buckley, an Irish traveler visiting the Amalfi Coast. Sofia will take you on her travels through friendship and betrayal but will she discover the difference between lust and love?
\n
\nEmma Smith grows up with a controlling and violent mother. Emma’s life is immersed in sadness and that is all she has ever experienced. Hoping to become a strong person, and wanting to pursue a career in Criminology, Emma joins a Juvenile Justice Centre as a youth worker. Her dream remains to become a mother and raise her own children one day. Will Emma ever able to leave her violent and controlling mother and become a good mother herself?
\n
\nAbha Pillai challenges cultural norms to create a life for herself and her daughter. Being a divorced mum is not highly valued in the Indian culture. Will Abha ever be able to forgive herself for leaving her daughter behind to create a life for the both of them?
\n
\nSofia Rossi, Emma Smith, and Abha Pillai all experience life in distinct ways. Set in South Italy, Sydney, London and Mumbai, you will be taken on a memorable journey of self- discovery and will become a part of the lives of these women.
\n
\nAn intense and lively debut novel from an exciting new voice, Rozene.S.Narayan.
\n

Name: YOU -  An Uncommon Breed
Description: Keval Darji is a Mechanical Engineer. He lives in a small town called Meghraj in Gujarat. His dad is a Tailor and his mother is a housewife. Books have completely changed his life from last five years. ‘You An Uncommon Breed’ is his debut non fictional book which is based on stories and best quotes by great influencers of this world.He wants to pursue his career as a writer. For more information, follow him on Facebook and Instagram.
Short description: You- An uncommon breed is all about your gifts. This book is all about your legendary. It wants to tell you that you are a definition of greatness. The stories in this book and the sayings will make you feel that you are the creator of your own destiny.Because no one has come to you ever saying that you are the best creature from the almighty, you are best as you are. People always tell you that Be sincere, Be kind…But no one tells you to be Bold, to be awesome.This book will realize you the lion inside you. It will make you realize you that being extra-ordinary is the only option you have.Playing small won’t be enough. So get up and crack the pavement

Name: A 46 Gulabganj - The Tam Brahms and other short stories
Description:
Aparajita Bannerjee, or Apu, is a writer, born and brought up in Delhi in the fictional neighbourhood of Gulabganj. Her father, Doctor Bipin Chandra Banerjee, is a Professor of Cardiology at the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Delhi. Apu has a younger sister, Suchitra, who also studies medicine like their father. She is now settled with her husband and children in San Jose, US. After Doctor Bannerjee’s death, his wife Jaya goes to live with Suchitra in the US. Their house in Delhi, A 46 Gulabganj, is kept boarded up and shut; waiting to be sold off. Apu eventually marries Shashank Chowdhry, a former student of Doctor Bannerjee. The two of them decide not to sell off the house and make A 46 Gulabganj their home. After moving back in, Apu relives the memories of her childhood and youth. The Tam Brahms and other short stories is a series of incidents of her life as narrated by her.
\n

Name: He loves me, he loves me not
Description:
