Pratibha Mishra, basically belongs to Ranikhet (a beautiful place in Uttarakhand) but has spent most of her life in Delhi. She is a post graduate in Public Relations & Advertisement. She has served few Multi-national travel companies in Delhi before moving to Mumbai. She recently got married and now lives happily with her husband in Mumbai. She is serving another travel MNC in Mumbai at present. She loves traveling and has traveled to many states of India and few other countries. Apart from traveling, watching movies, writing and reading she just loves dancing and listening music of all sorts. “He loves me... he loves me not” is the first book of Pratibha Mishra.
\n
\nShe can be contacted on  pratibhamishrat@gmail.com
\n
Short description:
Priyanka, a tom-boy Delhiite girl was living her life content until she encounters a break-up she had never imagined. Her best buddies helped her moving on but the incidence was too much of a shock for her to take and left her in say-no-to-boys-ever-again decision. 
\nThen what made her fall for another guy that too from a distinct city when she knows her family would never support that? 
\nIs falling in love enough for getting married? Why even on the date of her marriage, Priyanka was not sure if she will be getting married today or not? What all they had to go through to get married? Did they disappoint their parents whom they loved and respected most or they had to sacrifice their love for family? 
\nEnjoy Priyanka and Arjun’s roller coaster ride for their marriage through this novel.
Tags: Fiction,He loves me,He loves me not,Mishra,Pratibha,Romance

Name: I Wish I Could Wake Up And Find Out I Wasn't Alive
Description:
Kris Iyer is the pen name of a first time author grappling with all the usual questions that tend to be the preoccupation of first time authors
\n
Short description:
Blurring the lines between reality and make believe, waking and dream states, this work straddles genres before transcending them all
\n
Tags: bildungsroman,dreams,I wish I could wake up and find out I wasn't alive,Kris Iyer,magical,realism

Name: In that Hour of Despondency
Description:
Yashi Tripathi started writing books at the age of nine. It was a story about some spies which she has conveniently forgotten. She is addicted to reading books and has explored many genres across the years. She is currently a student of class eighth. She lives in Lucknow with her lovely family. The things that she loves most in the world are chocolate, pizza and her family. She welcomes any book reviews and e-mails.
\n
\nE-mail her on: yashitri11@gmail.com
\n
\nYou can know her more on her website: bookwrittenbyyashi.wordpress.com
\n
Short description:
Kester Swan had never been one of the brave guys. He had always preferred watching from the sidelines rather than taking action. He always had his best friend, Jennet Wolfham by his side who stood up for him. But when his best friend is brutally murdered, will Kester be able to overcome over the fear which has brought him down his entire life? Will he be able to find out the truth behind her death?
\n
Tags: In that hour of desponency,Kris Iyer,Mystery,Suspense,Thriller

Name: Melange
Description: Born and brought up in Kolkata,the poetess is a teacher of English and a freelancing Jewelry Designer. A debutante in the field of writing, she aspires to contribute to women empowerment using verse.
Short description: A Journey Down the Alley Of Womanhood
Tags: A Journey down the alley of Womanhood,Bafna,Melange,poetry,Priyanka

Name: Love and Relationships
Description:
Vysakh Jayakrishnan hails from Thrissur, Kerala. He doesn't want to disclose anything else about him not because they are all bad but because they won't help a little in selling the first publishing venture of his. In case the readers feel offended on keeping the personal details of their beloved writer at large, they are humbly informed that he is an Engineer. Do they want to know anything regarding that? He thinks not. Yet he dares to inform a little more that he is not just a Bachelor Engineer but a Master Engineer who now tries to become Doctor Engineer. Now do they want to know anything further? He definetly thinks not
\n
Short description:
People fall in love and make relationships. They do it because they wish to live happier than before. They expect that they compliment and complete each other. Even though every man and woman wishes so, sometimes they breakup.
\n
\nEven though they wish to be together forever, they part.
\n
\nThe author of the book also has gone through similar situations and has seen many such ones. Upon observing them, he sees that every story is worth doing a research on it.
\n
\nThat is the objective behind this writing venture. The author tries to capture the moments when people fall in love and when they break apart. He tries to find the reasons behind. He tries to do a research on relationships.
\n

Name: Skeleton in the Closet
Description:
Terence Morais was born in Thoothukudi, a relatively small coastal town in Tamilnadu. He writes stories that blur the lines between genres. Currently he lives with his wife in Chennai.
\n
Short description:
Lives will be shattered. Why would a hatchet man be set on someone searching for his long-lost family?
\nDaniel Roger must untangle himself from a wrongful murder conviction and find his lost family before losing them forever.
\nNo one gets to be together without being torn apart first. Not even Daniel.
\n
Tags: American novel,Fiction,Indian author,skeleton in the closet,Suspense,Thriller

Name: Spaceman-1 from Swarnaland
Description:
C. RAMAIAN is a retired government higher secondary school headmaster in the state Tamil Nadu, INDIA. He had a spark to write English novels only three years after his retirement from service. His novels are:
\n  1) Spaceman - 1 from Swarnaland.
\n  2) Spaceman - 2 from Swarnaland.
\n  3) A thief and three angels-1
\n  4) A thief and three angels-2
\n  5) Magnetic fortress-1
\n  6) Magnetic fortress-2
\n  He has an idea to write more fictions in the above stated three series of novels.
\n
Short description:
“Spaceman-I from Swarnaland” is a cosmic science fiction with utmost power to give you the highest thrill of reading.Prince Ernest is the superhero of Swarnaland, a country in Delta, an assumed planet revolving around the real star Alpha Centauri. The twist of events that establish his love affairs with Princess Angela and Miss Alice will lift you to the higher level of mirth. Struggles of Prince Ernest with sea monster FileZilla, flying lion and monster animals of Jurassic period will make you expand your eyebrows in wonder. The encounters of the superhero in the areas of floating orchid garden, fish rainbow and Jelly fireflies will oscillate you on swings of joy.
\n 
\nThe role played by scientific inventions like armor of power rays, electronic duplicator, laser pistol, electronic captivator and instantaneous launching of flying saucer into the atmosphere of the earth will make you fly on wings of imagination. With a positive purpose to release Prince Ernest from the political turmoil of Swarnaland, ProfWalter projects him into the atmosphere of the earth in a flying saucer with the company of padfoot, a spirit in the shape of folded umbrella.
\n 
\nThe second hero in the novel is Leon, a taxi driver in London. His love affairs with four multicolored human blossoms will show you the hidden corners of motherly love. By the crafty game of fate, Leon reaches Swarnaland in the same flying saucer and ascends on the royal throne of Swarnaland in the name of Prince Ernest. By the artful play of the same fate, Prince Ernest enters into the love circle of the four multicolored human blossoms in the name of Leon and oscillates them on a cradle of love. The superhero of Swarnaland transforms to a hunter of terrorists and plays miracles of wonderland with the support of the supernatural powers of padfoot.

Name: Thanking You With Love...
Description:
17What happens when an engineer turns into a writer?
\n 
\n Born and brought up in Kolkata, Arjun has transformed his imaginations and created brilliant portraits from his day to day life into stories. His interests involve exotic trip planning and travelling. From getting stuck at the borders of Bangladesh to exploring the remote beauties of North East India to hopping onto a wild trip at Thailand to sand surfing in the desserts of Morocco his next target is to take the grand Trans - Siberian railway ride from Beijing to Moscow via Mongolia.
\n 
\n Having worked in the domains of technology and education for a substantial period of time and having travelled across the length and breadth of India during his career, he wishes to capture the moments of his diverse experience and create stories out of them.
\n 
\n He released the first edition of Thanking You With Love... in 2015 and his second novel titled Daddy’s Princess along with a book music album named Our Home in the Clouds at Bali, Indonesia in 2017.
\n 
\n Arjun maintains a blogspot (www.qodro.com/blog) where he invites contributions from all writers, photographers, artists and musicians to highlight their talent. Those interested may write to info@qodro.com.
\n 
\n His Facebook page is myGenie Entertainment and twitter handle is @royalbtiger.
\n 
\n He may be contacted at arjunch7@yahoo.in for all official communications.
Short description:
“Certain relationships don’t have any name. They sprout from nowhere and disappear somewhere”
\n 
\nAshwini and Vikram had become more than just friends. It was not that he was her boyfriend but she just felt like being with him always.
\n 
\nLife moved on and Ashwini matured over time realizing that the responsibilities and problems one had to shoulder were much more beyond the four walls of college. As time came for her engagement, Vikram not only disappeared from the scene but also did not get in touch with her ever.
\n 
\nWhat was in Vikram’s mind when he was with her all the while? Did he really care for Ashwini or was it just a hallucination?
\nThanking You with Love…will hold the reader till the last page when Ashwini discovers a shocking truth upon returning to her hometown after six years.

Name: The Abyss of Power
Description: Siddharth Sabari is a Dyslexic Author based out of Chennai. Born in Mumbai, he did his majority of his schooling in Chennai & went on to complete his graduation from VIT University,Vellore Campus. His first book is Figmented Reality, based on the mental strain of addiction and the role it plays on shaping of a boy into man into something dangerous. This is his second book and is aspiring to be Script Writer.
Short description:
To meet a real criminal and write their biography is every crime writer's dream come true. Arun, an upcoming author gets a chance to meet Sophia, a cyber criminal who has risen to power by manipulating social media perception. This is an opportunity the Investigative Agency have been waiting to lay hands on Sophia. Sophia surfaces for a reason while the members of the Investigative Agency have their own agenda. Will Arun go undercover? Will Sophia be caught? What is the Agenda? Will it be fulfilled?
\n

Name: True Love is Hard to Find
Description:
Dinesh Kr. Acharya is from the Tezpur City of Assam. The city of culture, the city of art and artists, the city of passions, the city of cleanness, the city of historical places and so on. He is an MBA and a young man of 27 years of age. As the city itself has some stories of passionate people, Dinesh Kr. Acharya is also passionate from his earlier age about his writings. He uses to write poems as he likes to express his inner feelings through poems and till now he has more than 550 poems in his diaries in four different languages.
\nIn 2016 his first Poetry Book was published which name is “Love Happiness and All… (81 Poems)”. After the success of this book he was inspired by various people to write more and they also suggested him to write novels. The inspirations also come from the readers of his blogs where he sometimes posts his more number of poems and writes something of his feelings. 
\nThis all, at last,  nspired him to write his own novel which he picked up from a real story a loving couple. He is succeeded to put all the things in this book “True Love is Hard to Find”. 
\n
\nThis a little about him. You can follow him on his official blog: dineshkracharya.wordpress.com
\nFacebook page: /dineshkracharya 
\nTwitter: /dineshkracharya
Short description:
Love is a universal thing. Love touches everyone in one day or in many days. In different ways, in different times love comes to our life which we also accept knowingly or unknowingly. Love is not the thing which can be denied so easily. “True Love is hard to find” is based on that one type of real-life story of two persons ‘D’ & ‘P’. ‘D’ is the boy who falls in love with a very beautiful girl ‘P’. But when he comes to know this, it was too late that her marriage was fixed with someone else. Though D proposed P and told his feelings to her. But what will happen next when that girl with whom he falls in love truly, reject his love? Will D could be the success to convince his love in the next seven months? This real story is based on that couple who may not be in the relationship in those months but it was also more than a single side love story. 
\nWe all believe that true love wins always. But is it really applicable in all cases? If it is ‘no’ then what will happen to the boy and if it is ‘yes’ then what will be the turning points in his life? The story is that
\nextraordinary love story which is not a relationship and also more than not a relationship.

Name: WHILE GOD SLEPT - Forces of darkness as Angels of Light Sri Lanka: 1971-2009
Description:
Mario Perera is a foremost Western European languages specialist of his country, Sri Lanka. He speaks six of them and translates from four more. He is proficient in Latin and Greek.
\n
\nThe author’s university career spans sixteen years spent in universities of Rome, France (Lille), and Sri Lanka. His fields of study were: philosophy, theology, law, European classical literature, applied foreign languages, interpretation and translation.
\n
\nMario’s professional life was spent in embassies here in Sri Lanka (French Embassy), and abroad (Embassy of Sri Lanka, Paris), He also worked for UNESCO, Paris as a translator. His services as interpreter and translator were availed of by the French government and the government of Sri Lanka as well as by foreign delegations. He served as interpreter at international conferences.
\nMario Perera is very widely travelled having been several times to the USA, Canada, the major countries of Europe, and to most countries of South and South-East Asia.He has already written 17 books.
\nA note to readers and well-wishers. Please send in your comments to:
\nmario_perera@yahoo.com
Short description:
This book deals with the most tumultuous years of Sri Lanka’s post-colonial history. It is an extraordinary blend of fiction and history. The story is a penetrative probe into the belief systems of the country, and how they were made to serve ascatalysts for the unleashing of violence which shook the country between 1971-2009. 
\n
\nThe author with an array of academic distinctions in multiple fields deals with the subject with a display of rare erudition. A master of many languages and a confirmed globe-trotter for whom the world is his home, he approaches the subject without bias or prejudice. 
\n
\nDr. Juanita Perera, Ph.D. University of Rochester, New York. 
\n
Tags: Fiction,History.,Sri Lanka's post colonial history,while God slept

Name: Work, Workers & Workplaces - Using space as the starting point of innovation.
Description:
Parthajeet Sarma is a Chevening scholar (Oxford University), award-winning innovator and entrepreneur. Fifteen out of his over two decades of work experience has been as an entrepreneur. Set up in 2003, iDream has metamorphosed to be a boutique strategic management consultancy, handholding change management in corporate organizations. 
\n
\nBesides iDream, Parthajeet also acts as an advisor at Gallopper. Gallopper fuels experimentation and discourses around design as the core in business transformation. Parthajeet’s experimentation efforts have yielded award winning products and services. He is the joint winner of The Economic Times ‘Power of Ideas’ 2012, Sankalp Awards for social innovation and others. He has been featured across various electronic and print media including CNBC TV-18’s ‘Young Turks’. 
\n
\nA graduate of Sir J J College of Architecture, Mumbai, Parthajeet went on to complete an MBA. After years of industry experience, he was selected by the British Government to do a leadership program on science and innovation at Oxford University. A husband to a fellow professional and a father of two daughters, Parthajeet is a regular speaker at industry forums as well as in educational institutions.
Short description:
Humans are wired to follow the path of least resistance. If one doesn’t have to do something, he or she will not do it. Technology has enabled humans to work from coffee shops and from home, reducing the need to go to work. The very meaning of work has changed for modern day workers where the workplace is no more a physical space. The new workplace is a blended space of the physical and the digital. 
\n
\nThe subconscious mind is like cruise control for humans and shapes behavior. The environment that one is in conditions the mind. At work, the workplace environment conditions quality of thinking. For organizations in a collaboration economy today, productivity depends on the quality of thinking, and not so much on efficiency. The blended workplace is the starting point of innovation for organizations that believe in innovation. 
\n
\nParthajeet Sarma delves into psychology, human evolution and science to draw connections with greatly changed expectations from work. In his third book, Parthajeet espouses the need for management to get out of codified theories. This facilitates a macro view, leading to a radical new meaning of work, workers and workplaces that is aligned with the organization’s vision for the future. 
\n
\nFor more resources, visit: www.idream.in/www/

Name: You are the author of my story
Description:
Sunil Kumawat is a son of poor farmer, lives near Indore, graduated in Arts from DAVV, Indore. At present, he is preparing for Civil Services from New Delhi. Belongings to village that holds cruel thinking scared him. He turned introvert that forced him to hold pen and paper to express his emotions. To dream something is like a crime in his village. Nevertheless, he dares to dream. He chose the endless path of writing to find his voice. This book is the dawn of the Revolution to awake the people of his village, to live the life the way they want, to break the boundaries of their own. By this book, he is presenting example to youth of his village, so that they could dare to dream, as that’s how they can find their real Karm on earth. He has dedicated his soul to help people of his village in helping them to find the right way to live the life, to fight for the truth, to set theory of Karm, to know their own souls. Sunil has dwelled himself in spiritual world. Moreover, he accepted the writing journey to find the truth of the universe, he is wondering about from years. This is his journey to merge his incomplete part into the all mighty universe to become Purn. Inspired by the words of Amish Tripathi and Paulo Coelho he began his jaunt to awake all the spirits and to find true essence of his own soul.
\n
Short description:
Millions of stories travel around us, every story has its own world, and they are here to perform the obligation announced by the mighty universe. And every story has its destination. But sometime we Sudden a stranger’s story crosses our path, we be part of his journey, then some series of events happen, and we discover the path which was waiting for us from ages. We just say to that stranger, ‘You are the author of my story.’ 
\nShourya, Aahna, Ruhi, and Sid are thrashed and cornered by their evil past. But universe conspires to weave all these spirits together to rewrite end of their story. They cross each other’s path to light their own conscience. They sacrifice their sleep, time, and peace to find the truth that karma is the only way of salvation of their soul so that to dwell into mighty, to awake the universe within them. They stake their life for breathe of all the strugglers who dare to dream. Some decides to release their life so that their soul could add up cosmic energy to universe so as universe can responde more powerfully for victory of their friends. They don’t thirst for triumph but they fight to live every moment of the path which they have chosen. All they have to fight with is the last hope that at the end everything will be okay. This is tale of the faith in ourselves that brings universe to us and dwells all universal power into us.
Tags: Romance,Sunil Kumawat,you are the author of my story

Name: Bahir
Description: Monisha K Gumber is a bestselling author of immensely popular Teen Novels called SICK OF BEING HEALTHY and DYING TO LIVE. This is her first book for Adults, which is long awaited and already creating a buzz. Monisha is an Army brat and has moved around all over the country and says that her background has made her more accepting and humble. Like most people from her generation she has the usual MBA and many years of corporate experience till she decided to move into the arena of writing. She hopes to write entertaining, simple yet inspirational stories that make a difference. She is also passionate about alternative healing and wishes true health and happiness for all. Currently she lives in Bahrain with her family including two dogs and two cats.
Short description:
Reviews:
\n
\n"A gripping page turner that didn't leave for a moment, a phenomenal story showing the brutal realities of life in the author's signature light-weight style " : Mahesh Bhatt
\n
\n"An engaging, sensational story with deep thematic resonance" : Gulf Weekly
\n
\n"Perturbing, piercing, yet able to warm the heart" : Rohini Bakshi (Author, Oxford Alumnus and Sanskrit Scholar, UK)
\n
\n"An enthralling social satire that makes you introspect" : Sumit Agarwal (National bestselling author)
\n
\n"A saga that haunts the reader untill the last page. Unput downable" : Rohini Sunderam (Author & Founder member of Bahrain Writers' Circle)
\n 
\nA tale of utter desperation and fierce hope. And a fight for honour. 
\nMeet Sawera. A beautiful and Sensual woman. Born in Pakistan, raised in the Middle East and abused wherever she goes. Struggling to find acceptance, which eludes her over and over again, she ends up being an outcast. Who belongs nowhere and to no-one. 
\n 
\nUsed and manipulated by the men she loved, from the depths of her soul she claims her self-respect, along with the faith to overcome her pitiful circumstances.
\n  
\nWhere does she find her strength? What is the breaking point? How does she get over the demons of her past? Follow the story of Sawera, a child born of midnight into the dawn of new hope. Uncover the secrets and conspiracies that make her the woman she is. Read her story, a story of survival.
Tags: Dark story,Gulf,immigrant,Life in the middle east,Mahesh Bhatt,Pakistan,Romance,Satire,social issues,Thriller,women

Name: Notes in the margin
Description: An Economics graduate and B-School Post-Graduate, Arindam fell in love with poetry the day he first read Robert Frost's 'The Road Not Taken'. Since then he has developed an acute infatuation with the written word, which has led him to read quite a bit from Rumi to Neruda, Hosseini to Orwell and Poindexter to G.R.R. Martin. Writing has been part of him for as long as he can remember and he co authored his first book 'Prelude to the Horizon' with close friend and fellow Presidency College alumni Monami Ghosh. Currently based out of Mumbai, he works at an advertising agency and sometimes tries his hand at photography.
Short description:
​Margins define people, often dictating what is thought of but not mentioned and mulled over but not spoken aloud. 
\n
\nThey reign supreme over the land of words gone astray, feelings that swim to the front of the consciousness but do not find expression through the fingers. But once margins are breached, it almost doesn’t matter how deep into our true selves we go. Because then, and only then, can we truly put the madness down on paper and immortalise it in the captivating world of the written word. 
\n
\n'​​Notes in the margin', Arindam's second volume of original poetry, is an exploration of outlying thoughts and fleeting emotions, dwelt on over time and woven into kaleidoscopic verse. Verse that ranges from rain to schoolteachers, from abortions to ice creams and from serial killers to eternity.

Name: Embracing Epiphany Moment
Description: Ajit Nair is a qualified Chartered Accountant, based in Mumbai. Ajit has worked in various functions in reputed companies over the last twenty five years..During his tenure in the Industry, had opportunities to experience various instances and have dealt with interesting people that were appealing and had an alarming story to share. This book is a genuine effort by Ajit to give life to those select stories that had a positive impact on him and thereby sharing the same with all the readers. This book is his attempt to play a squirrel’s role in this gigantic task of letting people know how BEING HUMBLE helps in overcoming all situations with a positive mindset.
Short description: A set of short stories from real life instances with an all-time appeal, which are sure to be a favorite read for all age group...The reader has the choice of stories with life situations and thereby learn how a humble approach has helped the person handle the situation with grace and thereby happily embrace the outcome.Rendered in an easy narrative style, the stories are a sure way of connecting the reader to the situation and facilitate the character in each story find through the solution and thereby inculcate a realization that life if handled being humble, can make a simpler and easy living.

Name: Are you Living before Dying?
Description:
Nagendra.K.Biyani is a Provincial Civil Servant in Andhra Pradesh. He is Joint Director in Municipal Administration Department and has served in various capacities in Government of Andhra Pradesh. He is currently working with United Nations Development Program (UNDP)
\nNagendra Biyani did his Bachelors in Civil Engineering from Andhra University. He completed Post Graduate Programme from IIM, Ahmedabad. He authored two case studies that were registered at IIM, Ahmedabad. He spent a brief stint at famous Lyndon Johnson School of Public Policy, Austin at USA.
\nBiyani has a writing interest since his student life. He had written several short stories in Telugu those were got published. He penned many articles that were published in vernacular daily. He got published his first book “ Four Dimensions”.
\nBiyani lives in Hyderabad and can be reached at nkbiyanii@yahoo.co.in and nagendra.iidc@gmail.com and on phone 9395360369.
Short description:
This is a story of a common middle class man who represents millions in the country.
\nA common Man who struggles his entire life to live with a conviction that the struggle itself is life altogether.
\nA middle class man who does not dare to nurture big aspirations and dreams.
\nAn ordinary man who lives on day to day basis and feels assured that life will go on like this for ever.
\nOne night his life receives a big jolt with a dream.
\nIn that dream, he meets a guruji who unveils his future life. Guruji breaks his heart by a deadly truth that he is going to live for a year only.
\n
\nThe common man is shattered. He is struck by this new revelation. He is not in a position to digest.
\nHe is clue less. He is worried about his own life. He is worried about his family.
\nHe cursed his past; wherein he did not care a damn. He lost all the life without future. His agenda is unfinished.
\nHe has no means; no resources.
\nHe has no feel of his life. No memories; No experiences; No contentment
\nHe has no Plan for future.
\nHow to lead the balance life? How to safe guard the family?
\nWhere to start?
\nHow can he fight the death altogether?
\nHe started exploring himself. He began to think about life.
\nHe, now, deadly wants to live his life fully.
\nHe is losing days in his miniature life very fast. He first time noticed the value of each day and value of life.
\nGuruji guided him to lead his balance short life in a fulfilling manner.
\nGradually, he stopped worring about death. But worried about living his short life in full spirits.
\nHe wanted his life to be meaningful; satisfied; fulfilled with contentment.
\nHe opened new vistas of life. He explored new avenues of life.
\nHe acquired new habits; discarded bad ones.
\nHe investigated the essence of life.
\nHe planned for his life.
\nUltimately, he got strengthened to aspire to defeat his own death!
\nNow he is prepared to lead an all new life; if he gets new lease of life.
\nWe, all, generally don’t understand the value of life. We actually miss our life in the name of living on materialistic aspirations.
\nThis is the case with all.
\nThe Protagonist displayed the journey of his miniature life and enlightens us about the life itself!
\nHe questions us- Are you living before Dying??
\nThe day to day struggles, the emotions, the commotions, feelings, pain and pleasure are all displayed in this fable.
\nHe represents us. He represents our life.

Name: A Lot Like Love & Other Short Stories
Description:
Nidra Naik is a writer of English prose and poetry. Being from the silver city of Cuttack, Odisha, she is one of the first Odiyas to pen down her work in English-fiction. Her first notable published novel titled, “The Bhubaneswar Times”, was published in 2013 by Leadstart Publishing Ltd. and has had mixed reviews from different media houses.
\n Belonging to one of the most prominent Oriya filmi families, she was also a freelance feature writer for an English daily in Bhubaneswar. In her leisurely hours, she loves to pet animals, sing, read and observe life closely. 
\n She currently works and resides in Hyderabad with her husband, who she refers to as a terrific source of inspiration in all her stories!
\n Her second novel, “A Lot Like Love & Other Stories”, is a collection of six heart-wrenching, modern yet earthy stories, hailing from the neglected land of the east of India, Odisha.
\n
\n You can reach her at:
\n www.nidranaik.com
\n www.facebook.com/Nidraauthor
\n Twitter @nidranaik
Short description:
From America, New Delhi, Balasore, Cuttack and even at the barren land of Nabarangpur; unearth sagas of demands, indecisiveness, struggle, intensity, love and longing! A Lot Like Love & Other Short Stories reveals the human side of survival called Hope; hope on which every living being thrives, hope, which at times is also lost. 
\nStories travelling the test of time, characters infusing a blood of fire, this book brings to the readers, how deep and passionate life’s purpose can be, how in an insipid land of imagination, can connect with the most fertile of hearts.
\n Love adorns life! 
\n 
\n 
\n “Her stories are deeply embedded in her Odia cultural moorings interspersed with Odia coinages, be it the term ‘Bou’ or about the Maoists of Nabarangpur.” The Pioneer 
\n 
\n 
\n “…how stories characterized by dark humor, stark reality and romance can leave an indelible mark on the minds of readers.” Metro, The Telegraph
\n 
\n 
\n “Naik has penned a beautiful and haunting tale of two estranged lovers that enhances the value of this anthology.” India Blooms
\n 
\n “Naik's prose is effervescent, especially when she is being herself in describing a character.” Merinews
Tags: A Lot Like Love and other short stories,Nidra Naik

Name: THE PARAH'S OF LOVE
Description:
I am a firm believer in love.
\nAlthough I never liked attending school and college, I am a BMM graduate. Few friends I have but I hold them with great love. I have travelled to many countries but I think my journey started when I walked within.
\nI am fascinated by faith, such is my fascination that I have locked my heart there, what fascinates me is that it never tried to run away.
\nService to others gives me great joy and I love to help others. Would really love to get in touch with you through Instagram(vyasadi_). Feel free to have an open conversation with me and don’t forget to stay updated and upgraded by my blogs.
\nI have not much to talk, for I have never done anything great. All what I have done were everything strange.
\n
Short description:
God? Beloved? Both?
\nCertainly I choose beloved and god was after me. Relation between two people equates to three. Who is that third one?. Most probably will be your first love. A step towards my beloved, made hundreds and thousands of feathers. Unfortunately my steps stopped but so bliss is it to find oneself in the skies!
\nFrom the love for god to the love for one's beloved, all has been presented divinely. Blending of love and mysticism will take you into the oasis of godly rhythm. With sweetness of wisdom all has been prepared. Love has been torched to such an extent that even the shadows are to be seen very brightly.
\nThis platonic experience will give you the opportunity to delve into the inner splendour of one’s love towards heaven above and at the same time with one who is worldly precious.
\nAnd what more if some stories and some liners hop in this quest for thirst? This is the book that will take you home but beware all is not comfort.
Categories: Self help|Self Help: Motivational & Inspirational|Self-Help: Spirituality|Spiritual

Name: The Valentine Rose & Other Stories
Description:
Born 23 rd September, 1960, Pradeep Kumar Panda has academic qualification of M.A (economics) and lives in the city of Cuttack in the Indian state of Odisha. He has been associated as a writer-editor in the publishing of newspapers, periodicals and books and has written several essays to his credit. Besides, Mr Panda is a translator and grant writer.  The short stories in this collection are his maiden published work of the type.
\n
Short description:
This album of eleven short stories tries to portray true to life situations in the current milieu. The writer has used his creative prowess in building them basing on his observation of social complexities. Written in lucid style the satirical undertone in these stories can be well perceived by the reader who may find the latter both musing and amusing. Though written in Indian context, the stories may be enjoyed by the non-Indian reader as well. 
\nThe author, Pradeep Kumar Panda, has some years of editorial experience in the print media—newspapers, periodicals and books. He has produced several essays which have been published in newspapers and periodicals. Also a translator and grant writer, Mr Panda lives in Cuttack city in India’s Odisha state
\n

Name: Single Again - Remember my Pain
Description:
Seim Dahiya is a Poet, Author, Short Story writer, Children Book Writer, Satirist, Essayist and student of literature favourably support to young readers and respect their minds.
\n
Short description:
The book is the collection of experiences during breaking of hearts in the form of songs and poems and a trying to give the shape to the pain.
\n

Name: ANAND V/S ANAND
Description:
Sukumar Mandalika is an engineer by profession, with a lifetime of executive experience in private organisations.  A writer by passion, he is unabashedly addicted to Indian and English movies and thoroughly enjoys reading English fiction in paperback.  This is his second book to be published.
\n
\nHappily married to homemaker Padmavathy who is the anchor of his life and closest friend, Sukumar lives in Madras aka Chennai.  When not writing, he is busy adoring his screen idols Sean Connery, Sivaji Ganesan, N T Rama Rao and . . . Dev Anand !
Short description:
From Stone Age, wars have been and are being fought.  For the weak and poor, it is a war for survival.  For the strong and wealthy, it is a war for more power and wealth.  And, of course, there is one war simmering unabated since the time of Adam & Eve . . . MAN v/s WOMAN !
\n
\nMan feels superior to Woman.  Woman finds Man overbearing. This then forms the genesis of a war that ends in nemesis for both.
\n
\nThe truth is that like night and day, pain and pleasure, man and woman are inseparable.  If one is the song, the other is its very rhythm.  If one is the stronger among the two, the other is the very secret of this strength.  Lucky couples who realise this truth will find life a journey of joy.  Others too blinded by their ego will remain on a path of pain.  
\n
\nThe ANANDs are one such couple in love and at war too.  Will they be lucky?
\n
Tags: Anand v/s Anand,Love and Hate,Love and hate are two sides of the same coin,Lovers who realize this are lovers forever,Sukumar Mandalika

Name: The Resignation Letter
Description:
After completing his B.Tech. degree from NIT Bhopal and working in a steel plant for two years, Baljeet finally moved to Mumbai to be a writer. He started off as a copywriter, and in the same year founded his theatre group called Dream Stage. One of the most well received shows of Dream Stage, Taboo Talks, was conceived and created by him. And since theatre can’t pay bills, at least in Mumbai, TV became his savior. Baljeet is writing screenplays for daily soaps these days, along with working on his films and web shows. And when he is not writing, he would be seen browsing for his travel plans. He loves solo-travels, silences, and sangrias.
\n For more updates, you can follow him on Facebook and Instagram or contact him at randhawa.baljeet@gmail.com
Short description:
Can Mechanical Engineering and Fashion Designing be on the same page? 
\n Naïve and idealistic, Patrick joins the promising Rajan Industries for hefty paychecks, lucrative perks and aspiring positions. Like for any other fresher from a prestigious engineering college, his training period isn’t anything less than a ‘honeymoon period’. But actual married life starts only when the honeymoon ends. 
\n What awaits next for Patrick counted in the least popular department, a boss with his brain on sabbatical, a jealous senior expert in ‘Et tu’ moments and inescapable office politics. The threshold of tolerating ugly experiences reaches in only nine months – standard pregnancy period – and what is born after that is Patrick version 2.0: the one who chooses to leave all at once but not in an ideal way this time.
\n What made it happen? A wearisome job, a provoking boss, his paralyzed creativity or just love?
\n The Resignation Letter is a coming of age story of a young engineer toppling from a greased and stained job in an outback town and falling over the lavish hanging robes on Delhi’s fashion-street.
Tags: Baljeet Randhawa,Coming of age,Contemporary novel,Delhi - Mumbai,dreams,Engineer,Engineering,Fashion,Fashion Designing,Love story,The Resignation Letter

Name: Broken Sparrow
Description: Born and brought up in a large middle class family, Raj Sinha completed his school education from St.Xavier’s, Patna. He then graduated in Economics from St.Xavier’s College, Kolkata before completing his post graduation in Business Management from XLRI, Jamshedpur. He began his corporate career with Asian Paints in 1975 and ended the same 38 years later with Bombay Dyeing. For 1 year he also taught Business Management as a fulltime Associate Professor at the Fore School of Management, New Delhi.
Short description: Down the river, up the stairs, You’ll find a garden lit with chairs, They’re white and deep, made from cane... Boyhood memories, free of stain.

Name: Water My Soul
Description: She is 40 years and has been passionate about writing poetry since she was a teenager. Her poems have deep meaning and revolve around life experiences and the spiritual journey within. She is a nature and horse lover. Likes simplicity in everything and is a very loving and compassionate human being.
Short description:
There is a journey of the soul into light and darkness,
\n into the heavens and the earth.The poet captures the
\n elusiveness of existence beautifully in topsy-turvy.
\n Basically that is life."
\n - Sakina Qutbuddin (Poet and Educationist)
\n 
\n 
\n - Women litterateurs have often compared the angst of creation of poetry to pangs of child birth. However, what comes at the end is worth all the trouble. To have an idea, please read the following works and wonder at the inspiration of the Muse. Look at the cycle of hurt and healing, the triumph of the indomitable human spirit and the rising of the phoenix from its own ashes.
\n -Aziz Ahmedi (Former Honourable Chief Justice of India)
\n 
\n 
\n - A resilient warrior who fights her day to day battles with courage and copes by writing beautiful poetry, transforming her experiences into a glorious victory.
\n - Zarina Screwvala (Founder Trustee Swades Foundation, Ex-Chief Creative Officer and Founder - UTV Software Communication)
\n 
\n 
\n - Spare and revelatory as Zen haiku, they remind us too of the longing of the Portuguese fado, the bhakti devotion of the Tamil saints, and the pain-in-love of the Persian ghazal.
\n -Christopher Queen (PhD, Lecturer on World Religions and Buddhism, Harvard Division of Continuing Education)

Name: Silent Sun
Description:
Ayushman Jamwal is a Senior News Editor at CNN-News18. He completed his graduation and post-graduation in Britain at the prestigious Cardiff University School of Journalism, and was inducted into the University’s Honour Roll.
\n He started writing poetry when he was a student at the Doon School in Dehradun. His first poetry collection ‘Chameleon Lights’ was featured in the top 10 poetry bestseller list 2017 on Amazon.com.
\n Ayushman also serves as a Board member of the Kunwar Viyogi Memorial Trust, established to promote and preserve the Dogri language spoken by the Duggar community of the Shivalik foothills. He curates the ‘Cultural Cocktail: Youth For Art’ initiative, a platform for innovation with a focus on convergence of classical, contemporary, regional and global literature and art forms. 
\n He lives with his parents, younger brother, grandmother and dog Leo.
Short description:
No longer chained to a fight for survival, we are consumed by an endless search for meaning, purpose and fulfilment through our meagre human instinct, fighting for communion and love against lonely existence, and even marvelling at what an afterlife has to offer.
\n We walk this earth forging and re-forging ourselves. Just like the sun, we do beautiful and unfortunate things in that constant struggle to be a little more than nothing. It is what makes us human. The creator, the preserver, the destroyer, the tormented, the hero, the enlightened, the faithful and the wanderer are all united by this virtue.
\n This is a celebration of the Silent Sun in all of us. 
\n The countless voiceless tales beckoned to the universe. The spirit that elevates us above our primordial origins. Find your fire between the lines.

Name: Lodgings In Oakwood
Description: Dhaval Nagar is born on 23rd April of 1994 in Ahmedabad in middle class family. He did his graduation at Gujarat University in 2014. At the age of twenty-one he begin writing, making continuous effort to become entertaining author. In 2017 he become Associate Member of ICAI. Now being in profession of Chartered Accountant he is providing his service in accounting industry. Currently he is living in Ahmedabad, Gujarat with his brother and parents.
Short description:
The time was the years after the death of Vasco Da Gama. Politics between nations grew insane. The life losing its importance. And a man from Portugal struggling to save his own life came to Kochi. He had his own purpose. He described himself as small trader and get lodged in the house of local boy who had his own problems given by the history. The history of Merchants of Chromatic sands. Their relationships with King. Their rise, their fall and sudden disappearance from Kochi. 
\nThere the man came to know the effect of those merchants not limited to the boy but their history has also done something to his past that he is still unaware. 
\nWill he able to find the true secrets of Merchants of Chromatic Sands?
\nOr he will die just like others who tried to find their history.
\n

Name: KRISHNA- THE SUPER CONSCIOUSNESS : THE HIGHEST PLEASURE LOVE AND SERVE
Description:
Om Prakash Nemani, born on 5th September 1936, in Kanpur is a graduate in commerce. He did his early schooling in Kanpur and graduated from Lucknow University. He was awarded Gold Medal and Chancellor’s Medal by Shri V.V. Giri, former President of India. 
\n
\nHe started his career as a Probationary officer in State Bank of India. Since, he belongs to a business family he left the job after five years of service and started his own manufacturing unit. He is widely travelled and has vast experience of various fields of business.
\n
\nSince, last 3 years he has come in touch with Sadguru Rameshji and is moving ahead on his journey on the path of spirituality. Nemani considers him a common man just like you living with family, earning his livelihood and moving in a society with very strong belief systems of happiness through materialistic success. His first book was HAPPINESS 24/7. It was widely appreciated and liked by the readers. He has now written this book to explain how the philosophy and teachings of Gita and Upanishads can be adopted and practiced in the context of present life and one can achieve the highest pleasure of love of the life and service to the mankind.
\n
\nHe can be reached via his face book page or via email at ompnem@gmail.com. Book can be ordered on Amazon and other on line portals..
Short description:
Duty is Divine. Result is the outcome. Gita never says, don’t have the goal but make the goal the mean not the end and enjoy achieving it. Gita is the ultimate Gyan which teaches us to enjoy our action. It was recited in the battlefield of Kurukshetra, when Arjuna was trying to shy away from the war. God says enjoy the battle of life, fight it out, enjoying every bit of it, by giving your full but without being affected by its result; which is not in your hands.
\n
\nWe walk through our lives as sleep walkers, never really present in what we are doing, never fully alert to our environment. Break free of the conditioned belief system and prejudices that limit your capacity to enjoy life in all its richness. 
\n
\nExpand your consciousness; don't just limit it to provide you immense pleasure in situations that touch you deeply; welcoming a new baby into the world the first time, being with someone at the moment of death-when we are aware of every moment, every sound and every thought.
\n
\nMy previous book “HAPPINESS 24/7” was widely appreciated. This book will accelerate your journey on the path of spirituality. It will help to expand yourself, who is a PURE SOUL, FULL OF PEACE, AND LOVE with DIVINE ENERGY in a HEALTHY BODY.

Name: Thanking You With Love...
Description:
What happens when an engineer turns into a writer?
\n 
\nBorn and brought up in Kolkata, Arjun has transformed his imaginations and created brilliant portraits from his day to day life into stories. His interests involve exotic trip planning and travelling. From getting stuck at the borders of Bangladesh to exploring the remote beauties of North East India to hopping onto a wild trip at Thailand to sand surfing in the desserts of Morocco his next target is to take the grand Trans - Siberian railway ride from Beijing to Moscow via Mongolia.
\n 
\nHaving worked in the domains of technology and education for a substantial period of time and having travelled across the length and breadth of India during his career, he wishes to capture the moments of his diverse experience and create stories out of them.
\n 
\nHe released the first edition of Thanking You With Love... in 2015 and his second novel titled Daddy’s Princess along with a book music album named Our Home in the Clouds at Bali, Indonesia in 2017.
\n 
\nArjun maintains a blogspot (www.qodro.com/blog) where he invites contributions from all writers, photographers, artists and musicians to highlight their talent. Those interested may write to info@qodro.com.
\n 
\nHis Facebook page is myGenie Entertainment and twitter handle is @royalbtiger.
\n 
\nHe may be contacted at arjunch7@yahoo.in for all official communications.
Short description:
“Certain relationships don’t have any name. They sprout from nowhere and disappear somewhere”
\n 
\n Ashwini and Vikram had become more than just friends. It was not that he was her boyfriend but she just felt like being with him always.
\n 
\n Life moved on and Ashwini matured over time realizing that the responsibilities and problems one had to shoulder were much more beyond the four walls of college. As time came for her engagement, Vikram not only disappeared from the scene but also did not get in touch with her ever.
\n 
\n What was in Vikram’s mind when he was with her all the while? Did he really care for Ashwini or was it just a hallucination?
\n Thanking You with Love…will hold the reader till the last page when Ashwini discovers a shocking truth upon returning to her hometown after six years.

Name: Jaltarang
Description:
She had a penchant for Hindi literature right from early
\nteens and won several competitions in Essay writing,
\nextempore, short stories writing etc. during her school
\ndays.
\nMore than 1000 articles, short stories, poems, etc.
\nhavegot published so far in India’s leading newspapers
\nand magazines. Few of the stories/books have been
\ntranslated intovarious other languages like Gujarati,
\nMarathi, Bengali and Punjabi.
\nSome of her key accolades:
\n•Two short stories were selected by Maharashtra
\nstate Education board and are now part of 9th
\nstandard syllabus
\n•Won several awards at state and national level,
\nmajor one’s being- GurudevRavindraNath Thakur
\nSaraswatSamman,KusumSmritiSamman, Katha
\nShilpSamman,
\n•Her stories were selected for research in UGC
\nSeminar in Pune and Mumbai
\n•Guest lecturer in Design Media and Management
\ncollege, Indore
\n•Secretary of VamaSahityaManch, Indore
\nBooks published so far:
\n•Jaltarang and Bijuka (short stories)
\n•Bhorwela and Setu (Stories)
\n•Mere Hisse ka Akash & Maa Beti (Poems)
\n•Parth…. TumheJeenaHoga (Novel)
\n
\nMrs. Jyoti Jain
\n1432/24, Nanda Nagar, Indore
\nMadhya Pradesh – 452011
\nM: 9300318182
\nEmail – jyotijain218@gmail.com
Short description:
JALTARANG”      is a collection of 75 short stories entailing “Maximum impact with minimum words. Exploring a range of emotions, each story evokes a different feeling. Every story deals with a social stigma and teaches us a  lesson without being preachy.
\nOriginally written in Hindi, this is the English translation of the book. Jyoti Jain is a Hindi writer who writes in all layouts of writing but has a penchant for short stories. She has been writing articles from the past 25 years.        
\nJaltarang –Hindi was her ϐirst book published in 2009 and since then she has 7 books to her credit.cam

Name: Interesting Insights into the Mind-to understand one's own mind - and of others
Description:
~ Alumnus of the Seth G. S. Medical College (KEM Hospital), Parel, Mumbai
\n ~ Member of the Indian Psychiatric Society, Bombay Psychiatric Society, Indian Medical Association
\n ~ Presented several research papers in national and international Psychiatric conferences
\n ~ Published several research papers in national and international Psychiatric and Psychology journals
\n ~ Nearly three decades of experience of treating patients using counselling and medicines
\n Other interests:
\n ~ Involved in saving birds. Made a documentary called ‘Our Birds’ and presented more than hundred live commentary shows of the same
\n ~ One of the Founder Members of the erstwhile Humour Club D3
Short description:
Often, we want to understand the minds of our teenage kids, spouses,colleagues and even suicide bombers. “How can a person think like this …?” Sometimes, we feel frustrated about our own mind: “Why can’t I remove this sadness, anxiety or anger from my mind?” Unfortunately, schools taught us about heart, intestine and kidneys – but not about ‘mind’! This book fills that gap.
\n It is a compilation of articles from the popular weekly column written by Dr.Shrirang Bakhle that was published in The Free Press Journal. The book is the result of readers’ demand for it.
\n It has interesting insights about more than 60 facets of the mind such as love and anger, adaptability, loneliness, meditation, addiction, emotions, how emotions influence thinking, how stress affects the mind and what can be done to prevent or reverse these changes. 
\n Although the articles are based on sound scientific principles, they are written in an easy, conversational style - without any jargon. 
\n 
\n “The book is clearly written with plenty of useful examples. Readers cannot help but benefit from its contents.” – Dr.Chittaranjan Andrade, Prof. and Head, Department of Psychopharmacology, National Institute of Mental Health and Neurosciences, Bangalore

Name: Seek
Description:
Atchuthan Carvalho is a post graduate in English literature from Mumbai University. 
\n This book is a result of a search for a hidden truth in life which he has realised through his own research, meditation and reflection.
\n His quest had been to find out why humans suffer? Why there is so much pain in existence and why are some more happy than others!
\n After close to ten years of search and reflection, he has decided to share what he thinks through poetic verses.
\n Here he talks about Enlightenment and understanding the true nature of the world around us and knowing what’s within.
\n Also follow him on 
\n Facebook –
\n https://www.facebook.com/Atchuthanc/
\n LinkedIn - 
\n https://www.linkedin.com/in/atchuthan-carvalho-14973512b
\n Instagram -
\n https://www.instagram.com/atchuthancarvalho
Short description:
We all are seeking something in some way or the other. It is a perenial quest and once we find what we are looking for, an ocean of immense happiness shall arrive. Somehow though true happiness eludes us and we keep searching but we are never quenched of this thirst. 
\n 
\n Wisdom is to know what to seek; it is said we may gain the whole world only to lose our soul. However if the soul is found, eternal bliss shall come to us forever. 
\n 
\n Our inherent nature is one of perfection as we are a part of an infinite consciousness. The same ocean of infinity that makes the whole universe roll also bmathes in us. 
\n 
\n My book gives you an introduction to basic ideas about our minds and away to seek a truth beyond it. l try to get you to a state of mind and a realization that what you seek is actually you. You are the happiness that you have been looking for.

Name: Nirvana for Dummies
Description:
PRASAD AUTY
\n
\nObjective-· ACT (Be an Author, Coach and Trainer) as the CATALYST to accelerate Human Development using Neuro-science, Yoga-science and Computer-science                                                                                                                                                                                 Education
\nMASTER OF TECHNOLOGY (M. TECH.) | 1990 | INDIAN INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY (IIT), MUMBAI
\nEXECUTIVE COACH | 2011 | NEURO LEADERSHIP GROUP
\n                                                                                                 
\nPublications                                                                                 
\nWISDOM MANAGEMENT
\n• Captures salient leadership and management principles in verse form. Foreword by Mr Anand Mahindra, Chairman & Managing Director (CMD), Mahindra & Mahindra Group. This book was published in 2005. 
\nA TO Z OF ORGANIZATION DEVELOPMENT
\n• Captures 26 models (one for each alphabet) for developing an organization. Foreword by Dr. Anand Deshpande, Chairman & Managing Director (CMD), Persistent System Ltd. This book was published in 2012.
\nGEET KRISHNAYAN
\n• Biography of Lord Krishna in prose and verse form. First published as weekly series of articles in local daily ‘Sakal’ in 2006 and later in book form by Mehta Publishing House, Pune, in 2007.                                                                                             
\n                                                                                                                               
\nExperience in Information Technology (IT) Industry
\n VICE PRESIDENT | PERSISTENT SYSTEM LTD. | 2010-2015
\nCORPORATE HEAD | TECH MAHINDRA LTD. | 2001-2010
\nASSOCIATE PROJECT MANAGER |INFOSYS LTD. | 1996-2001
\nCONSULTANT | CITICORP OVERSEAS SOFTWARE LTD. | 1993-1996
\nSENIOR SOFTWARE ENGINEER | TATA CONSULTANCY SERVICES | 1990-1993
\n
Short description: ‘Nirvana for Dummies’ unfolds the way to the state of perfect bliss for everyone. It lays down a step-by-step process for you to become happier, healthier and wiser no matter where you stand currently. It is an ideal self-help book for those who wish to swim, rather than sink, in the ocean called the ‘universe’ that Life has plunged us in!      The book blends ancient science of Yoga (Yoga-Shastra) with positive psychology. It is not a typical ‘Yoga’ book dwelling merely on postures or breathing techniques. What you WILL find inside ‘Nirvana for Dummies’ is a holistic approach for integrating Yoga-science into each situation and every action so that your entire life-experience becomes a celebration.Your life is a cyclical process. Each cycle consists of a stimulus from your environment, your cumulative response to it in terms of behavior and the results you reap thereof. This book will improve your Awareness through ‘Jnana Yoga’ (Yoga of Knowledge), Behavior through ‘Karma Yoga’ (Yoga of Action) and (acceptance of) Consequences through ‘Bhakti Yoga’ (Yoga of Surrender). The book will also demonstrate to you how practice of ‘Ashtanga Yoga’ (Eight-limbed Yoga) complements each of these facets.In an era where people are practicing Yoga in bits and pieces (and therefore deriving piecemeal benefits), this book tries to construct the entire jig-saw puzzle so you know precisely where YOUR pieces fit in. How ‘goose-bumpy’ is it then, based on this knowledge, to lead the rest of your life with full awareness, steely purpose and high-impact actions?

Name: ENAMOURED
Description:
SUBHASIS BANERJEE
\nThe author is an interior designer and a freelance nature and wildlife photographer by profession. ENAMOURED is his first novel.
Short description:
Barnali is a young, urban woman rocked by a perilous marriage. Her arranged marriage with Sandip, a garment exporter, heralds a series of diabolic predicaments in her life. Within months of her matrimony, she finds herself married to a perverted lecher. Being a very decent woman,she tries every trick in the book to tame her husband’s morals but with his utter recalcitrance, all her propitiations of salvaging the marriage appear futile. In the mean time, her purchased book gets inadvertently altered at the counter of a city book store one day. A day later, she fortuitously bumps into Chinmoy – the prodigious grandson of a colossal grandfather – the man with whom her book got altered, and thenceforth, her life incredibly starts coursing towards an intriguing destiny.
\n On the other hand, Palash, a Divisional Forest Officer, has to take care of a strange family which comes to stay for a vacation in a forest bungalow within his jurisdiction as his boss’s guests. But the rune of the pristine forests and the conjuration of both Palash and his boss's guests invoke an enigmatic tale of double incantation.

Name: Growing Up - A book of poems
Description:
RUHEE ADVANI
\nRuhee Advani is 30 years old, born and brought up in Bombay India and writes because writing is her passion, hobby, therapy and survival tool all rolled into one. She began writing at the tender age of eight and hasn’t stopped ever since. Apart from writing, Ruhee is into music, theatre, movies, science, sunshine, sports and basically everything that gleams with life. A lover and liver of life, Ruhee loves to do the occasional nothing. Poetry according to Ruhee is music in prose and she is grateful that poetry comes naturally to her. Growing Up is her very first collection of poems published.
Short description: Growing Up is a collection of poems that the author wrote during her growing years, her years of adolescence. As such they reflect all the agony and ecstasy of growing up. The pain and pleasure, joy and confusion, light and darkness of the teenage years are beautifully and poignantly expressed in this collection of poetry that will find resonance with everyone who has found growing up just a little bit difficult at times. ‘Nirvana for Dummies’, while covering the breadth of Yoga-science, strives to remove mysticism, misconceptions and jargon! It connects Yoga principles to modern science. It provides the foundation of positive psychology and logic to Yoga practices. It shows how to adapt these principles and practices to your daily routine.

Name: SMITTEN
Description:
PUJITA KRISHNA
\nTethered to a bitter sweet relationship with Hyderabad where she currently lives, Pujita Krishna’s unceasing fascination with human trials and tribulations is fed by the city’s multi-layered and diverse culture; it has informed her artistic temperament that sparks both her dance and her writing. She practices a unique temple tradition called Vilasini Natyam aside from Kuchipudi and has authored a book on the revival of ritual dancing at the Ranganathaswamy Temple in Hyderabad. Writing on whim on occasion and at other times furiously on matters that are close to her heart, she has had her short stories as well as articles published in different media over time. She writes regularly on dance for The Hindu. She has no pets but loves all animals from a distance and is a very fastidious lover of music, although her long and never ending affair with guys like CCR, America, and J J Cale carries on till the end of time. This is her first novella. She hopes it’s not going to be her last.
\n She can be reached at pujitak@gmail.com.
Short description:
Populated by women, their desires, dilemmas, decisions and doubts, this book undoubtedly seeks women as its favoured readers. Men are welcome to help themselves to it as well, but they may find themselves somewhat lost in a literary setting that nudges them aside, albeit playfully.
\n
\n At 28, Jayanti is seemingly a woman who has it all: a good looking fiancé who is a pilot in the Air Force, a well-paying cushy job, two loving parents and close friends. But in reality she is unravelling. Alok, her fiancé, doesn’t hold the mojo for her anymore. She hates her job. After six years on the same beat, she wants something more out of her life. Her life comes undone pretty much after her chance encounter with Russo at an art gallery in Hyderabad where she lives. Russo is not just an artist but also a drug dealer, working for a Goan drug overlord, Jimmy. Unsuspectingly, through a strange sequence of events involving her naïve maid Vijji, Jayanti finds herself in a heady situation mixed with drugs and goons that takes her to Gokarna, even as she falls head over heels in love with Russo. Her two friends Arpita, a Tollywood starlet and Srilaxmi, a much married woman looking for excitement, are along for the ride. The journey, although foolishly motivated, helps her and her friends, find some answers for themselves.

Name: Live-in a fake relationship
Description:
KAUSHIK JETHVA
\nKaushik Jethva is a human residing on planet Earth in this vast universe. He prefers his unique and peculiar manner and started his dream project — 1 Life : 7 Ways — when he was fifteen. After celerity of life in unforeseen sequences, at last he stopped thinking and started working on his fictions. He insists his adolescence is full of misunderstandings and mistakes which made him strong. Having authored his debut novel “Suicide: There is a way”, he feels he has learnt in stages, enhancing his creativity as a writer.
Short description:
“ … It’s a curse to strong relationships, hardcore dreams and energetic lives. Marriage is living in a fake relationship.”
\n 
\n So says an unknown woman in the dreams of Kabir Virdi, torturing him, blaming him as one of the reasons behind her death.
\n 
\n And when he reaches Mumbai in a pursuit to find out the daunting mystery, a series of events leads him to live-in with Maira Godbole. They frame the bond to serve their wildest fantasy—experiencing live-in—with a commitment to be unattached emotionally and not fall in love, naming it as Live-in a fake relationship.
\n 
\n But while Kabir fights the trauma of the woman appearing in his dreams, he must rectify his mother’s past mistake.
\n 
\n What if, all this while, Kabir falls for Maira?
\n 
\n He has to make a wise decision …
\n 
\n Love Complicated is a trilogy centring three different characters —Kabir Virdi, Kunwar Shah and Karanveer Virdi— in three different stories which are connected to each other. “Live-in a fake relationship” is the first part of the trilogy.

Name: Swaraj at 58
Description:
KUSAY SABUNWALA
\nKusay is how I am known as.I had a middle class upbringing in chawl system, in the heart of Mumbai.I moved away from the chaos of Mumbai to the calm serenity of Udaipur, the city being my native place.I have a happy small family of 'hum do humare do'. I want to be a dedicated parent to my children,a loving husband to my pretty wife and an adorable son to my ageing parents.
Short description:
15th August 1947, the date is ingrained in every Indian's mind.
\n Jana gana mana....... The sound floated in the air. Swaraj was rejoiced with singing of the anthem.
\n Swaraj in all its coming years saw ups and downs, many events shaped our free India.
\n The ills of Partition, Corruption, Dowry, Girl infanticide, Emergency, Reservation and Riots booed us down.
\n The bright side to it were Middle class emergence, Women empowerment, Liberalisation, India's surge towards economic progress.
\n All these factors were entwined with Swaraj the central character, in a happy coincidence.
\n The growth of independent India is filtered through the lens of Swaraj, the common Indian.
\n With Jana gana mana...... It all began
\n With Jana gana mana...... It all ends.
\n Paying its tribute to the rising nation.

Name: The SUPER KID
Description:
P. V. GEORGE
\nThe author, P.V. GEORGE, is a teacher by profession with a Master degree in English Literature from the Pune University and a recipient of the best teacher award from the Lion’s Club. He is also the author of the book, ‘SKITS FOR VARIOUS OCCASONS.’
Short description:
The SUPER KID is a fantasy story with unexpected twist of events and gripping suspense to keep you engrossed till the end. Having tortured by his step parents, Jim, the hero of the novel, runs away from his home. He meets an ugly looking old woman tied to a tree and he takes pity on her and releases her. At once the woman turns into an angel of unusual beauty, who grants him supernatural power by which he becomes the SUPER KID. He realizes his noble mission to help the people in distress. He takes up several daring adventures, encounters dreaded criminals and dons, busts their conspiracy, investigates the mystery of his missing parents etc. Be ready to meet the child SUPER HERO who will take you through a spell binding action drama and dare-devil adventure.The theme will appeal to the young and the old alike and anyone can certainly enjoy the fiction. Meaning of difficult words are provided in the end, chapter wise, to facilitate easy reading.
\n The theme will appeal to the young and the old alike and anyone can certainly enjoy the fiction. Meaning of difficult words are provided in the end, chapter wise, to facilitate easy reading.

Name: Vyom and the Royal Weapon
Description:
TRIPTY BHARDWAJ
\nTripty Bhardwaj is a scriptwriter, an anchor, a newsreader and a teacher. She is a Master's degree holder in Physics and a Bachelor's degree holder in Science as well as in Education. She has worked with Doordarshan as a scriptwriter and an anchor in the shows 'Geet Bahaar' and Geet Gunjan' for two and a half years and as a newsreader in an agricultural based show Krishi Darshan' for three years.
\nTripty has always been a voracious reader of variety of literature especially science fiction, mythology and thriller and mystery.
\nBeing a creative and self-motivated writer, she always tries to formulate her writing in a meaningful and logical manner. She 
\nsuccessfully turns her framework of mind into simple and understandable language.
\n
Short description:
Vyom: the sky of success, a global organisation, promotes international cooperation and 
\nstrives to establish world peace. One of its parts, Vyom Institute primarily works for the 
\nnational security and provides its students the skills, knowlegde and training to fulfil the 
\nresponsibilities to their country. 
\nVyom Institute faces challenges when its ex-member, Vikrant Kapoor, desperately searches 
\nfor the Royal Weapon which had been hidden in the past. 
\n Vyom's submarine, Mandakini, is attacked. Manasvi -55, a chip connecting two time 
\nmachines, is stolen from Vyom's Museum. World's two advanced humanoids stand against 
\neach other. Chancellor Jaywardhan Rathore and his team find themselves in a deep trouble 
\n created by someone present among them.
\n To get the answer what the Royal Weapon is and reach it before Vikrant does, five students  
\n from the institute, Prithviraj Malhotra, Kanak Singhania, Samrat Chopra, Kabeer Khan and Aavishkar
\n Arora, journey through time. They encounter unimaginable situations in their quest which
\n lead them to Ananyaakashganga, the Royal Weapon's Haven. 
\n
\nA fierce combat is fought where a brother leading an invincible army finishes a 700-year old 
\nunfinished business. 
\nA teacher is murdered. 
\nA father wishes his son to be dead rather than cursed. 
\nA tablet unfolds a way to the ultimate destination. 
\nA time machine is chased. 
\nA mask reveals a horrible carnage. 
\nAn armour becomes the reason of its bearer's defeat.
\nA code deciphers a warning for the enormous destruction. 
\n
\nWelcome to the world of VYOM.
\n
Tags: BecomeShakespeare.com,Fiction : Action and Adventure,Vyom and the Royal Weapon

Name: In Everness
Description:
SMITA JAYAKAR
\nSmita Jayakar is a veteran Bollywood actress who has turned on to explore the mysteries of life, experimenting with various techniques of Holistic healing. She has already published her book ‘Before Tomorrow’ that encompasses her life journey. 
\n
\nSmita’s area of expertise lies in ‘Aligning Energy Centres of the Body to enhance life skills’. She conducts workshops and seminars with private groups, college students, business professionals and non-profit organisations.
\n
\nFollow Smita on her Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/SmitaJayakar or visit her website http://www.newleaftrust.com
\n
Short description:
“A brilliant life affirming book…part memoir, part inspiration!”
\n
\n• Is there a sure shot formula to peace and happiness in life? 
\n
\n• Can Spirituality be made part of everyday being?
\n
\n• What is Stress?
\n
\n• How can you simplify things to enhance your personal and professional lives?
\n
\nIn this  compulsive read, actress and theatre artist Smita Jayakar brings together real life experience, scientific learning and the wisdom and knowledge collected through her explorations to design a practical guide that will give readers a thought-provoking insight into pertinent issues.
\n
\nThe book has already received excellent reviews…
\n
\n“In Everness teaches simple techniques how to be peaceful and happy…the language is reader friendly…a very well written book. I plan to apply its teaching in my day to day life.” 
\n– Mona Vasudev, Founding member, Club 55 Graceful Aging for Seniors, New Jersey.  
\n
\n“I carefully read the chapters on Stress, Calming the Mind, The Five Elements and Positive Balance. I realize that reading this book is like a ROAD MAP towards HAPPINESS. Thanks for writing this wonderful book.” 
\n– Jagdish V, Ex Senior VP, International Risk, BOA.
\n
\n“What I liked most about the book is that it does not seek to preach…in her own simple and conversational style, Smita has offered us practical tips and suggestions which is the quintessence of her deep reflection and mature learning.” 
\n– D.M. Sukhthankar, Former Chief Secretary, Govt of Maharashtra.
Categories: Body, Mind and Spirit: Astrology|Self help|Spiritual
Tags: body and spirit,Happiness,Inspirational,Meditation,Mind,Motivational,Personal Growth,Professional growth,Self discovery,Self Help,Spirituality,Stress busters

Name: In Love With Jatinga
Description:
DR. TAPATI BARUAH KASHYAP
\nDr Tapati Baruah kashyap is a noted Guwahati-based bi-lingual writer who has over ten books to her credit. They include three collections of poems in English –Peace of Silence (2001), A Discovery (2008), Winding Ways (2013), two critical works on Assamese Women poets (One in English, the other in Assamese), a collection of biographies of 50 empowered women and a handbook on women rights, among others. A PhD from Gauhati University on the topic ‘Seamus Heaney and W.B Yeats:A Comparative Study’, she is also winner of two prestigious awards –Kunjabala Devi Memorial Award instituted by ‘The Assam Tribune Group in 2004 and Laadli Media Award by Population First and UNFPA n 2011. She also writes a regular column in Dainik Asam apart from being a regular contributor to ‘The Assam Tribune’ and ‘Harmony’.
Short description: It is a collection of 50 poems written by Dr Tapati Baruah Kashyap in the backdrop of Jatinga, Haflong and other places of natural beauty in Dima Hasao district of Assam, India.
Tags: Assam,General,In Love with Jatinga,Nature,poetry,Tapati Baruah Kashyap

Name: EMOTIVITY : A Pursuit of Emotions and Creativity
Description:
BELLY KANUNGO
\nBelly Kanungo, an ex Radio Jockey, Show Producer, Columnist and a present day iconic Food Blogger & Youtube Vlogger, takes the leap to accomplish her vision of inspiring others by bringing out the emotional experiences, which not only carved her creative life but also made her what she is today.
Short description:
“LET YOUR CREATIVITY FLOW HAPPILY IN VARIOUS DIRECTIONS TO CREATE AN ULTIMATE MASTERPIECE OF YOUR OWN CHOICE.”
\n Emotivity will not just talk about people in the creative professions, but also about all those who are creative in general, who think differently from the methodical norms of life and who want to be better with each learning experience of life.
\n EMOTIVITY will be a book for all those who are over thinkers; who are trying to know what they are meant to be but have not realized it yet.
\n EMOTIVITY will be a book for those who are driven by passion.
\n EMOTIVITY will act as a tool to rescue the creative minds from the vicious circle that they find themselves trapped in whilst battling with emotions such as fear, anger, unhappiness, and so on.
\n EMOTIVITY targets to help the naturally talented minds that possess creative skills like painting, dancing, acting, writing, singing and so on, but are unaware of the art of tackling the emotional and social barriers that their creative melancholic side reconciles with.

Name: The Rough Edges
Description:
SHAURYAVIR
\nShauryavir Singh is an intense writer, an art lover and an automobile geek. He holds a Management degree from the Indian School of Business and an Engineering degree from Thapar University, Patiala. When he is not juggling marketing and business strategy at his day job, he surrenders to his passion for writing, weaving his experiences in words with a thread of fictionalized adornments. 
\n 
\n Considering himself an extremely sensitive person, Shauryavir writes to create space for his thoughts on a wide variety of topics buried underneath the banality our daily lives. Countless days of musings and a million long drives later, Shauryavir hopes to touch lives through this tale of love and loss in his first book. Currently, he lives in New Delhi.
Short description:
What is the ultimate test of love? 
\n 
\n Getting pregnant with a stranger’s child to see if the man you’re being forced into an arranged marriage with, accepts you or not. 
\n 
\n Or sacrificing your self respect at the altar of neurotic behaviour to see if that one person reciprocates your love inspite of your glaring physical flaws. 
\n 
\n Or pursuing a long lost crush just before they are about to get married to see if the past can be veered into a new future against all odds.
\n 
\n As Alia, Shahid and Mehak go down a dark road searching and testing for love, Fate simply reflects their twisted ways by weaving their lives into an inextricable tangle. Little do they know that beyond all that complexity, their journey would transform into one of self-discovery.

Name: Diluted
Description:
VISHAL V KUMAR
\nVishal V Kumar is a medical student who resides in Bangalore, India. His love for literature started while he was
\nin school. His long time dream of becoming an author was realised with his debut book, ""Diluted"". He plans to continue writing more books along with his profession as a doctor.
\n
Short description:
Vikas, once surrounded by the innocence of
\n youth, experiences a tragic incident which 
\nscars him for life. Unable to forget his 
\nmistake, he is stuck between his hopes and
\n the guilt that pushes him towards decisions
\n with the worst of consequences. Now,  
\nhoping to fix his melancholic life, he takes 
\nbrave and drastic steps. Will he be able to  
\nbeat the odds and lead a life that he dreams
\n about, or will he fall prey to the darkness
\nthat has been hanging over him like a cloud?
\n

Name: Three pegs of whiskey in Mumbai
Description:
SOUVIK DAS GUPTA
\nI am deeply inspired by the things that come straight to me without much difficulties and at the same time which comes by chance, I appreciate wholly. My ideas are imperative and never ending and suits to the every classy people. My stories reflects the perfect blend of Literature and the Imagination. One can feel the swing of Imaginations by going through any of my book. It can lead you to feel extreme good about me or sometime may take you with surprise by the amount of extreme good usage of Literature and authors concepted imaginative thoughts, which seriously need an introspect by others. Reading itself is equavalent to believing so am i speaking worthy, prove yourself.   
\n
Short description:
This book is all about the ethnic corporate culture of Indian multinational companies which goes extensively into extreme rough weather not because one is having its sales figures detoriated but due to other using an unlawful things to tarnish the established brand. Can you imagine a corporate war to initaite the major upside down for the company's top bosses, the sales teams and the second line managers. In this corporate war who will listen to whom when money spent like a water to buy the best performers of the company to hijack the quarterly sales figure of entire pan India business.
