Mumbai never had witnessed a financial war before as thousands of sales personal from entire India unite ultimately to join this war against the causative force to defeat it by extensively keeping round the clock watch and revolt with an extreme action.The causative person behind all these is the best brain of Harward University who has extramarital affair and loved his girl friend whom he promise to marry. The woman luck might be with him, as a womanizer and a billionaire he nearly succeed in whatever he does, even in purchasing company stalwarts at any unprecedented price. The corporate war has just begin, be a part of it to understand if you are a part of this situation what you would do?
\n

Name: The Five Year Old Man
Description:
DEBASHISH CHAKRABORTY
\nDebashish Chakraborty is an Engineer with a Master’s degree from National Institute of Technology Rourkela. A self-diagnosed sociopath and typical nerd, he likes to spend his time with fictional people rather than the real ones. With an active interest in real life science as well as science fiction, he wants to tell stories that teach as much as they entertain and “The Five Year Old Man” is his debut novel. 
\n He previously published a short fantasy story titled “The day Death smiled!” and gave it as a free sample of his work. Encouraged by the positive reviews it earned, he decided to burden the world with his first full-length novel.
\n Apart from reading and writing, he takes a keen interest in sci-fi and fantasy television series and movies and plans to pursue a doctorate soon.
\n
\n Debashish Chakraborty is an Engineer with a Master’s degree from National Institute of Technology Rourkela. A self-diagnosed sociopath and typical nerd, he likes to spend his time with fictional people rather than the real ones. With an active interest in real life science as well as science fiction, he wants to tell stories that teach as much as they entertain and “The Five Year Old Man” is his debut novel. 
\n He previously published a short fantasy story titled “The day Death smiled!” and gave it as a free sample of his work. Encouraged by the positive reviews it earned, he decided to burden the world with his first full-length novel.
\n Apart from reading and writing, he takes a keen interest in sci-fi and fantasy television series and movies and plans to pursue a doctorate soon.
\n
\n Debashish Chakraborty is an Engineer with a Master’s degree from National Institute of Technology Rourkela. A self-diagnosed sociopath and typical nerd, he likes to spend his time with fictional people rather than the real ones. With an active interest in real life science as well as science fiction, he wants to tell stories that teach as much as they entertain and “The Five Year Old Man” is his debut novel. 
\n He previously published a short fantasy story titled “The day Death smiled!” and gave it as a free sample of his work. Encouraged by the positive reviews it earned, he decided to burden the world with his first full-length novel.
\n Apart from reading and writing, he takes a keen interest in sci-fi and fantasy television series and movies and plans to pursue a doctorate soon.
Short description:
Dr VENKATESHWARA IYER is an Artificial Intelligence expert, whose career is marred by a controversial failure. Together with his friends and Colleagues, Dr ANNA AINSWORTH and SHEN JIAMO, he creates ‘ISAAC’, an A.I with the naivety of an infant and near-free will of a man, that can learn and adapt with time. But how human should, and will, a machine become? Human enough to murder?
\n Is ANUJ JOHNSON right to dread Isaac? Or is he just biased against robots for losing his job to them? Will Venkatesh’s work prove to be a breakthrough for the humankind, or just a repeat of his lethal mistakes?
\n Innocents will become collateral when the two ideologies collide, and a nation will bear witness as an honoured scientist is dragged to court. In the future when A.I will intertwine with our lives, when men will fall and lose their humanity, will Isaac be able to prove his own?

Name: Tick Tock
Description:
RAHUL P BHANDARE
\nI’ve awkwardly stumbled through engineering, a job at Godrej, and working
\nas a writer in advertising.
\nBut the love for stories and drawing has been with me since my childhood.
\nEven now, making comics remains a source of great joy. A joy that I’d like
\nto share through my stories.
\n- Rahul P Bhandare
\nFor more comics, please visit thecomicspace.in
Short description:
Good or bad. Simple or complicated
\n 
\n Ultimately, life just goes on.
\n 
\n Here's a story of a writer watch that closely depicts the chaos of our own lives. Told only through images, this immersive tale holds a profound message.
\n 
\n 'A lovely little tale of where a watch begins and where time takes it'
\n Alicia Souza , Illustrator
\n 
\n 'Bhandhare with his simplified illustrations and easy to understand language teaches us what life actually is!'
\n 
\n 'Rahul's concept is brilliant. Through the simple black and white lines, he has been able to convey a meaning deeper than what meets the eye'
\n Abhijeet Kini, Comics Artist

Name: Underbelly of Life
Description:
SUNEET PAUL
\nBorn in Nairobi, Kenya- Suneet Paul in his earlier years was exposed to diverse cultures within India, thanks to the gypsy urges of his parents. He comes from a family involved with literature. An architect by training, he is a creative writer and editor of a magazine. Suneet has authored a couple of books in short fiction and has been published in various magazines of the country and online literary portals. Painting is a hobby for him.
Short description: Heart-warming, heart touching, earthy, raw and stark reality...all by one writer…. Panning across all genres, each story is a revelation.... if one takes you in a journey inwards the other looks outward to a myopic world. The stories help you traverse from the urbane life to the slums to the middle class roll on. The mesh of relationships, conjugal, sibling, extra-marital-so delicately sketched and eloquently worded. All with one underlying messageafter all we are all mortals. No judgement, just an interlude which encompasses all the good, the bad, the ugly, the beautiful ……. And leaves it to the reader to release and realise. --Ranjana Joshi Literati, poetess and actress. Author of Visual Poetry book – Walking Shadows.

Name: Quick Whispers - Short and Mini stories
Description:
AMARENDRA PATTANAIK
\nAmarendra Pattnaik is a native of Odisha (India). He graduated in engineering from University College of Engineering, Burla in 1989 and later pursued MBA at Xavier Institute of Management, Bhubaneswar. After working for twenty years in the corporate sector, he shifted to academics and currently he is a Professor at KIIT University. Watching people and writing about their emotions is his passion. He loves talking to people and listening to their stories. He writes stories with two objectives – to make the readers smile and to make them think. He can be contacted at amarendra.pattnaik.aa@gmail.com.
Short description: Sandwiched between two travelogues, Shillong Diary and Jirang Diary, this story book is a collection of short and mini stories. Most of the stories have been written around human emotions. Some stories have animals and birds as the main characters. The story “Apples and Oranges” shows how these fruits are taunting each other to prove their supremacy. “The Lazy Bull” highlights how we all are busy in our life while he is enjoying his life lazily. These quick reads promise to make you smile and also make you feel nostalgic.
Tags: Anthology,Fables,Indian Fiction,Short Stories by Indian Writers,Short Stories by Odia Writers,Short Stories in English,Travelogues

Name: 101 Mantras for Living with Really Happier Experiences in Life
Description:
RATAN BUDHANI
\nMr.Ratan Budhani is a seeker, a quick learner, a high thinker, a reader of self-help writings, an
\nauthor, a coach and a guide. He is a keen student that keeps learning about one of the most wonderful
\nsubjects that's called 'LIFE'. This has always motivated him to look for various teachings, techniques and
\ntools that can be helpful to everyone in taking control of their lives.
\nAn engineer turned management consulting professional, a passionate life success coach and an author
\nwith experience in different fields, over the past 45 years he has been a manager, entrepreneur, trainer
\nand consultant. For the past 10 years now, he has been helping individuals to improve the quality of their
\nlives, from complete transformation to significant awakening and awareness. With a variety of learning
\nand training experiences behind him and a thoughtful mind he decided to share some of his best ideas
\nand experiences in life with one and all and as a result he authored a book 'From Survival to Success'.
\nOver the years he has helped clients break through barriers in their personal, business and professional
\nlives. He can help individuals with career development, money management, time management and
\norganizational skills, improving relationships, coping with change, improving self esteem and creating a
\npositive life-image. He is very passionate about helping people feel better about them so that they can
\nlead richer and fuller lives.
\nAs a direct outcome of his real-life experiences he has realized that despite one’s circumstances or
\nperceived limitations, one can develop the life and culture s/he wants.
\nSeeking out the wisdom, knowledge & experience of others who have already been where people are at
\nnow is a valuable resource. And that's exactly what he offers people.
\nA question: Who lives a truly successful life?
\nHis answer: The person who lives life fully, all the time glowing with life’s positive energy.
Short description:
These are some of the excerpts from the book. 
\n • Why are we born? This question poses a great challenge for many of us. The best answer to this would be…..
\n • The poor long for riches, the rich long for heaven, but the wise long for a peaceful mind.
\n • In order to perform optimally you need to nurture your body. You wouldn’t fill your car with sludge, leave it in the garage for five years, and then expect it to win a race.
\n • Every day you are impacting the world, and every day you are creating your life through your thoughts. Think whatever you like, big or small, rich or poor, fair or unfair, and those thoughts will strive to become the things and events of your life. It’s an immutable law.
\n • Every human action is either driven by fear or by greed. Beyond the shadow of a doubt both are negative vibrations. One of the best ways you can MAKE yourself happier, in all your attempts, is begin to come from a positive vibration and that’s love.
\n • Your expectations can literally influence your real life experiences. So be aware and consciously choose to create positive expectation with everything you do...
\n • Do what you love and enjoyment will follow. Do what you love and you will feel more fulfilled. Do what you love and the money will seem less relevant. Do what you love, and you’ll never work a day in your life. Alongside, love what you do and you come out a shining star.
\n • Enjoy the process and be willing to accept what comes your way. No matter how successful you are, if you have not stopped to enjoy yourself along the way, your success is half-full. Secret of happiness is not found in receiving more, but in developing the capacity to enjoy more. 
\n • Mistakes come from: acting in ignorance or in innocence or through carelessness or acting hastily or acting in fear or acting in worry or acting in doubt or acting under anxiety.
Tags: 101 Mantras for Living with Really Happier Experiences in Life,BecomeShakespeare.com,Ratan Budhani,Wordit CDE

Name: From Aaji's kitchen - Bliss on a plate
Description:
ANAGHA RAMAKANT DESAI
\n 
\nA graduate in science, has worked as an analytical chemist for 35 years. Working as an Analytical Chemist, gave her an in-depth view into food and various food processes and enabled her to understand the composition ofspices and flavours better. 
\n
\nHer husband, Ace Indian Cricketer (Late) Mr. Ramakant Desai, was instrumental in exposing her to new cuisines from various parts of the world and learnt to respect them. 
\n
\nThis book is an attempt to preserve Desai family recipes and cuisine for the younger generation.
\n
Short description:
The Book can also be called "Desai Family Cookbook". This is a collection of our favourite recipes which we like to eat and serve our elders did. The Book portrays nostalgic aroma of my Mother in Laws kitchen. We intend to gift this to our children, grandchildren and future generations to come
\n
Tags: Anagha,Cookbook,Cooking,Eating,Everyday Indian Food,Healthy Food,Ketogenic Diet,Konkan,Konkan Cuisine,Lifestyle Cuisine,Maharashtra Food,Nutrition,Recipe Journal,Veganism

Name: The Station Master
Description:
INDRANIL MUKHERJEE
\nIndranil Mukherjee is an aspiring author of fiction but a long-time amateur writer, who has taken a break from his software career to give expression to his main passion: Writing. And if provided with timely sustenance to keep body and soul together, he loves to read. Besides these, he digs driving, travelling to all corners of the world, sampling all variety of food, meeting people, learning new stuff, listening to music, and about a couple of hundred other things. Curious about life, and armed with 25 years’ worth of experience observing people from all over the world while working with them, he fancies he has stories to tell. Rather nifty ones.
\n Besides completing this collection of short stories based on an Indian Railways officer’s real-life experiences—“The Station Master” is his debut book—he has several works underway that comprise sci-fi, fantasy-humour-adventure, thriller, and has a maelstrom of other plots whirling in his head that occasionally meld nicely to create interesting dreams. And yes, a spot of scripting too.
\n Indranil is married to Sanghamitra, and they live in Delhi, while their son, Ayoush, is on the verge of completing his masters in the US.
\n He can be found at www.indranil-mukherjee.com where his blog lives, awaiting updates on life, the universe, and everything.
Short description:
What would you do?
\n When confronted with the impossible? The ghostly? The bizarre? The dangerous? Challenges demanding answers? With or without adequate resources? Against the clock?
\n Meet Manab Banerjee, the Station Master. A regular guy, like you, or that guy there wearing that rather nondescript shirt. Except, as the quintessential Indian Railways man, he dealt with them routinely…
\n Strange wails in the still of a misty night… a bloody beheading on the platform… a mysterious lady with an aura of danger… gold biscuits… a brutal murder… a catastrophic accident in the station… and a storm that led to a death and its consequences… all these and more. Manab meets them head-on in this collection of ten stories based on real life, resolute but accommodating, quick yet patient… and always with his heart in the right place.
Tags: Accident,Adventure,Bihar,Diesel engine,India,Indian Railways,Rail accident,Real life stories,Station Master

Name: Beloved Childhood
Description:
VIDUSHI GARG
\nVidushi Garg is a software engineer and lives in
\n Gurgaon. She was born in Budhana, a small rural town
\n in the state of Uttar Pradesh in north India. Her
\n schooling was from Navodaya Vidyalya, Baghra (2009
\n batch). She is not a writer by profession, but her love for
\n writing led her to write this book, which is inspired from
\n her journey in Navodaya. In her free time, Vidushi likes
\n to watch movies or chat with her friends. You can
\n connect with Vidushi on Instagram @vidushi.garg.7 or
\n on Facebook.
Short description:
Don’t children in the villages have the right to education? Don’t they have
\nthe right to study in a good English-medium school? Don’t they have the right to live with their parents? Or do they always have to be the ones who must migrate in search of good education?
\nTeena is a 13-year-old girl who has always longed to study in a good English medium school. But there are no such schools in her small town. She clears the entrance test to a reputed residential school and then she discovers what it
\nis like to choose between your parents and an education.
\nWhich will she choose?

Name: ECHO IN THE HILL
Description:
SANGBOI K. GANGTE
\nSangboi K. Gangte is a 23 year old from Churachandpur, Manipur. When he’s not writing or eating, he’s performing the drudgery of preparing for civil service examination which he hopes to crack someday. He’s a graduate from St. Stephens College, Delhi and did his schooling from JMS, Balrampur, Uttar Pradesh and Mt. Carmel, New Delhi. Meaningful conversations over coffee and long evening walks are among other things he enjoy.
Short description: He looked into the darkness and tried to soak in the words. His apprehension was apparent, yet he continued his smoke, seeking in it the sedative for the ache of all the questions to which he seemed to possess no answers. echo in the hill is an appealingly simple collection of bittersweet short stories which offers a mirror into the rustic and homely sphere of countryside we gradually have left behind. In ‘Inheritance,’ Hengo Bhai contemplates the realities of his roots that he knew had never existed; a kid comes home for vacation to discover his parent’s deteriorating marriage in ‘A Syrup Story’; while Siem’s infatuation for a college senior pushes him further into self introspection and soul searching. Each of the stories aptly tries to capture and explore themes of love, faith, hatred, regret, identity, misfortune, freedom, among other things - almost all set in the backdrop of the picturesque disorder of Lamka Churachandpur, Manipur.
Tags: Anthologies,Coming of age,Feel-good,Memories,North-east India,Sweet and wholesome

Name: Tears of Kashmir - A saga of Six Murders
Description:
SIMRAN BELLANI
\nSimran Bellani (maiden name: Namrata Thakkar) is an engineer by qualification but a content writer, poet and travel blogger by profession. She loves to read and write stories. A pro in story telling since young age, she feels she was destined to be an author ultimately in life. Tears of Kashmir is her debut novel. She is hopelessly optimistic and people look up to her for much needed pep talks in life. You can reach her at bellanisimran@gmail.com. Follow her on Facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/authorSimranBellani/ and Instagram at: @bellanisimran
Short description:
• In her quest to investigate her two elder sister’s deaths that happened in exactly same manner, 19 years old Aafreen stumbles upon something that she should not have known. 
\n 
\n • Now that she has known it, she has to be silenced. But Aafreen is not a meek girl as the dark people responsible for dark secrets have presumed. They have a tough time getting hold of her. Brave Aafreen loses her family, friends and all those people whom she loved. 
\n 
\n • She manages to flee from the clutches of dark people but suffers a terrible depression thereafter. People around her keep on dying. She doesn’t know what’s going on. She always feels she is being watched. Every moment makes her feel that she is the next in line to die at unknown hands. 
\n 
\n • She is saved from these thoughts by the police who astonishingly accuse her of all the murders- merciless murders of 6 men.
\n • Has she really committed those murders or is somebody trying to frame her up? Will Aafreen ever be able to live a normal life? Will she ever be loved again? Prepare yourselves for an intriguing read.
Tags: Best selling crime novel,Books about Kashmir,Crime Fiction,Crime thrillers,Mystery novels,Story of Kashmir

Name: The Faith
Description:
GEORGE VILSON
\nBorn toVazhappilly Lazar and Kunjilakutty Lazar, in a small village called, Kottapadi, Thrissur, Kerala, INDIA,but he was known as a person from Guruvayur.
\nHe wrote several stories about Migration, particularly from Kerala, to different parts of the world, and their living conditions, hardships, employment opportunities, etc. in the migrated countries and their parental homes back in Kerala in English and Malayalam. He had published around 9 books in Malayalam, compilation of short-stories [5], novelettes [1], screenplay [1] and novels [2] and a book in English, The Black Woman [compilation of short-stories].
\nHis wife is Lizy, daughter Liji and son, REX.  
\npleasantvilla@hotmail.com
Short description:
“The Faith” is an exquisitely crafted and highly enriching novel, where the reader enjoys the fun and freedom of endless exploration. It is a magical synthesis of strangeness and beauty packed with suspense and surprise. The novel is a quest for the unknown, the unexplained. Guilt and remorse are watered down when the high priest of holy sacrament forgives and extends a hand to support and rescue the lame lamp.
\nMan and woman are made for each other, no doubt but how to search for the right partner to share the apple of knowledge with her. There the journey begins, but never ends. The life of Raajasekharan Nair was a quest for a comfort zone from the beginning. He has many superstitions, inhibitions, emotional weaknesses, and always thinks with his heart rather than head. It’s a story of those who think like him, when the unattended, unrestrained emotional thirst causes disturbances and ruin.
\nA marvellous story with wide implications to modern life is narrated with an ease and passion which is incomparable in contemporary literature, executed in brilliant style; that’s “The Faith.”

Name: Kuch Mahki Si Kuch Bhaki si
Description:
SHASHI KOTHARI
\nShashi kothari born in Rajasthan but brought up in Andhra Pradesh is a graduate in economics with diploma in painting, dress designing, batik, journalism, German language. 
\nReading, contemplating, meditating and watching nature are her major timepass.
\nShe has published four books in Hindi, Jab nadiya bahna bhool gayi ( poems on soul quest ), Bah gaya main, rah gaya main ( poems on joyous living ), Dhadak raha saagar boond mei ( four liners on love and devotion) and this fourth book.
\nShe has also translated into English six Hindi books of Acharya Ratna sunder Suri ( recipient of Padma Vibhushan and Raj pratibodhak award ) and writer of more than 300 books.
\n
Short description:
Kuch bahki si, kuch mahki si - a collection of poems, flowing from a heart intoxicated in love for Self, nature and unknown beloved, accompanied by beautiful black and white sketches of women( profile as well as figures) and a foreword by Swami Ageh Bharti
\n(One of Osho’s oldest disciples and author of 20 books on Osho).
\n
Tags: Beautiful,Kuch Mahki Si Kuch Bahki Si,poems,poetry,Shashi Kothari

Name: Hate in the time of Malaria
Description:
BALU GEORGE
\nBalu George is a Chartered Accountant hailing from Cochin. He has been staying in Bangalore for the past 10 years. He has attended the Bangalore Writers Workshop. His works have been published in The Hindu, Literary Yard and Spark.
\n
Short description: This is a collection of screenplays, 4 comedies and a love story. “Hate in the time of Malaria” humorously depicts a young advertising executive’s attempt to woo an activist. “Life is a tale told by an idiot” depicts the goings on in a small law firm in Cochin. “Unlucky Tony” is about a Chartered Accountant who is down on his luck and how he is duped by two of his colleagues in a get rich quick scheme. “Ann“ is the love story of a girl with Bipolar disorder. “Dad I am having a heart attack” is about a girl who is desperate to lose her virginity.
Tags: Balu George,BecomeShakespeare.com,Hate in the time of Malaria,humor,Wordit CDE

Name: A Vintage Tale - What Past is Prologue
Description:
M.M.MARKS
\nMalvika Mishra grew up in a family of academicians and was brought up on a steady diet of literary classics ranging from Asimov to Bronte. Growing up in a house full of opinionated individuals who discussed Jane Austen and Munshi Premchand in the same breath, it was only natural that she opted for her Bachelors in English Literature. However, following in the footsteps of middle class India, she earned her MBA in Human Resource Management. After giving up her corporate job, she worked as a freelance academic writer before turning in to write the most important chapter of her life--motherhood. 
\n 
\n Malvika completed a Fiction Writing workshop at the Princeton Adult School in 2016. She had been invested in writing her debut novel for the last four and a half years. Meanwhile, she has been published online on prestigious writing platforms like Juggernaut and Readomania. Her story Remorse (published on Readomania) was also provisionally selected by Critical Literary Review India for their magazine. 
\n 
\n As a writer Malvika blends in modern sensibilities with traditional storytelling formats, thus exploring literary fiction with a fresh perspective. She is a Vintage aficionado which also reflects in the genre she loves to write in--Historical Fiction. 
\n She lives in Bangalore with her family.
Short description:
Amrita came across an intriguing tombstone in a quaint Darjeeling cemetery. The epitaph
\nwith its tale of lost love drew her to question her own understanding of love and life. While
\nher interest was piqued, her heart ached because she was on her honeymoon, trying to find a
\nreason to continue her four-months old marriage. The slender alleys of Darjeeling lured her to
\ndiscover a tale beyond the curtain of time. But how?

Name: Patparganj Blues
Description:
SHASHANK UNIYAL
\nA music teacher, writer, observer.
Short description: “PATPARGANJ BLUES” is set up somewhere around the early 2013 and deals with the delusional, irritated, lost and pseudo-intellectual mindset of today’s generation. Although the story is setup in today’s modern India, the topics it covers has been around since the dawn of mankind! The absurdity of religion, the rebellion against authority, the ego of the naïve, the naivety of the young, the anxious youth, the nostalgic memories, and the craving for euphoria and love.-All of these topics covered under the light-hearted conversations made by three degenerates or the “Indian” version of punks.

Name: CATASTROPHE
Description:
SANJAY VERMA
\nDr. Sanjay Verma is an alumnus of RIMC, Dehradun. A military enthusiast, he underwent the military training at NDA, IMA and was commissioned into The Central India Horse, an Armoured Regiment of Indian Army, in June 1983. 
\n He is a graduate of the prestigious Defence Services Staff College and has served on three operational assignments including an active tenure in Gurez Sector of J&K on line of control in a high altitude area. He did his PhD in Sustainable Human Development from Jamia Hamdard University, New Delhi. 
\n He took premature release as a Colonel and joined the corporate fraternity for a second career. He has worked with organizations such as NDPL (Tata Power JV), HCL Technology and Larsen &Toubro. He is currently the Vice President and Head Petrochemical Academy of Reliance Industries. 
\n Sanjay enjoys reading, writing and travelling. He is passionate about training,coaching and has a creative approach.
\n Corporate Cocktailpublished in Aug 2017 was his first work. Catastrophe is his second book and first novel. 
\n He can be contacted at sanjay.mona2001@gmail.com
Short description:
Catastropheis purely a piece of fiction inspired by real incidents in the life of a soldier who faces tremendous hardships in fighting terrorists and enemies. Narendra who is capable of protecting his motherland is unable to protect his own family. He gets disillusioned by his inability to overcome the societal injustice where even hisown blood becomes a tormentor.
\n
\nThe intelligible expression, supported by heart-piercing and emotionaldescription aligns the readers with the realities of life where the sharks are out on a prowl for their prey. The catastrophic event of his life forces him to quit his loved profession and settle for a compromise.

Name: A Passerby’s Diary
Description:
SARATHA
\nSaratha completed her Electronics and Communication engineering from Government College of Technology, Coimbatore in 2001. She started her career with Wipro Technologies, and after a couple of years moved to Cognizant Technology Solutions. After having worked for about a decade in the IT industry, she took a break from her professional career to pursue her passion in writing stories and poems.
Short description:
A collection of short stories that are woven with characters and plots, eliciting deep emotions, which stay close to one’s heart. 
\n 
\n Sridhar’s return journey that was not the same …
\n The pain behind Vasanthi teacher’s beautiful smile … 
\n The secret behind the Calling bell … 
\n Only thing that Ramu thatha could never forget in his life …
\n The lesson learnt by Prasad from a stranger …
\n How conscience proves its supremacy …
\n Other side of anything that is easily overlooked and judged …
\n The self-revelation of the narrator about her pride …
Tags: Anthology,Fables,Indian Fiction Writers,Mini stories,Short Stories by Indian Writers,Short stories by South Indian writers,Short Stories in English,Short-stories

Name: Divided Destinies
Description:
APARNA SURESH
\nHaving lived in beautiful cities like Fort Cochin and Dubai, Aparna Suresh currently resides in Bangalore, the Garden City of India. Her first book, ‘Ordinary Lives’, was published by Leadstart Publishers in December 2013. When she isn’t writing, she is busy running her recruitment firm. Home is with her entrepreneur husband, Jerry, and their two teenage children — Dhruv and Diya.
Short description:
Arya, the past is better left in the past. It’s useless to go looking at the past for any answers. You won’t find them.’
\nThose were her mother’s words of warning when Arya told her about her plans to visit India. But how can Arya refuse to go when her father asks her to?
\nWith the help of her father’s friend, Group Captain Raghuvir Singh, Arya begins unravelling the mystery behind her father’s strange request.
\nWhat awaits Arya at the end of the journey? Why has her father sent her to India now? And why was her mother so upset about her going?
\n Arya journeys into the past, but here in the present, other discoveries wait for her — if she chooses to see them.
Tags: Aparna Suresh,Contemporary Fiction,Divided destinies,Indian Literature,Romance,Women's Fiction

Name: Living with the dead
Description:
Priyanka Harbola/pH62
\nPriyanka Harbola, an imaginative child born in the city of lakes, Nainital grew up to be a strong woman with deep emotions. She post graduated in pharmaceutical sciences and began her career as a teaching professional. Her life’s journey however witnessed quite a few turns. After a short stint as a research scholar, she changed path to become a banker. What didn’t change all along was her passion for writing. A keen observer, her rich experience in life with different people and surroundings helped her in understanding various human emotions. She believes that the world needs literature and philosophy. 
\n A married working woman, she is presently based at Kanpur, UP. You can e-mail her at priyankaharbolaauthor@gmail.com or tweet @pH62
Short description:
When Neil, the lonesome child encounters a shadow in his home, he is terrified. He tries to share his fears with his father, Mridul who is not ready to accept the existence of a ghost in his home. The tormented child struggles to survive while his father is busy finalizing an important business deal.
\n 
\nIt is while working on his official project one night that Mridul realizes the presence of a shadow. He is left aghast and has no option but to believe his son. Things take a turn when the shadow reveals its identity to Mridul who is immediately reminded of his buried past. 
\n 
\nThis is one story that you would have to stay up the night for and feel. It has the thrill of paranormal events, mystery that will keep you wondering, blood rush of a young love, agony of a heartbreak, longing of an unrequited love but more so it has lessons for a lifetime that will change you.

Name: Cosmology and Consciousness: A Comparative Study of Hindu Metaphysics and Physics
Description:
DR. H K SUHAS
\nThe author has a PhD in Aeronautics and had been reading books on various religions and philosophies, as a hobby, more with an interest to know and understand the similarities of thought processes. He has read books by Theosophists and great thinkers and writers trying to understand the convergence of thoughts and the way the societies progress with in the ambit of religious conditioning. The interaction between science and religion has made the writing of this manuscript possible.
\n 
\n He has traveled widely to many countries like Russia, Norway, Sweden, Germany, France, England, USA, Korea, Singapore and Afghanistan as member of delegation and interacted with different people. This has been very helpful in understanding different cultural values and getting also the different perceptions and viewpoints about political affairs.
\n 
\n He retired as Deputy Director General from Government of India in 2008.
Short description:
In whatever way one looks at the current state of Cosmology and Consciousness, one cannot deny that Science is inching intriguingly close to the Hindu view of the Cosmos and Consciousness as put forth or visualized by our sages meditating upon the mystery of life.
\n 
\nClassic examples of Indian knowledge System is the practice of newly married couple sighting the Arundhati and Vashista Stars in the sky and seek their blessings to lead a life without any one dominating the other. In traditional Indian astronomy, pair of Alcor and Mizar in constellation Ursa Major is known as Arundhati and Vashista. In most twin stars system one star is stationary and other rotates around it, while Arundhati and Vashishtha both rotate in synchrony. To tell that both husband and wife must do all things in sync and that husband must not rotate round the wife or wife should not dance to the tune of her husband, this ritual was made a part of the marriage ceremony. The greatness of our ancestors / scholars was that they could know that such a twin star system exists much before the discovery of the telescope.
\n 
\nThe question that is to be asked is, ""How did our ancestors / scholars come to know of the existence of such a pair of Stars that rotated about each other?"" The entire Indian knowledge system has such revelations not only about the Cosmos but also about the Ayurveda medicine, mathematics, building construction technology as is seen in the large temples complexes in India and also in Angkor Wat in Cambodia. Therefore the statement that the ancient Indian scholars did not have a scientific grounding is definitely more an outcome of imperialistic supremacy which was sustained and encouraged by Indians who had a vested interest in following such a path. In fact, the Hindu Philosophy is the only philosophy that gives you the freedom to question even the existence of God. This is considered blasphemy in other philosophies / religions!
Tags: Cosmology and Consciousness: A Comparative Study of Hindu Metaphysics and Physics

Name: The Doctor and the Ghosts
Description:
MANTRI PRAGADA MARKANDEYULU
\nMantri PragadaMarkandeyulu, Bachelor of Commerce (B Com), Diploma in Business Management (DBM), Post Graduate Diploma in Computer Applications (PGDCA), Diploma in Computer and Commercial Practice (DCCP) is the Author and Writer.
\n 
\nHe has written English Lyrics for making fully composed tunes to Songs, around 155 songs (lyrics) + 330 Quotes in English (each Quote is in 8-10 lines). Also, he has written 400 Haiku Poetry. He too has written Hindi Song Lyrics 37 and Telugu Song Lyrics 35 and all are useful and utility for Movies/TV serial purpose and also for making Song and Music Album. 25 Stories in English.
\n 
\nHe is a retired Officer from PSU and a permanent resident of Hyderabad-500062 Dist: Rachakonda, (TS) India. 
\n 
\nHis special ebooks are, (1) ENTANGLEMENTS (consists of 20 short stories in English) (2) MARK’S QUOTES (325 quotes) (3) THE DEAD, DOCTOR AND THE GHOST (For Movie/TV serial purpose) (4) NGO (Systems and Procedures), (5) My Flower to your Heart {Lady Police}, Derailed Mission, My Darling, Wings of Love, Fraudulent Husband, Shattered Affection, What I can do in my life, etc. And other Short stories, What I can do in my life, etc. And other Short stories, all useful for making movies. All useful for making movies. Two Telugu Stories (1) Top Cop Rani, IPS (Telugu) (2) JeevamStory (Telugu) are ready for publishing. English Stories Lady Police and the Dead, Doctor and The Ghost, are useful for Movie making purpose.
Short description:
This is a Scientific-Horror-Thriller-Suspense-Death-Rebirth-Ghosts, Aghoras and Entertainment Story with Looting, Club, Pub, and Horse Race)
\n 
\nScientist Shyam invents a formula medicine. If this medicine as per dose, injects to an immediately dead person, such dead person slowly wakes-up and becomes alive. The power of medicine doesn’t long last than an hour initially. Scientist with the support of a Doctor friend Vishal experiments this medicine on a dead body. This experiment becomes successful. Few Souls, Spirits become Ghosts, Devils, and Satans. All these things create trouble to Doctor Vishal. At the Grave Yard, all sorts of dead body scenes becoming alive and become dead. Booth Bungalow scenes, all Aghoras scenes making nonsense at Grave Yard.
\n 
\n Scientist Shyam will be kidnaped by anti-social elements for ransom. Doctor’s Conference takes place. These ghosts, devils and Satans, loot money from various sources and keep the money in Doctor Vishal’s house.There are scenes like club, pubs, Casanova, horse races, gambling places, hotel scenes, where these ghosts, devils and Satans make nuisance and create trouble to all the people. Traffic signal police also were the victims for these ghosts and devil acts. M. Paul Brunton, an American Journalist experiment on Aghoras, is also seen in this story.
\n 
\nDoctor Vishal leaves Atmakur for one month to Varanasi on pilgrimage. After Doctor Vishal’s return from pilgrimage, entire house scene is changed. Everywhere money in gunny bags, Doctor Vishal surprise, becomes aghast. All the ghosts, devils and Satans create lot of nonsense and trouble. Even at hospital, these ghosts and devils create trouble and nonsense to patients.
\n 
\nScientist is let off free with the Police help. The Scientist invented formula sold to one Pharmaceutical Company. These Souls, ghosts and devils leave the Doctor Vishal, with a view to go back to their Souls World for reincarnation and says good-bye to Doctor Vishal and Scientist Shyam. All the villagers happy. Grave yard shifts to outskirts. Doctor makes his hospital a multi-speciality hospital.Scientist and Doctor perform their daughter’s marriage.

Short description: It Is a Story of A Young, Glamorous, and beautiful Management Student’s Successful Life. Miss Rani Devi, A Look-Alike Princess Nilofour’ Of Hyderabad. Miss. Rani Devi Became Deputy Superintendent Of Police at Central Bureau of Investigation, New Delhi and Rose to the Level of Director General of Investigations at CBI. She Brought To Book Black Money Big Shots From United States at America and United Kingdom (London). When She Was Posted at London, while taking all types of risks. Miss Rani Devi Was Posted at the Prime Minister’s Office as Inspector General, Officer-on-Special Duty [Investigations]. Miss Rani Devi Not Married Yet Due To Career Sake And Very Late Marriage Took Place At Around 36 Years Of Her Age With One Of His Old Class-Mate Mr. Anurag Varma Of The Same MBA College Who Was Very Handsome And Also CEO Of Software Company In India. She Was Blessed With Two Sons And Two Daughters [Each Year Twins]. She Established One Charitable Institution [Ngo] Titled ‘’My Flower to Your Heart’’ For the Less Privileged Children and People. The Dedication, Commitment and Passion to Serve the Country While Improving Her Professional Career Has Made Ms. Rani Devi, a Very Successful Woman in the Country.

Name: An Anglo Indian In Love
Description:
TAPAN GHOSH
\nLife is all about striking a balance. That’s what I do. Balance work with things that excite me. Not that work doesn’t.
\n
\nAn engineer by qualification, my passion for work has driven me to be an entrepreneur, a pioneer in my field and a patent holder as well.
\nBut, as they say, all work and no play makes Jack a dull boy. Very true, because I get bored easily. The adventure seeker in me learnt to fly a plane (I hold a flying licence). The creative side of me seeks expression in writing scripts, some of which have been made into short films.
\n
\nOne of these scripts lost its way and ended up being published as a novel. Friends tell me that there is a bit of me in it. Perhaps! Because, what is creativity but an expression of the creator? And expression comes when you feel the experience, not merely live it.
\nExpression must reach out. And that’s why I am here. To amuse, to entertain, to inspire or merely to strike a chord within you. Of course, I’d be happy if you tick all the boxes. We talked about balance, didn’t we?
\n
\nGod Bless!
\nTapan Ghosh
Short description:
It is said that the memories of one’s growing years form the deepest impressions. Nothing could be truer. In the mid-1950s I spent my early years in Calcutta when the city’s culture was a blend of the colonial times and the first flush of independence. It was an interesting mix which made Calcutta one of the most livable cities in the country. Optimism and hope mingled with old world charm to offer the denizen the best of both worlds.
\n 
\nAs a 10-year old student of the Our Lady Queen of the Mission School referred to in this story, the Anglo-Indians made a big impact on me. Especially the flamboyant sort who rode powerful motorcycles with sexy girls in short skirts riding pillion. As I grew older, this community dwindled in number, as many of them migrated to the UK, Australia, Canada and other places around the world. 
\n 
\n This community was born out of the union of British men and women of Indian origin in early colonial times. This union was encouraged by the rulers to expand their presence significantly. It created for them a workforce for top positions in the railways, missionary schools, customs, excise, posts & telegraph and forest departments and elsewhere. Their control was complete and the Anglo-Indians were more British in their ways than the British themselves.
\n 
\nThis story is about a married Anglo-Indian who falls in love with an Indian boy young enough to be her son. The story also refers to the deep-rooted scar of the white-skin complex left by the Anglo-Indian community which continues to exist to this day. Though a piece of fiction, the story draws heavily from incidents I was witness to during my growing years.
\n 
\nI hope that I have been successful in my attempt. For this story is my tribute to the city I cherish. A place of which I have the fondest of memories. Strange as it may sound, I haven’t had the opportunity to visit it ever since I left it half-a-century ago. I hope both, the city and I, won’t be separated for much longer anymore.
Tags: East India love,India love story,Kolkata,Love story of Anglo-Indian,Romance,Short love story

Name: दादी के बोल सरल, सरस, सहज और गूढ़
Description:
OM PRAKASH NEMANI
\n
\nलेखक का परिचय
\nश्री ओम प्रकाश नेमानी
\n६७२, फर्न्स पैराडाइस ,
\nदोडनकुण्डी,
\nबेंगलुरु – ५६००३७
\n            
\n        श्री ओम प्रकाश नेमानी ने लखनऊ यूनिवर्सिटी में शिक्षा प्राप्त की, उन्हें स्वर्ण पदक से श्री वी. वी.  गिरी, भारत के पूर्व राष्ट्रपति द्वारा सम्मानित किया गया था| वे एक संभ्रांत परिवार से आते हैं| उन्हें जीवन के विभिन्न क्षेत्रों का अनुभव है| वे ८० वर्ष की आयु में भी पूर्ण रूप से स्वस्थ तथा कार्य शील हैं| पिछले ३ वर्षों से उनका संपर्क सदगुरु श्री रमेश जी, पूर्णा आनन्दा आश्रम, हैदराबाद से हुआ और उसने उनके जीवन में क्रन्तिकारी परिवर्तन कर दिया|
\n
\n       अब वे अपना समय, अध्यन एवं पुस्तकें लिखने में व्यतीत करने में, अधिक आनंद का अनुभव करते हैं| उनकी पुस्तकें जीवन के विभिन्न क्षेत्रों में उनके किये गए अनुभवों, घटनाओं तथा प्रचलित कहानियों पर आधारित होती हैं| उनको आध्यात्मिक दृष्टि से कैसे देखा जाये, यह उनकी विषेशता है| 
\n
\n       उनकी एक पुस्तक अंग्रेजी में 'हैप्पीनेस २४/७' प्रकाशित हो चुकी हैं, वह पाठकों द्वारा अत्यंत सराही गयी है| उनकी दूसरी पुष्तक अंग्रेजी में 'कृष्णा दी सुपर कॉन्शसनेस' छप रही है और शीघ्र ही प्रकाशित होने जा रही है|
\n
\n      यह पुस्तक 'दादी के बोल' उन्होंने हिंदी में लिखी है| इसमें उन्होंने कहावतों और मुहावरों द्वारा जीवन की सच्चाइयों को आध्यात्मिक दृष्टि से देखने का अनूठा प्रयास किया है|
\n       उनकी पुस्तकें ऑनलाइन अमेज़न तथा फ्लिपकार्ट आदि पर भी प्राप्त की जा सकती हैं| उनकी ईमेल ompnem@gmail.com है|  
\n
Short description: पुरानी प्रचलित कहावतों और मुहावरों में छुपे हुए आध्यात्मिक तथ्यों को प्रकाशित करना

Name: Handling Alzheimer’s with Courage
Description:
Wg Cdr DP Sabharwal, Veteran
\nWing Commander DP Sabharwal is a man of varied interests. After serving for 25 years, he took voluntary retirement from the Indian Air Force at a young age of 46 to pursue a career of teaching and writing.He is an engineer by training, an aviation-man by profession, a teacher at heart, a motivator and counsellor by instinct and a social worker by choice. 
\n He is a writer by passion, and this is his 40th book, though the first one where he has applied both head and the heart in equal measure to pen down his experiences!
Short description:
Alzheimer’s is a deadly disease that progressively reduces a healthy human-being to a person who becomes absolutely dependent on others for each and every daily-chore before becoming bed-ridden and in the bargain, being reduced to a skeleton. Now if that is a perceived to be a difficult journey, well it is the understatement because the care-givers goes through a journey that is even more arduous and difficult. Seeing your loved one going gown the long dark tunnel, that has no end and no chance of any ray of light or hope, can really be devastating for even the toughest individual.
\n 
\n The author having gone through such a journey for almost 12 years, has penned down his experiences, suggesting various ways and means by which the care-giver can give a ‘dignified life’ to the affected person while maintaining and retaining own sensibilities.

Name: Deep Down and Drizzling
Description:
VEDATROYEE DE GHOSH
\n“But you see, there is a graveyard in my mouth, filled with
\nwords that have died on your lips.” Sugar-coated feelings
\nand estranged emotions is what describes Vedatroyee (De)
\nGhosh the best. A 20-year-old enthusiast who wishes to
\nvoid the world with her raw and praline thoughts. A budding
\nelectrical and electronics engineer at VIT, Vellore, a (about-to-be
\npublished) poet, a space extrovert with dreams of
\ngetting into research in the future. She is also the type of girl
\nwho you would find playing with cats and dogs on the street
\non a lazy Sunday afternoon (or any afternoon, or any time
\nof the day as a matter of fact. They are much better than
\nhumans apparently). Shouldn’t be left unsupervised in a
\nstationary shop. Food, love, music, poetry, aestheticism. Too
\nmuch to ask for? Never, she believes.
Short description:
You are the lip shade,
\nThat I’ve heard rave reviews about from my girlfriends.
\nToxic.
\nSeductive.
\nRuthless.
\nAnd Vain.
\nDeeper scars in my bralette with each piercing.
\nYour poetry, still stuck on my lips,
\nLike the remains of a cold blooded ashtray.
\nYou came, calm-quite-deep, you conquered.
\nNext to the coffee mug, a blue note
\nCold and harsh like morning drizzle,
\nWith a lonely goodbye.
\nI lay on my bedroom floor,
\nRe-reading it,
\nAs the words unreadable, with blood from my hand
\nsmudging it all.
\nWhat if.

Name: OMD! (Oh My Delhi)
Description:
UPASANA SINGHAL
\nI am blessed to have gained good education. Being an average student I managed to excel at board exams in year 12 and studied Literature in college which had also been my ultimate love. I am an ardent reader; it commenced with Enid Blyton, Nancy Drew and Hardy Boys, however I fell head over heels with books when I was introduced to the world of Harry Potter. Till date, despite being older, the writes of J.K. Rowling excites me like no other. I reckon I acquired the love for books from my mother, a Hindi Graduate. 
\nBeing the eldest, I was always looked upon. In spite of my extended conservative family, I was given the opportunities like no other. At the age of 21, I left for Australia to pursue Masters in Tourism – Festival and Event Design and Management. Away from family for the first time, the only person I knew was my shadow. That was the journey of a lifetime. The friendships, the University, the culture and more, I embraced with arms wide open. 
\nToday I look back and wonder, “How did I not know how to use a printer?”
\nI befriended people from different ethnicities and learnt their cultures. Later, as my expenses augmented I decided to lighten my father’s monetary assistance. I commenced my work in the house keeping team at the hostel. In the team of twenty, I made lasting friendships and learnt team work and leardership skills. Later, I worked as a Project Officer at Reconciliation South Australia, my former placement organisation, for three years. Simultaneously I also worked as an Event Assistant at Flinders University. I soon realised I was more capable than I gave myself credit for. In all the years, I gained confidence and was independent unlike before. I made mistakes and worked to rectify them. 
\nToday, I am married and have a son. My former experiences had strengthened me as a partner and a mother. I always teach my child – be kind and have courage, just like Cindrella’s mother. I balance my life precariously, push past obstacles with an omnipresent book in my hand and my baby on my hip.
\nPersistence is the key, along with patience. Ofcourse, I am only human and tend to lose sight, however I come back to my way and work harder to achieve what I strive for. 
\nIn the end, I owe everything to my parents and my brother. It surely sounds cliché, but I’d rather be honest than sugar coat the words and lie to self. 
\n
Short description:
In the celebration of everything public, there is always an undying pang of discovering one’s personal ghosts. Through a sprawling canvas populated by unlikeliest of people and their echoing voices Asmi has always been challenging herself to knots that couldn’t be unknotted. For more than a decade she has cursed her fate for leaving her mother-less and with a woebegone family.  As abysmal kins and unjust life ensnare her, she dreams of leaving the despairing gullies of Lajpat Nagar. Little did she know, her fairy god mother was smirking, twisting her wand mischievously, set to cast a spell to turn her life around. Unsaid, the mediocre are seldom sanctioned to taste the life of affluence. Torn between her coarse edges and Mahi’s soft silks, Asmi emerges from the depth of literary world and inhale the air of the rich. Her delight is short lived as humiliation taunts her presence in the society and forces her to congest into a cocoon. Nevertheless, questioning her right to dignity Asmi stands firm challenging the conceited of Delhi. Are Delhites as rotten as the city?  
\nAlthough soon Asmi realises the houses that aren’t made of glass include more than skeletons in their open closets, waiting to be unleashed.    
\nWhilst thrown in the midst of unexpected relations, Asmi captivates Amin with her unpretentious approach towards life. Admiring Amin’s and Mahi’s comfortable lifestyle she seeks refuge with her new comrades and shuns her father altogether. She also finds solace in Rajee, her childhood companion. One cannot help but wonder, are dysfunctional families a norm in Delhi, concealed behind closed doors and plastered smiles? Was this a prominent rationale for our protagonists to fuel their bond and form a match amidst mismatched society? 
\nDelhi, also known as the city of mayhem, spares none with mercy including our female protagonist who is ambushed and stifled ruthlessly. Amid the atrocities caused by the living and the dead, she is forced to question her existence. Rightly stated, “Happiness is out lived and temporary”, Asmi is left alone and distraught in no time. Deceived and distressed with heart break, she finds haven in subjugated world to evade the gnawing memories of her past.  
\nWill life offer another prospect to mend her broken relations and save the one she strives for? Has setbacks strengthened and prepared her to conquer hindrances and return to her roots? Or will she surrender her broken relations, leaving them be, forever. 
\nIt is a quest of survival of the mediocre. Evidences of dysfunctional self and withered familial ties become a recurring theme throughout the book, much like the fleeing away from and returning back to the sentiment we call love.
\n

Name: Your Hands Are Cold
Description:
RUCHIKA YAMI SHARMA
\nRuchika Yami Sharma is an artist and through her mind, flow beautiful, dazzling thoughts. A poet by nature and a lover by heart, she dives deep into the sea of love. She believes that existence of each woman, like a wildflower, is poetic in itself. She believes in the beauty of the world. Life creates art. And art creates life. 
\n 
\n When she holds a pen, her passion finds a way through her words. And when she holds a brush, the canvas catches her thoughts about a wide range of subjects. She’s an ordinary woman. She has a Master’s degree in Psychology and has worked as a Research Assistant in IIT, Kharagpur. Currently, she lives in India with her inquisitive pet cat working on her next masterpiece. 
\n 
\n She writes what she feels. Nothing is censored or edited. Because she believes everything in nature that is true to itself, is in itself a piece of art.
Short description:
Often we fall in love, sure of ourselves. Of love. In the blinding light of love, we fail to see things for what they are and fill up the blanks with our imagination to create a wonderful masterpiece that is love. As time goes by, the blazing light fades away, leaving us with the realization that who we thought was perfect, was simply close to perfect. The hand that stretched out to take the lover's, slowly retracts back. Not because of imperfection but because of uncertainty. The inability to not see things as they are haunts us. And slowly, even before you can understand, it all disappears. Love is something eternal in the column of lost and found. That's why we love love.
\n This is a tale of an ordinary woman in love. The only difference is there is no beginning or an end. Just like love, it’s a continuum. Her voracious search for love often comes to a hault but never to an end.

Name: Wild Fragrance - A collection of Poems
Description:
GOPAL GUTTAL
\nAfter retiring as a Bombay High Court Justice and practicing as a consultant and arbitrator, Gopal Guttal took to writing poetry as a pastime which soon took a passionate turn. His first collection of poems ‘TWILIGHT MELODIES’ was published in 2014 which was co-authored with his daughter Priya Guttal
Short description:
Some say that every poet is a fool.
\n
\nBut their words prove that every fool is not a poet.
\n
\nThis is a collection of poems which speak of persons, places, human bond and lingering fragrance of yearning songs.
\n
\nA poem is not a collection of words or catalogue of transient events. It is a manifestation of the inner rhythm which rings beyond the obvious.

Name: Kaleidescope of Love - A Collection of Short Stories on Varied Facets of Love
Description:
PRIYANKA BHUYAN
\nHi, I am Priyanka Bhuyan.I have been writing ever since my school days ranging from a variety of articles and short stories in different publications.I have done my Masters in Journalism and Mass Communication from Amity University and currently working in a central PSU I am from the beautiful city of Guwahati.In my free time I love reading, playing badminton and travelling.
Short description: Love, the strongest human emotion to ever exist. But what is love and why are its colour so myriad? Love can range from the purest form of mother’s love to the tragic feeling of unrequited love. And also to the silent love which continues even after it is gone. Love is basically like a kalaidescope and it changes colour in all human relations with time.

Name: The Keepsake - Poems of Longing
Description:
NAYANIKA DEY
\nNayanika Dey is an Indian poetess, and songwriter born on October 29, 1993 in Durgapur, West Bengal, India. She did her Graduation in Accounts and she is currently pursuing Actuarial Science from IAI. She started penning down her thoughts and imaginations when she was 15.
\n 
\n She has bagged the Menzione Poesia Estera (Special Mention Foreign Poet Award) in the Unicef International Prize of Sentieri Diversi II Edition, Bitetto. She is a respected member of “Associazione Culturale Euterpe”, Jesi, Italy and owns the “Emotion Award for Foreign Poetry”.
\n 
\n Nayanika is a Permanent Member of International Writers and Artists Association (Represented at UNESCO), USA, and World Nations Writer’s Union, Kazakhstan and carries the International Diploma of the III Degree “Temirqazyq-The Best Poet- Writer of the World”.
\n 
\n She is a member of the Editorial Board of an international magazine, The Literati Council, India as well as a rank holder of Excellence for brilliant and consistent high standard of workmanship on the basis of Article writing Contest held globally by the same. Nayanika has also been conferred with the award of Poetic Galaxy Award in Mathura International Poetry Festival. She is also a member of Rock Pebbles International Literary Journal, India and owns the title of “Wordsmith Writer” Her poems get translated and songs get sung by artists in different languages across the world. Her poems are published in a number of anthologies and some of them are FCG Naji Naaman’s foundation for gratis culture Year Book of Lebanon, Amaravati Poetic Prism 2017 International Multilingual Poetry Anthology.
\n 
\n She is also a Gold Medallist and the recipient of The Enchanting Muse Award (International Award) and Fellow Of The Regal World Of Scribes (FRWS) in recognition of her valuable contribution for World Literature and Promotion of World Peace and for her legendary services in the field of Literature, Education, Humanity and Spirituality in the “Pentasi-B India World Poetry Festival” as a member of the National Delegation on 12th-16th October 2017 at Ramoji Film City, Hyderabad, organized by Writer’s Corner, Warangal, Telangana, India.
\n 
\n She is a Merit Prize Winner of Naji Naaman Literary prize 2017 (Lebanon) in recognition of the meritorious manuscript “LIBRARY OF PERFUMES” with the coveted title of ""Naji Naaman Literary Laureate"" and the Honorary member of Maison Naaman pour la Culture.
\n 
\n She has also been appointed as the Administrator for World Institute for Peace (Nigeria), West Bengal Branch, West Bengal, India.
\n  Nayanika has been a Delegate at 10th International Poetry Fest-2017, J.K.C College Guntur, AP, Thinkers’ and Writer’s Peace Meet 2018 organized by International Society For Intercultural Studies And Research in association with WCPA, IPPNO (USA).
\n 
\n She believes poetry is peace; it bails the answers untold from the retired cove and poets are remains of illusions, covered in a body of flesh and blood but in a soul of ink and words. 
\n 
\n www.facebook.com/nayanika.dey.9
\n Twitter.com/nayanika_niks
\n Facebook.com/authornayanikadey
Short description:
Nayanika Dey is a Humanist poetess and dwells mostly on the affairs of the human person and society. She concerns herself with drawing attention to both her inner thoughts as well as the happenings in the external world that shape society. For example her writings about peace also mean depicting suffering and the amelioration of the situation perpetuating the pain in the larger society. Peace only can be seen if the disrupting element is removed. She is able to traverse this road in her poetry, capturing peace, and violence and even fear of death playing amongst these themes with the ultimate triumph of producing her chosen subject matter.
\n 
\n -Dr Rashid Pelpuo, Ghana
\n 
\n The Indian poetess; Nayanika Dey has a peculiar style where the writing has a smooth, genial surface and a wide and illuminating deepness with a special poetic element represented by the expressive metaphor.
\n ~Anwer Ghani, Iraq
\n 
\n I am thankful to the modern devices of internet which has joined us in a global chain of fraternity. Obviously Pakistan and India are hostile countries but I found many literary figures who aspire to render their role to lessen tension between both of the countries and live as peaceful people so Nayanika Dey a representative of Indian youth joined me in this mission and we both have been connected poetically father and daughter... I advise the Indian Govt. and concerned other literary organizations to patronize Nayanika Dey properly as she is a gem and must not mix into dust, she is not only the representative of Indian youth but global youth that is worried about the safety and wellbeing of future generations.
\n 
\n ~Muhammad Shanazar, Pakistan

Name: 1959: A Love Story - A Tribute to joint and extended families
Description:
ASHA ANAND
\nA symbol of national integration, Mrs. Asha Anand is a multi-faceted personality. Born in the South of India (Kerala), she did her nursing studies in Bihar, married in the North (Punjab) and now lives in Mumbai, with her husband, children and grandchildren.
\n Mrs. Anand’s writing career began with articles for Eve’s Weekly, Mid-Day, Mumbai Mirror, Reader’s Digest and Women’s Era. Her present memoir is written specially as a tribute to joint and extended families.
\n A story teller with a keen sense of humour, Mrs. Anand is former President of ‘Inner Wheel Club’ of the Rotary Club of Bombay North.

Name: Soul Free
Description:
ANIRUDHA PADAGI
\nAnirudha is a nomad at heart, a soul searcher and in quest for the truth of life. 
\n 
\n He is also a motivator, life coach and mentor. His views of life are drawn from personal experiences and his intuition when he meets people. 
\n 
\n His life experience comes from spending time in France, Germany, amongst Mexicans and Danes
\n 
\n As an occupational hazard he loves selling to enterprises and start-ups. He has completed his Masters In International business from IESEG School of Management, Lille. He is married to an awesome woman - Rashmi and lives with his parents P Dwarakanth & Sumithra in Bangalore. His parents and wife are his inspiration for his quest for higher purpose of life.
Short description:
“I have crossed the oceans
\n                                                                                            Met life’s teachers
\n                                                                                            Met life’s lovers
\n                                                                                            I have met myself”
\n
\nThe soul already knows its destiny and the body is just helping it reach its place. Life is about travelling , meeting your life's lovers, your teachers and finally meeting your self. What better way than letting your soul lead you there. 
\n
\nThis book will take you on a poetic  journey of life experiences of finding love, losing love and discovering your true self. 
\n
\nYou will be able to reach your true-self, your soul and be free - "Soul Free". Soul Free is about feeling alive, free and letting your soul be free from clutches of life.
Tags: Famous poems,Love poems for her,Love poems for him,Love poetry,poems,Poems about life

Name: My Oldest Of Friends
Description:
BALU GEORGE
\nBALU GEORGE is a Chartered Accountant hailing from Cochin. He has been staying in Bangalore for the past 10 years. He has attended the Bangalore Writers Workshop. His works have been published in The Hindu, Literary Yard and Spark.
Short description: This is a collection of poems which are sometimes humorous, sometimes poignant and sometimes philosophical

Name: The Echo Within
Description:
GURUJI NAUSHIR
\nGuruji Naushir is the direct disciple of Mahavatar Babaji, the deathless sage of the Himalayas. Since the year 2000, he started receiving communications from Babaji who has been the constant source of knowledge, guidance and spiritual practices taught under the banner of MBTF. Guruji Naushir has physically met Mahavatar Babaji in the Himalayas in the year 2010 which was the rarest of rare gifts granted by this elusive great sage.
Short description: This book is a compilation of soul provoking wisdom gained by Guruji Naushir from his Guru and follows the insights that started with his first book "Amrit" published in 2014
Tags: Amrit,Babaji,Daily Wisdom,Guruji Naushir,Mahavatar,Self Help,Spiritual 365 quotes,Spirituality,The Echo Within

Name: Fireflies in the Backyard
Description:
PRANJAL HAZARIKA
\nPranjal Hazarika is a Civil servant serving in Government of Delhi presently. His ancestral lineage is from Assam. 
\n 
\n  In his early life, Pranjal had stayed in places like Pasighat and Nampong in Arunachal Pradesh where his father, a Doctor was posted. Thereafter, he grew up in the metropolitan city of Delhi after shifting to Delhi in 1984. He completed his schooling in Delhi, followed by Graduation and Post Graduation from Kirori Mal College, University of Delhi. Thereafter, he obtained his Doctorate degree from Department of Genetics, South Campus, University of Delhi. He got selected to Government Service through the Civil Services Examination in 2006. He also did research as a post doctoral fellow in USA during 2009-2010. 
\n 
\n  Having lived in diversely different places like Arunachal Pradesh, Delhi, USA has enriched Pranjal with verdant and vibrant experiences and observations which have found space in his short stories. His stories are based on human relationships and shades of emotions - love, friendship, empathy, malevolence, passion, betrayal, joy, sadness and so on and the twists and turns that are associated with it. This collection of short stories is his first published work.
Short description: Minoti dreamt of a loving husband. But, battered and violated by her husband, Minoti would occasionally spend hours gazing at fireflies in the backyard…. Jisnu’s father planned to sell off the poultry fowls due to rumours of an epidemic outbreak. Jisnu saves one fowl from selling but is he fully successful? An old Phallus shaped stone structure gets unearthed by Aslam Mian in Bonjuli. This leads to a chain of events that transforms the villagers… Jeenu came to spend few days in Rubul’s house during his summer vacations to enjoy the village life instead, he experiences something else in the dark of the night. Naina meets a Charming boy Vishal in college. She falls in love and develops trust. Does Vishal break her trust? Supriya eloped with Bhaskar few years back and her family broke all ties. But Supriya longed to get accepted back by them… Sujoy adored Abhimanyu as ‘Mr Popular’ from school days. Years later, Sujoy meets Abhimanyu. Does Abhimanyu retain the same old charm? Arun met Meghna in US and love blossomed. Meghna marries someone else. After a few years she contacts Arun. How does he react? A truck driver loved his newly wedded beautiful wife. He remains away from home for months leaving his wife at home. During an unplanned visit to home, he witnesses something shocking. On a vacation stay, Neel finds that his friend and his wife have a workable and practical approach to their marriage. Manjusha, a Ph.D student fall in love with her professor, Robert. But when Robert’s ex flame comes into their life, what happens?  Fireflies in the Backyard is a collection of short stories with vivid shades of emotions associated with relationships and twists and turns that are associated with it.

Name: Two Leaves In Autumn
Description:
VATSAL SHARMA
\nVatsal Sharma is a young, upcoming poet and author who writes masterfully in English and Urdu. He has been mesmerising and impressing his readers for a few years now with his wordplay and skill around the languages. His maiden collection of poems in English is a testament to love which throws all the conventions out the window as an 18 year old sets words in a way that they play a beautiful and sometimes haunting harp with your heartstrings.
Short description:
So, here I give back to you, 
\nPromises of the evenings."
\n
\nAn account of love so real and yet so dreamy that it captivates the readers through their journey and leaves them spellbound after they turn the last page. Written with masterful wordplay, every single poem comes alive as one reads it.

Name: Summary of Bhagavad Gita
Description:
Vysakh Jayakrishnan
\nAuthor may be contacted at
\nEmail @ jaivmenon@gmail.com
\nmailto:vysakhjayakrishnan@gmail.com
Short description:
This book is written after the author reading the original Bhagavad Gita. Apart from the usage of certain examples that relate Gita to the current era and some interpretations regarding those examples, nothing new is added from outside. 
\nThe motive behind this writing venture is to present Bhagavad Gita to a reader who is not well aquatinted with religious books or spirituality. Gita is retold here with utmost care given to preserve its original flow and simplicity. Extreme vigilance is shown in keeping away heavy spiritual words like individual consciousness, universal consciousness, transcendental opulence etc.
\nThe Summary of Bhagavad Gita is intended to be read in one sitting. It contains less than eighteen thousand words only. 
\nThe book may entertain you or it may bore you. But it will never confuse you.

Name: Sins Of Gods - Warriors of Dharma
Description: Dr Chandranshu Chaudhary \n \nDr Chandranshu Chaudhary is a Surgeon. He has deep interest in Indian Mythology. He did his schooling from Sainik School Tilaiya,Jharkhand. He passed MBBS from GMCH Gauhati and MS (General Surgery) from AMC Dibrugarh. His father played significant role in shaping his love for mythology. It is his second and last of the series Warriors of Dharma; his first novel. His first book was widely appreciated and remained best seller in its genre for many months.
Short description: We have been told that Duryodhan was responsible for Mahabharat; but was he really responsible? When sons of Satyavati died childless she fearing the passing of throne back to Bhishma decided to do something unthinkable and immoral. She called her eldest son born out of a brief encounter with Sage Parashar. She asked him to make the widows of her son pregnant. It didn't go very well with the subjects,Generals and nobles of the court. Bhishma remained silent. But deep inside he was hurt. He decided to avenge his insult. He vowed to end the lineage of Satyavati completely.

Name: When The Going Gets “ROUGH”
Description: Mandar Chitre \n \nIt should be a continuation of the cover page crossing over with an inset of the following text& about the author \nWe all know that when the going gets tough, the tough get going. However what would happen when the going gets “ROUGH.” Rough is much worse than tough because it has involvement of criminals & terrorism. This is not just a work of fiction, but a guide book of survival in the world full of rough situations, without us turning into rough individuals. \n \n
Short description: The Author, Mandar Chitre is a creative person & a business professional with over two decades of corporate experience. He is an engineer by profession with addition of business management, marketing, law & indirect tax diplomas. Mandar also spends his time with students as a visiting faculty in MBA colleges.
Tags: 9789388573429,BecomeShakespeare,Don't jump to comclusion,Fiction,Mandar Chitre,When the going gets rough

Name: Love At First Print - Life Teaches, Love Reveals
Description: Tushar Khurana \n \nTushar Khurana has completed five diverse internships in his career. In comparision he has also survived an year in the retail industry. He has been a story-teller since his childhood. Most of these stories are elaborated and tweaked versions of incidents from his own life. Family always comes first for him. He also composes poetry but only for his close loved ones on their special occasions. Next year he is not only debuting as an author but also beginning a new chapter in his career.
Short description: The most crucial element of this book is Relationships. A perfect relationship can be formed between two imperfect individuals. Everyone carries some past baggage. There is no person sans any flaws. A strong bond is established by sharing that baggage and admiring those flaws. Meet Ishaan Agarwal. Tag alongside him as you get introduced to his best friends, his ex-college girlfriend, his casual-fling from coaching days, his high-school crush, a CEO without a name, a broad-chest head-bouncer, two tech-savvy entrepreneurs, a quirky-psychic artist, an adorable bride-to-be, an uber-cool watch and a rich-spoilt brat. This list is endless yet incomplete. At the crux of this story lies the most crucial character which can only be found inside this book. You eventually meet her in some chapter, but Ishaan met her via a printed sheet of paper. \n

Name: SECRET OF THE HIMALAYAN TREASURE
Description: DIVYANSH MUNDRA \n \nThe author is a 22-year old perennial dreamer who has been engaged in a perpetual war with words for a better part of his life. Like every 22-year old living in the 21st century, his journey began with a borrowed laptop, a slow internet connection, and a pretty boring life carefully studded with gems of existential crises on Monday mornings. \n \nHe started out by writing on the world’s biggest Q&A website called Quora; where other equally bored 22-year olds found a connection with his writings, leading him to amass the trust of over 40000 followers and more than 11-million viewers. \n \nThe author is a self-proclaimed specialist at writing fictional crossovers (a genre he proclaims to have invented), where he narrates what would happen if a beloved fictional character from one universe was to meet someone from another. Many of his fictional-crossovers, mostly featuring Sherlock Holmes, have gone viral online, garnering him immense praise and extensive hate equally; which is a perfect balance to maintain for your works on the internet. \n \nWhen empty inboxes greeted him in response to his proposals to the publishers and literary agents, he decided to self-publish his debut novel on the internet at the age of 21, which became a Bestseller on the twelfth day of its release and spent time in Amazon India’s ‘Top 10 Selling’ and ‘Hot & New Releases’ lists. A year later, the same book is resting comfortably in your hands and being read by the most awesome person in the universe. \n \nThe author spends his time experimenting with various writing styles when not running a fiction blog which has pulled readers from over fifty countries. He can be found writing Sherlock Holmes short-stories, fan-fiction, Honest Trailer reviews, first-person observational comedy pieces, and fantastic battle scenes when he gets time from binge-watching TV series. He is a cinephile, loves photography, likes to discuss world news and fashion trends with equal interest, and admires retiring to his solitude with an old dusty book of fiction and a cup of black coffee… with two sugars. \n \n
Short description: THE OLDEST SECRET SOCIETY OF INDIA. THE GREATEST TREASURE IN THE HISTORY OF MANKIND. THE MOST EPIC MYSTERY OF THE ANCIENT WORLD. \n \nWhen the richest man of India confesses to being part of a secret society in a live press conference; chaos ensues. His daughter Aanya Vashishtha takes the help of Aarav Kohrrathi, a brilliant but egoistic treasure hunter and his friend Rehann to solve the mystery of The Ring of the Seven, a society of influential men who are tasked to protect the greatest treasure in history. What starts off as a quest to uncover her father’s secret leads them to something bigger which they themselves couldn’t have fathomed. They take the help from her father’s associate, Shayna Maheshwari, a billionaire banker and someone herself involved with the secret, as they progress towards a treasure hidden somewhere in the Himalayas. \n \nThey brave bullets, puzzles, deadly chases, cult of assassins, and betrayal as their quest takes them across the length and breadth of South Asia; from the bustling metropolises of Mumbai and Delhi to the ancient temples of Nepal; from the serene beaches of Sri Lanka to the towering mountains of the Himalayas. They try to uncover a set of secret books of lost arts, which are believed to reveal the map of the treasure, and strive to discover the identities of the masters of the Ring of the Seven to solve the penultimate mystery. \n \nIn a tale of love and loss, logic and emotions, religion and history, action and adventure, and the trial of a few good men against the most powerful organization in the history of mankind. Will they find the secret of the Himalayan treasure?

Name: मैं सतत प्रसन्न हू1 प्यार इसका राज           और  ज्ञान इसका संबल है
Description:
ओम प्रकाश नेमानी
\nOm Prakash Nemani was born on 5th September 1936, in Kanpur and is a graduate in commerce. He  graduated from Lucknow University. He was awarded Gold Medal and Chancellor’s Medal by Shri V.V. Giri. Former President of India.                                     He started his career as a Probationary officer in State Bank of India.  He left the job after five years of service and started his own manufacturing unit. He is widely travelled and has vast experience of various fields of business.
\nSince last 3 years he has come in touch with Sadhguru Rameshji and is moving ahead on his journey on the path of spirituality. Nemani considers him a common man just like you. He is keen and eager to explore and unlock the secrets of constant happiness. 
\nHe can be reached via his face book page or via email at ompnem@gmail.com.
Short description:
मनुष्य में अद्भुत शक्ति है, वह रो भी सकता है और हँस भी सकता हैI परिस्थितियाँ तो निर्माण होती हैं, उनका प्रभाव पड़ता है परंतु उनका कितना प्रभाव उस पर पड़े यह मनुष्य स्वयं नियंत्रित कर सकता हैI सतत प्रसन्न रहना एक कला हैI यह कला हर व्यक्ति को आती है, परंतु हम विस्मित हो गए हैंI हम अपना स्वरूप भूल गए हैंI
\nयह पुस्तक आपको अपने मूल रूप में स्थापित करने का प्रयास है; जिसके द्वारा आप सतत प्रसन्न रह सकते हैंI कोई भी परिस्थिति आपको विचलित नहीं कर सकती है; यह अहसास आपको सदैव रहे; यही मेरी कामना हैI मेरी अन्य पुस्तकें अंग्रेजी में ‘हैप्पीनेस 24/7’, ‘कृष्ण दी सुपर कॉन्शसनेस’ और हिंदी में ‘दादी के बोल’ भी आप पढ़ें और लाभान्वित हों; यह अपेक्षा रखते हुए आपके सहयोग के लिए धन्यवादI
\n
Tags: मैं सतत प्रसन्न हू1 प्यार इसका राज और ज्ञान इसका संबल है ",ओम प्रकाश नेमानी

Name: DIVYASTRA
Description:
NIMISH BIPIN TANNA
\nHaving authored his debut novel ‘Moments of Truth’ in 2014, Nimish has managed to juggle the pressures of his full-time work commitments, migrating to a new country and starting life all over again in order to find enough time to complete his second book – ‘Divyastra’.
\nNimish has been invited at various colleges & institutions viz. IBS Mumbai, ITM Business School, K.J.
